Name: leuchtstoff - Kaffeebar und Bakery
Summary: Cozy couches & hip music selections in a busy coffee shop known for cinnamon rolls & vegan pastries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['I love this place! They have amazing coffee and great vibes. The food is also nice.\n\nJust a tip though: do not order their cold brew. It’s a massive rip off. it costs five euros and is probably 100ml of coffee in the tiniest glass you’ve ever seen.', 'i have been here many times and the coffee tastes different each time. sometimes great, sometimes not', "Coffee and croissants were tasty. I can't rate the sandwiches unfortunately: I asked the staff if they could make me a sandwich leaving out one ingredient as i am pregnant. The lady said no, they were too busy...it was 9 o'clock on a Saturday, there were three other customers in the room, two staff members behind the counter doing nothing, chatting away and one guy in the kitchen - very disappointing!"]

Name: Asude Yemek Dünyası
Summary: Generously portioned homestyle Turkish dishes like grilled meat platters in a buzzing eatery.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 AM – 1:00 PM, 2:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
["My favourite halal restaurant in Berlin. Went there multiple times , and haslama (not in this photo review) is my favourite

Although speaking in English is sometimes challenging but they've big monitors displaying ffoodphotos & name7s make it easier.

It is one of the most busiest restaurants in the street, so you might have to be in queue if it's peak hour'.

Services and food are too good with tea on the house.
We tried the 59th menu. As for the desert, earlier we tried bakalava and kenefa (which is very demanding).

Transportation is very much accessible with U8 & S-bahn are very close to walking distance and bus halltestelle just one block away.

The only downside to me is that they don't accept the card if the total amount is less than 10 euro.", 'Everything is better than perfect, you do no need to pay too much money as others. It’s marvellous. Love it ❤️ Also Turkish is at your service ❤️❤️❤️', 'This place reminds you a local turkish restaurant. They have food of the day or you can order different type of grill dishes. It never disappoints.

Food portions are quite big and price is good.

We have tried their lahmacun, kuru fasulye, grilled chicken and kofte sandwiches. All are very tasty and fresh. They serve cacik sauce or salad with all dishes. Both are also super yummy.

We come here again and again, so highly recommended.']

Name: Pho Phan
Summary: Vietnamese pho noodle soups, spring rolls & Thai curries at a stylish place with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['Super nice restaurant. The food is delicious and at reasonable prices. The waiters are also really friendly. I go there often as it is in my street and I’ve never been disappointed with the quality. I would highly recommend :) (also they are super fast for lunch breaks)', 'Great place to grab a bite of Vietnamese food in Neukölln. Close to the Hermannstraße station, it’s very convenient to find this amazing restaurant. First time coming here and I’m immediately hooked. The food is so good! I really loved my order of glass noodles with egg and veggies it was really well put together and all the other small dishes we got was also good!\n\nI really recommend trying this place out, hidden gem in Neukölln. Absolutely will be back again especially the staff, so friendly and they such a lovely smile.', 'The service was not the most attentive and food good but rather average. The veggie variety is quite nice and the staff actually followed me down the street when I left without the food I was taking to go. That was very sweet. Interior also pretty but that was it really']

Name: Mira Restaurant
Summary: Casual fixture serving globally inspired breakfasts, including simits, bagels, pancakes & smoothies.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
['We stopped in here for breakfast, and in all honesty we really couldn’t have selected in more fitting establishment. We had the farmer – breakfast, and the vegan breakfast, which was served to us with one bread and simit each. we also got the Biscoff pancakes, and everything was served with a healthy portion of fruit. Service at this place was excellent staff friendly, and if you come here you’re even in for a chilly surprise… We spent about €20 per person on an admittedly lavish brunch. 10/10.', 'Cash only eatery that was absolutely amazing. Insanely great prices and so many options to choose from. Superb coffee, and the food that was delivered was so fresh and tasty. In our visit to Berlin it will be hard to not just come here for breakfast each day!', 'This is by far the best kebap place we have been in Germany.

Their kebaps are very tasty and service is also very good. Portion is very big, if you are nit very hungry, 1 dish is also enough.

We have tried many dishes (Yogurtlu Kebap, Beyti Kebab, Chicken Shish Kebap, Meze platters, Grilled vegetable salad) and everything was good all time.

They give salad and meze plate as a starter before your main dish comes. They also give tea and baklava in the end.

Whenever we want to eat kebap, we always come here.']

Name: Anh Em Restaurant
Summary: Unassuming eatery fixing up Asian staples including bao burgers, sushi, noodle dishes & pho.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['Asian Fusion dishes in a rustic-chic Vietnamese setting. The owner is super nice and friendly. Sushi was fresh!
My recommendations,
✨Summer roll with Shrimp: 5.9€
✨Pulled Chicken Bao Burger: 14€
✨Beef Pad Thai: 14€
✨Sushi Menu for 2: 38€
✨Red Sun Cocktail: 7€', 'Huge menue with diverse Asian options. The starters are magical, the different non-alcoholic drinks were delicious and came with great, fresh garnish. The main courses also convinced us to make Anh Em our new go-to spot for fresh, tasty, healthy food at Hermannstraße.
Very suitable for any group of vegans, vegetarians and omnivores 😀', 'Went there for lunch because of their ratings and it was very good. Had a veggie curry with peanut sauce and all tasted fresh and well spiced. I loved their menu as it contains the story of the restaurant and the two brothers that own it. Stuff was super friendly. It’s loud if you did outside because of the street but nice ambience inside. I will come back as there is a lot to discover on their menu!']

Name: Ristorante Firenze
Summary: Classic Italian pasta & seafood in an elegant room with wall murals & floor-to-ceiling wine shelves.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['We come here often for their delicious menu. The food is fresh and tasty. The service is premium. They are kind and helpful for selections both for food and beverages. The price is quite reasonable. It is spacious for larger groups. Reservation is needed in advance. It must be visited at least once or twice a month. Recommend.', '3 stars for the food: the mixed appetizer (cold cuts basically) was by far the best dish. The caprese appetizer had good mozzarella but tasteless, small tomatoes that hadn’t ripened. Both pasta dishes were mediocre. The Tagliatelle Firenze: under seasoned, tomato sauce wasn’t good and the beef was over cooked and chewy. The tortellini were just ok, supermarket quality. The restaurant does offer a decent selection of Italian wines, which is nice, but the food needs quite a bit of improvement. The reason I’m giving this restaurant 4 stars is the cozy atmosphere and relatively low prices. Otherwise, definitely not the best Italian restaurant in Berlin. Just a place to have a glass of wine with some Italian style tapas on the side.', 'Amazing italian food, good prices and the treatment is great. I had truffle pasta and I really recommend it.']

Name: LA PAZ
Summary: Colorful venue with a terrace, offering burritos, enchiladas & classic tequila cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['The restaurant has a nice environment, with both indoor and outdoor sections, and good music inside. In terms of price, eating with friends would be a better deal because I ordered a few glasses of wine, so it seemed more expensive, but the food portions were adequate. The waiters here are very friendly.\n\nThere was a little situation when paying, but the waiter was very nice and the other customers were kind enough to help, which made me impressed', 'Visited this in my birthday. I had some pasta and it was delicious! The waiter was super nice and he even gave me a shot for free!', 'If you know and like Mexican food, this is not it. If anything is more Tex-Mex, but not even that. We order two different dishes, and both had the same in common; like eating meet with no flavor, with very big chunks of vegetables in a tomato salse soup. And to top of, price is ridiculous for what you get. This is no way anything near Mexican food.']

Name: Louis Café-Restaurant
Summary: Long-standing, retro-style dining room for Austrian classics, including massive schnitzels.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['One of the best spots in the neighborhood. Nothing fancy, just good beer and delicious home-cooked food. The "normal" schnitzel is far too big, but the small portion and the veal schnitzel are much better, in my opinion.', "Walked from our hotel to the Louis-Cafe restaurant and didn't regret it.  Very friendly staff and the restaurant was quiet for lunch.  We chose an outdoor table in the shade and the light breeze made the temperature perfect.

We ordered the schnitzel (the big one😁) and it lives up to is name.  I'm a big eater and didn't finish half of it.   My wife and son ordered the chicken in mushroom sauce and it was great also.  We also ordered salads, but I missed the opportunity for pictures...

This cafe is definitely worth the walk and I'll be back here the next time in Berlin to try that schnitzel again", 'Unfortunately, this was not the schnitzel i was expecting. Upon touching it with the fork the crust was just falling off. Maybe the pork one would taste better. The classic wiener one was just bad (to put it simply). Sad 😔

Spent almost 30eur for schnitzel and 2 beers - was left disappointed to say the least']

Name: Cafe Rix
Summary: Laid-back cafe-restaurant in a converted dance hall with gilt-framed mirrors & freshly baked cakes.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ['Soup was amazing, the dishes were big and super tasty.\nWaitress was nice unfortunately she was a bit flooded with customers. Nevertheless she did a good job.\nWe discovered this hidden gem over Neo and we will definitely come back!', 'Giving 2 stars just because of the interior but very bad service. The waitress at the bar was very much disinterested in serving us. She looked very busy in some sort of paperwork. Also, be mindful that the place is not very hygienic for example. Our spoons with the coffee were picked from the dirty uncleaned basket of utensils and quickly washed off and kept on the plate. Disgusting !', 'Historic building hidden from the busy street just next to the metro station. Visited by locals rather then hipster expats. Traditional breakfast buffet on the weekend from 10 to 14-15, with simple but tasty and varied offerings. Coffee is not special but quiet good.']

Name: Vux
Summary: Understated place with a wall of framed pictures, making vegan cakes, waffles & light meals.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['Always love visiting Vux, their vegan cakes are some of the best in Berlin. My favourite I’ve had there is the lemon meringue pie, but the cheesecake I tried last time was also super good - I think I ate the whole thing in one minute. The iced matcha was also lovely. Their savouries are also excellent if you’re looking for lunch, I particularly like the bao buns.', 'This is a super cute vegan cafe. The bagels were delicious, we got the seitan and the sun dried tomato chickpea. It was so hard to choose which cake to try, they all looked so amazing… but I went with the struesel and it was very good. Coffee was excellent as well. We will come again next time we’re in Berlin!', 'Lovely calm atmosphere with friendly staff. Amazing vegan cheesecake and cinny buns.  Coffee great too.\nRichtig coole Musik!!']

Name: Villa Rixdorf
Summary: Meaty Berlin specialties, plus pizza & salads, in an 1870s villa with a shady beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Delightful place -  a little oasis.  Excellent service very quick, attentive and helpful.  Food was fabulous and all so reasonably priced.  Had the veal schnitzel with side vegetables and apple strudel from dessert.  Definitely go back', 'Great German experience with an extensive menu and many beer options.
Had the crispy pork and the eggplant gratin, both absolutely delicious. Fair prices, big portions and good service.
Definitely would recommend trying', 'I was here more than ten years ago and couldn’t quite remember the address. But thanks to a geolocated photo from all those years ago, I found it again.
I ordered a portion of Eisbein with a  hefeweizen. It was a splendid meal and a splendid location (once again).
I couldn’t nearly eat all of it, so I got a doggy bag with me.
The service was exceptional good.']

Name: Café Botanico
Summary: Garden-to-table Italian cuisine in a cozy, lively cafe & bistro with a lush garden terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['This place is a true gem. Not only the food was extremely good, but the service was amazing. Dishes are made simple but really tasty and home made. They use herbs and products from their local garden which makes everything more sotenable. Do not miss out on visiting the garden, such a lovely place to have a drink before your dinner. And the waitresses there were all extremely lovely and careful with our allergies inquiries. Many vegan options, all of them delicious 😋 The burrata is one of the best I have ever tried and the vegan pasta was sooo good!', 'Wonderful hidden gem with a nice garden in Berlin! Excellent Italian food, with a lot of fresh greens and fresh herbs. Lovely helpful\nstaff and great service. Highly recommended!', "I’ve visited here three times with my boyfriend, and we consider it the best restaurant in Berlin. It's a humble and cool place with its own vegetable garden. Unlike many fine dining restaurants, their food is not pretentious but genuinely honest. Despite this, each menu item is crafted with care and a high level of quality. The cozy atmosphere makes us want to return again. :) Personally, I enjoy the antipasti menu and the meat dishes. The tiramisu is the best! 😊"]

Name: Jemenitisches Restaurant
Summary: Intimate eatery offering classic Yemeni plates & slow-cooked meats in a brick-walled dining area.
Opening Hours: Monday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Food was really delicious and it came very fast we order something called henez “حينيذ" and it was really well cooked and the meat tasted great. Also the rice was amazing. We also ordered white beans which was okay. Make sure to order their bread as it is very very good.', 'Went here for dinner with two friends and we really enjoyed our delicious meal. We sat in the floor seating area, which had cushions and was perfect to relax in after devouring our meal. I recommend coming here for delicious food, large portions, good prices, and low key ambiance 🫶🏼🇾🇪

PS I love the cute table covers. Very creative 💮', "The bread was a little too dense for my taste but it's freshly made and has nice charred marks.

The okra dish was ok, missing the punch.

The rice is flavorful and fluffy.
The lamb was fall of the bone and the star of our visit.

The lemon mint juice was amazing, with a shot of sparkling water it was even better.

I will definitely come back to try the roast chicken with red colored rice. That seemed to be the most famous dish when I looked across the resteraunt.

You have to order and pay upfront at the desk.

The food came suuuuper fast. It arrived even before the drinks."]

Name: Fleischerei
Summary: Meat dishes with a creative global twist, plus Austrian wines, in a shabby-chic former butcher shop.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ['The white wine is good, the taste of steak was okay, nothing special, could be better for this money, the place is overpriced but cute (if we will not count the view to road reconstruction). Also please pay attention to the serve of wine, the customer should see the bottle. The service is great, quick and nice waitresses.', 'Steaks perfectly cooked and delicious. The vegan miso cabbage dish was a flavour explosion as well.\nThere were some issues with our service, the kitchen lost our mains order and we had to rush to eat the luscious steaks in under 10 minutes. Due to a show. There was also some lacks in knowledge but it was so yummy we will be back and hope for a smoother ride.', 'One of my favorite local spots in Berlin. Great service, excellent food and lively atmosphere. All the steak cuts are top notch and the selection of sides are equally tasty. I recommend the asparagus soup when it’s in season.']

Name: Gugelhof
Summary: Classic dishes like potato pancakes & pork knuckle in a homey room with wood accents.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Service a bit confused but good in the end.
****
Food was over expectations, portions could have been a bit bigger. Food reasonably priced.
*****
Outdoor venue was ok - lots of space and seats. With a great corner view of Kollwitzstr.
****

Would come here again. 👌', 'The food was a bit simple. My rösti was basically a bit like a full English breakfast. big hashbrown with eggs and bacon. The bacon was really nice. Felt a bit pricy at €18.', 'Very good cod, very good pheasant, schnitzel ok, choucroute I guess you have to love it. Very good desserts. Wines good. Professional service. Absolutely recommendable']

Name: I due forni
Summary: Casual Italian restaurant serving pizza, pasta, beer & wine in a cozy, brick-lined space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['The place has a vibe and food is prepared fast, with big portions and tastes amazing. However service can be faster and waiters can pay more attention to smaller groups as well. Otherwise very good restaurant and definitely recommend the house wines!!!!!', 'Amazing location, with great pizzas. The service was super friendly and we enjoyed our time on the terrace during a warm Berlin summer night. Wonderful place to gather with a larger group and have great value for your money! Especially in the area it is a great launching point for your night.', "Suitable for a team event, a small dinner or anything in between.
The seafood pasta is always worth it, as is the tiramisu and I've never had a bad pizza here.
Sometimes the kitchen is a bit busy but even so you won't have to wait too long.
Great for takeout too"]

Name: Dark Restaurant Berlin
Summary: Restaurant with a softly lit bar & a completely dark dining room, so diners use non-visual senses.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Ever wondered what it's like to dine in complete darkness? Such intriguing dining concepts are becoming increasingly popular worldwide. This DarkRestaurant offers a dining experience shrouded in complete darkness, served by visually impaired waitstaff. The prospect was intriguing, yet no amount of anticipation could truly prepare me for the depth of the experience that lay ahead. In this environment, "utter darkness" means the absence of all light, making it impossible to see anything at all.

Upon our arrival, the hostess warmly greeted my date and me, taking our coats and presenting a menu that outlined meal types rather than specific dishes—poultry, seafood, beef, or vegetarian options, with a selection of drinks. I opted for the vegetarian, and my date chose beef. We were then led by our blind server, Heedi, in a conga line fashion into the pitch-black dining area, a journey that set the stage for an evening unlike any other.

Seated and acquainted with our surroundings through touch—silverware, glasses, and more—courtesy of Heedi's guidance, we awaited our meal. The palpable darkness soon unsettled us, a feeling exacerbated by the inability of our eyes to adjust or find light. To distract from the discomfort, we engaged in conversation.

The meal began with bread that, to my discerning palate, immediately felt unworthy of indulgence. A playful moment ensued when my date, attempting to lighten the mood, inadvertently launched a piece of crust into my eye. Despite the mishap, we navigated the challenges of sharing dishes and experiencing the meal without sight, which proved messy yet enlightening. Our main courses arrived, and though my initial impression was of a simple salad, I was actually enjoying a complex dish of lime-marinated beetroot with a mint topping, a discovery that underscored how much sight influences taste.

This dining-in-the-dark experience taught us valuable lessons about the reliance on visual cues in culinary enjoyment and the profound impact of sight on our dining experiences. Despite the average quality of the meals, the unique environment made for a memorable evening, though not one we're likely to repeat. The experience served as a reminder of the importance of sight and the intriguing ways in which its absence can alter perception, conversation, and even the ambiance of a meal. Dining in the dark offers a one-of-a-kind experience that goes beyond food to challenge and enlighten the senses in unexpected ways.', "I absolutely adored the experience and the atmosphere! The employees were super nice and friendly. The food was great and having the option of being surprised which meal you'll get is awesome. I loved the live music show as well. It was a wonderful time and I can't wait to revisit!", 'It was a funny and peculiar visit and interesting to experience how your senses compensate when one is disabled. That being said, overall the visit was disappointing. The food was sub-standard, the atmosphere was like a factory where focus was on squeezing as many guests as possible through the production line. We never felt welcomed nor appreciated as patrons.

Conclusion: Been there, done that! Won’t repeat!']

Name: Lucky Leek
Summary: Elevated vegan tasting menus with organic wines in a bright, airy space with a plant-filled terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["Food was excellent. It was delicious, innovative and definitely premium. The server was charming, knowledgeable about the food and genuinely on her game. The drinks were great (we ordered mocktails and they were delicious). I had the 4 course meal, and my wife had the 3 and we shared. It was perfect. With the drinks and tip, it ended up being around 130 bucks.

I would recommend paying cash as there was a mix up with the payment system with my card and the manager on duty was not very professional. Luckily, I had the chance to speak with the chef and she was very understanding and sorted everything out immediately.

On a separate note, this place is NOT child friendly. It's a date place, not a family place. This is an important thing to note.", "Good to see this level of a more premium restaurant being vegan. We loved it - decent food, the 'cheese' plate perhaps being the highlight and left pretty full after 3 courses. I've seen other reviews re service and on our visit it was spot on. Genuine class", "The restaurant is vegan and it's good to get the 3 courses (entree, main dish and dessert). The place is cozy and the staff is friendly. The entree was a very tasty soup and the dessert was amazing, the main dish was a bit spicy for my taste. It's a very good vegan restaurant, I highly recommend it."]

Name: Aromi e Sapori - Restaurant & Weinbar
Summary: Elegant Italian option with sidewalk tables, offering wine & familiar favorites like pasta.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Might have become my favorite italian place. Food was delicious, generous portions - great atmosphere.
Need to come back soon to try more things on their menu!
Carpaccio was fab, Carbonara and the ragu/burrata pasta as well. Tiramisu was great👍🏽', 'Super good pasta, very good servings.
Ravioli was amazing and the pasta carbonara as well.', 'Wonderful food, wine, and atmosphere. Typical italian restaurant with a small but very nice selection of dishes.
We took the fish platter for two and the cannoli. Wonderful sicilian wine selection.  Highly recommended when in Berlin.']

Name: Khushi
Summary: Samosas, pakora fritters, tandoori & curries at a cozy Indian place with a sidewalk terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Probably my new favourite Indian restaurant in Berlin. Food was excellent, I loved the mixed pakoras! We also had chicken sabji which was alright but wouldn’t order again. The real discovery was the shahi baingan, aubergines with soft cheese, cashews. Lovely. The sauce was perfect to dip the amazing batura in. Wish I had another stomach to try the naan but will do next time! Staff was very polite and attentive. I also appreciated the sober ambience for an Indian restaurant. Super clean too.', 'True taste of Indian food. Variety of starters with an interesting combo of sauces( chutney). Tasty 😋. Enjoying the real taste of Indian food. Mango 🥭 lassi give the feel of Punjab ❤️ in Berlin 🇩🇪. Overall : Quick service, delicious food, clean and hygiene atmosphere.', "First, the basics. It's in a great area with a lot of dining options. A LOT. The pricing and variety were great. Outdoor seating was comfortable. Indoor seating is as well and quite large and well decorated. Clean bathroom as well. I dined on the mid day mittag menu and a soup and salad is served with it along with a crispy bread and selection of sauces which were fun to try. Happy about finding some real spicy flavours that are often hard to find in Germany. There is a full bar as well as plenty of selection for non alcoholic drinks.\nThe first server we encountered was not kind and not interested in our business. He was too aggressive with his tone and his demeanour was dismissive and cold. The younger one was quite nice. The food came out quick but not too quick. It all tasted 3.5 out of 5 stars. The problem is this.. Their idiot tough guy who was the first server was so rude and uncomfortable with us that we couldn't shake that feeling of not being wanted. THEN, and have picture to PROVE, I found a black human hair in my chicken madras. Very irritating especially after having eaten most of it already. There is no reason for hair in food if you make everyone entering a kitchen wear a hair net. Just like you should wear gloves when preparing foods. So, all put together, I feel I'm being generous. I've worked with food in professional kitchens. I know. I'll go back to try the service and food quality again. If it's still the same I will be bringing this to 2 stars which would be a shame."]

Name: PAPPA E CICCIA
Summary: Modern, minimal setting for elevated Italian dishes with ingredients like truffles & octopus.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Great ambience and service is good. I felt the place is surely make sense when you go as a couple. Good place for a date night. Drinks are a bit on the pricey side but they are good. Food tastes yummy too.', 'Great Place!
Family Business!
Really good Pasta, and i usually have trouble eating Pasta in Restaurants, because i love to Cook them myself.
Nice staff and good atmosphere', 'We stumbled across this restaurant while walking around Berlin. We didn’t have a reservation but they were able to get us in. We sat at a small high top table behind the host stand and it was perfect (the chairs were very comfy for high top chairs).

The food was great! My husband got a truffle butter pasta that was amazing and I got a red sauce pasta. We had a great time and loved the atmosphere.']

Name: Café Chagall
Summary: Russian dishes & drinks presented in a dark, dramatic interior space or on a sidewalk patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
['Wonderful hidden restaurant that we stumbled upon by chance.

The indoors have a Gothic medieval theme, with old benches and tables and candle lights. Loved the ambience and the vice.

Music is nice, service is friendly and prompt. Great selection of beers.

We orders the chicken schnitzel which was nice and crispy, came with a side of fries.

The potato and salmon blini was simply great! Every bite was savoured.

Highly recommended!', 'Great place to celebrate your birthday! I booked the red room and they made everything perfect! They have good burgers.', 'It used to be one of my favorite bars in Berlin, until one day I’ve forgotten they don’t accept cards.
I had to pay for ONE BEER but didn’t have cash and the waiter denied allowing me to withdraw it from ATM, I had to wait for my friend to bring me the cash.
In general, the stuff was extremely rude and accusing me of scamming them ( again, the bill in question was 3.80 € for a bottle of beer :D
Instead of coming here, consider an amazing place nextdoor - Piruette']

Name: Lụa Restaurant
Summary: Vietnamese staples & sushi in a warm, refined setting with exposed bricks & wood accents.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:30 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:30 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Service was good but the food unfortunately awful. Not only Pho soup lacked any flavor, they coriander that came with it was half dry and yellow and should’ve been thrown away days ago. Also looked like it hasn’t been washed. Also the chicken is the sliced chicken from the bag in a frozen section and taste nothing like chicken - but very strange and has a weird texture. I recommend to stop cutting corners and serving such low quality of food.', 'Delicious food. I love it. Come here again', 'Absolutely terrible. The older gentleman that served us was incredible rude and unwelcoming. Every question we asked, he responded with attitude and annoyance. He did not make it an enjoyable dinner at all. Will never be returning again.']

Name: Metzer Eck
Summary: Familiar dishes prepared in a stalwart restaurant with an old-world vibe & a sidewalk terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['If you are looking for a traditional Berlin bar and food with lots of heritage you can do no better than going to Metzer Eck.

The business has been in the same family for about 100 years.

Excellent outdoor area for some good evening summer sun.. essential booking as it is always booked out.

Go inside the bar and see the heritage of it as it has not been updated with many original features like the coal fire (not working as now as part of the bar).

The Schnitzel has to be one of the best value and taste ratio I have tried in Berlin. , go for it with herb butter as super delish. I do feel other items on the menu are a little expensive for what you get but still very tasty.', "What a pleasure to eat in this authentic German restaurant.  The staff and clientele where so friendly.

Steeped in history if you can get in I'd say is a must. Next time I'm back I know where I'm getting my schnitzel", 'Awesome German food and beer at this location. Very traditional food and tasty beer to wash it back with. We had a very nice seat on the patio with great service! The inside was nice also, comfortable atmosphere and friendly staff.']

Name: Domino's
Summary: Delivery/carryout chain offering a wide range of pizzas & a variety of other dishes & sides.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['I have a good experience there, I called them asking my order, we can’t hear each other well due to the bad connection, but they called back quickly and solved my problem. The staff I met is very friendly.', 'Today I went in and nobody came to the front for 20 mins , I rang the bell around ten times ,  when the guy arrived there was no apology,\nThen we asked for several pizzas they didn’t have what we wanted absolute joke of a dominoes', 'Racism is on top by the staff members. Once i went to this store to ask for a job and a girl from Delhi (India) answered me that we are not hiring Indians although she is also from India. I want to ask to her that do you own the Domino’s or this store? You are just an employee like others and who gave you this right? I also want to ask the manager is this Domino’s policy that Indians are not allowed to work in Domino’s? And if this is Domino’s policy then give me answer i will tag Domino’s on twitter’s and will ask to them directly. I want to say one thing to that girl from india “ you don’t deserve to be indian”.']

Name: Betty'n Caty
Summary: Busy cafe for coffees, juices, salad bowls & egg dishes, plus all-day brunch on weekends.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Reviews:
["2nd time this week we've been here (party of 2) and we'll be back! Yes, you might have to plan some extra time when it's crowded, but we got seated quite quickly both times. All waitresses are friendly, speak English but if you prefer German, there's always one available, too. Food is being prepared freshly and the taste is superb = worth the price. We recommend ALL of the freshly squeezed/blended juices, the poached eggs on toast, the bowls and the french toast! :)", 'I used to really enjoy this place for its location with sunny terrace in spring and fall, but the prices are so high now that it’s simply not worth it anymore. Charging 6 euros for half a tomato with some grated cheese, 4,5 for a quarter of an avocado, on top of 18 euros for 2 friend eggs on bread with pancetta and some basic salad… i wont come back anymore unfortunately

Only good thing that happened: the extremely grumpy blond women is gone and is replaced by overly excited new staff', 'Poached egg selection is great.
I had a poached egg with avocado, chilly and lemon. Their bread is also great.
Try the herbal teas if you’re into herbal tea.']

Name: Restaurant Pasternak
Summary: Intimate, parquet-floored dining spot with crystal chandeliers & a piano, serving Russo-Jewish fare.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['One of the best restaurants you will find in this area and is worth a visit for some breakfast, brunch or lunch.

A big East European influence throughout the menu. Their breakfast choices, especially No2, is fantastic, as are the pancakes, which I was reliably informed once again by the "experts" in my family, were really really good.

Coffee was excellent as was their home made lemonade.

Service and atmosphere are first rate and deserve a mention. A great choice if the weather looks half decent as well.

There is a lot to choose from in this area, and still, this one sits above the others I have been to. Highly recommended.', "Classic eastern european style place in a nice, relaxing neighborhood with beautiful scenery if you choose to sit outside.

Food was amazing and beautifully presented on the plate. I mainly went because I was craving borscht and I was satisfied. The lunch(?) plates were packed with many components and each of them delicious. Many veggie options to choose from, you don't feel like it's just an afterthought. Vegan options also available.

Price is a bit on the higher end but because the food is good it's worth it for me. Service was friendly and fast.", 'The salmon was incredibly soft and tasty. Staff were friendly except at the end we couldn’t get the attention of the waiter after we paid with a credit card. We returned the credit card machine to the counter.']

Name: Pomodorino‎
Summary: Italian restaurant for pizza slices with classic & inventive toppings, plus pasta & tiramisu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Never forget to bring a cash with you, the don’t accept card payments.
Last time more than a year I was here. Still same delicious pizza, but this time I couldn’t find any oil on the tables. But in general I recommend here.', "Simple sliced up pizzas at affordable prices for a quick dinner night. Good vegetarian options available, although some could be quite bland and bready for one's liking.
Tiramisu was served from their restaurant next-door but was super yummy and definitely going back for it!
Ambience: Very loud, could be cosier. Super friendly staff
Payment: cash only", 'Real Italian pizza at very cheap prices but the taste is truly authentic
Like the interior design as well']

Name: Budike
Summary: Generous homestyle offerings & beers are dished up in this old-fashioned mainstay.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['UK/America family went for dinner on a July evening. We tried with our smattering of German and it was well received! There is an English menu. Google Translate is your friend! My sons had the pork knuckle, and turkey coated with almond. Parents had the schnitzel with mushrooms, and schnitzel with mustard/horseradish. All were well received and all eaten up! Also tried the non alcoholic in-house (kids drank it), and the Schwarze bier (sweet, a beery Coca-Cola type).', "Loved the grumpy waitress, was the epitome of old school German service. If you don't speak German you'd have to work very hard to win her over!\nSchnitzel with creamy mushroom sauce was tasty and affordable. Friend got the xxl schnitzel, as big as his head per photo....", 'Amazing schnitzel! Tried both the mushroom and garlic. Good flavor and big size. Great selection of beers as well.\nDefinitely recommend.']

Name: Ristorante Italiano
Summary: Classic Italian pizzas & homemade pasta in a cozy venue with checkered tablecloths & outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Very good Italian restaurant (by Italian’s). Warm and friendly staff. Good service. Great food. Quality sizes and portions. Decent prices. We are here twice during our stay as it was convenient to our hotel. Both times the service and food were consistent and good the staff remembered us and gave a warm welcome.

Decent carbonara (although made with cream - as well as Parmesan & egg), good pizza, tasty tiramisu (light and creamy - slightly different to a heavy/boozy tiramisu). Good melon & prosciutto. Good coffee. Wine served by glass or caraffa.', 'Initially this restaurant was a pleasant spot with some good food, however the experience was spoiled by some poor service. It took 30 minutes for our drinks to arrive and a further 30 minutes for our bill to arrive after that. We were told when we entered that there was the option to pay by card, however when we came to pay the waiter aggressively told us no card despite having said we could pay by card before being seated. The only place nearby to get money out was a small store down the road which had a very high withdrawal fee on the ATM.', 'I ate there once and the food wasn’t anything special for the price. A frozen pizza from the grocery stores taste better than their pizza.

They recently installed some extremely bright lights outside the restaurant, that is totally nonsense for an Italian restaurant where you are supposed to have soft and comfortable lights. I leave close by and my eyes hurt when I need to look at these newly installed lights. It’s horrible.']

Name: Restaurant Blaue Adria
Summary: Traditional meat & seafood grills, fish dishes & Croatian wines in a relaxed venue with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
["Really nice hidden gem, that serves good sized portions and reasonable prices. If you like 3 types of meat on a nice hearty meal then this is the place to come. Mixed grilled meats with mushroom sauce reminds me of my mother's food - come here to make your mother proud and get your dose of meat, potatoes, and other veg 👍", 'Every time my mum visits me in Berlin, we never miss a visit or two to Blaue Adria. It reminds us of our holidays in Croatia! Food is excellent (not a place for veg though), the mixed grilled meat plates are all super tasty! Although we don’t speak German, the waitress is always keen to make an effort and make us feel welcome. We even have our own table at this point! We love the family-like atmosphere too. We always can’t wait to go back! ❤️', 'The perfect option for a lunch on Sunday. Good food, restaurant on very quiet location and outside the tourist area.

Prices are reasonable.
Beer around 3.5€
Pork steak and Cevapi around 12€
Pork meat with feta cheese inside around €14

You also get a free shot of Kruskovac.']

Name: Saporito
Summary: Kitschy venue with an open kitchen & patio, serving traditional Italian fare & wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["Amazing authentic Italian with a nice terrace, better staff and service and special decoration! Let them tell you what's the best according to your taste. The menu changes every week.", 'This restaurant is definitely worth a visit.
The interior is very notable and full of many little interesting Italian items :)
The service is extremely friendly.
The food is delicious and they have a different menu every week. Antipasti plate was mouth-watering!', 'The place Italians take their visiting relatives to show them they are ok in Berlin! Have been here countless times and always the great delicious food you expect. They have a weekly menu consisting of 1 entree, 3-4 (made in-house, fresh) pasta dishes, 1 fish, 1 meat menu item and a desert.
From the larger menu, the Antipasti Saporito is highly recommended. If the Parmigiana is on the menu, jump on it. And personally, I would always recommend anything with their home made tomato sauce (ragout or other). And save some room for the Tiramisu 🫶.']

Name: Rutz Zollhaus
Summary: Elevated regional dishes & steaks, plus a long list of wines, in a historic canalside building.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Dining at Rutz Zollhaus was an unparalleled culinary experience, earning a perfect 10 out of 10, and one that we will cherish for a long time. Our evening began on the charming patio, where the beautiful weather added an extra layer of enchantment to the night.

From the moment we arrived, the staff's exceptional hospitality stood out. They welcomed us with genuine warmth and friendliness, immediately making us feel at home. Their extensive knowledge of the menu was impressive, and their eagerness to guide us through the culinary journey ahead heightened our anticipation.

We started our meal with the grilled butter lettuce, an impeccable choice that set the tone for the rest of the evening. The dressing was extraordinarily flavorful, creating a delightful balance that tantalized our taste buds and left us eager for the next course.

Next, we indulged in the beef tartar, which was simply perfect in every way. The texture, seasoning, and presentation were all executed flawlessly, making it a standout dish.

For the main course, I faced a delightful dilemma between the braised ox shoulder and the BBQ ribs. In the end, I decided to indulge in both, and it proved to be the best decision of the night. Each dish was cooked to perfection, with the braised ox shoulder melting in my mouth and the BBQ ribs offering a succulent, smoky flavor that left me craving more.

Rutz Zollhaus is a true culinary gem in Berlin, where every dish reflects the skill and creativity of Chef Marco Müller and his team. The entire dining experience was remarkable and memorable, from the impeccable service to the exquisite food. If you find yourself in Berlin, this is a must-visit restaurant.

Bravo to Chef Marco Müller and the entire team for providing us with such an unforgettable experience. This evening will be one we remember fondly for years to come.", 'Mt meal, shoulder, was dry and hard. But my companions enjoyed their chicken and pork chop.', 'We recently had our wedding celebration here and booked out the whole place. I don’t think we could have ever found a more perfect location. The restaurant and its wine garden are just so charming and made everything feel so magical. Everything was beyond perfect. The service staff were incredibly kind, super attentive, and very accommodating. The chefs produced truly beautifully presented and incredibly delicious courses for all of our guests. A special shout out to Pia who was our point of contact who organised everything for us and was so sweet. Truly an unforgettable experience. Thank you to everyone at Rutz Zollhaus.']

Name: A.HORN
Summary: Stylish, plant-filled venue for bagels, coffee & salads, plus a bakery selection & outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Tuesday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Thursday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Friday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Saturday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Sunday: 10:30 AM – 5:30 PM
Reviews:
["A much better place than the last time I went. Definitely upgraded inside. I love the fact that you can pay by card AND you can make a reservation online.
The pancakes! amazing, fluffy and fresh and tasty and I'll go back for more.
Nice bagels, nice coffee. You can check the menu by barcode and then it's self-service.", 'We had Pastrami Bagel and Pulled Chicken. Service was quite slow. Took around 20 minutes to just get two sandwiches. I had higher expectations with Pastrami Sandwich and expected something like New York deli food. However, pastrami was nothing but from a regular grocery. Very thin cut. Bagel flavor was so strong I barely got the taste of Pastrami

Anyway, pulled chicken was around 12€ and for that quality and service I would say it was overpriced l', 'We had a lovely brunch at A.Horn! There are several cool food options and it tasted great. The interior design is very cute and cosy. I liked the fact that you order your food and pay for it immediately. Of course, if you go during peak time, you’ll have to wait in the queue for a while and wait for your food to be ready, but the cosy atmosphere made up for it. The weather was beautiful and we walked along the water afterwards.']

Name: Van Loon Restaurant Boat and Shipping Company
Summary: Smoked fish & fried seafood, served on a boat-top deck with panoramic views over the canal.
Opening Hours: Monday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Awesome place in summer. Beautiful view as well as chill atmosphere. I always spend at least one afternoon at van Loon when I‘m in Berlin. Usually I have a few beers and watch the swans and paddlers. Sometimes I also get a snack but never tried the real menu.\n\nPrices are very ok for the location.', "Awesome buffet for brunch. Thank you Van Loon team for such a service. Unfortunately on that day there was born gluten free bread. They said it's usually available. How is this possible they didn't restock for a Saturday morning?", 'Lovely place to have a romantic dinner at night ! Say hi to the swans when coming in the will appreciate ! 🦢']

Name: TZOM - Eritrean Restaurant
Summary: Compact restaurant dishing up homestyle Eritrean cooking amid laid-back surroundings.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["Went here to try something I haven't tried before, I wasn't expecting too much but TZOM FAR exceeded my expectations! Not only were the portion sizes large, everything we tried tasted incredible and the waitress was super attentive and friendly. The mixed platter for 1 was great to try out a few different flavours, the fatta was a huge portion and my personal favourite was the deep fried bread strips with minced meat and yogurt, definitely a must-try here!\n\nI've never had Eritrean food (or anything similar to it even) before, can safely say it's definitely worth checking out! We ended up paying about 51 euros in total, for the amount of food we got I'd say you can't ask for much better value.", 'Everything was beyond excellent. We loved the food from TZOM, super tasty and flavorful. The service was exceptional. Highly recommend to any foodies', 'We ordered platters to share to get a taste of everything. The food was delicious. The sauce with mushroom was on a spicier side. But the taste of everything else together balanced it. So talk to the server before ordering the food regarding the spice level, if you cannot handle the spice. In all, delicious food. Totally recommend it.']

Name: Bejte-Ethiopia
Summary: Cozy venue with Ethiopian artifacts for spicy meat & vegetable stews served with injera flatbread.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['We went for lunch and had mix platter of both vegetarian and non vegetarian options. They were delicious. The only thing was missing that the food was almost at room temperature where I was expecting it to be hot. The tej honey wine was great a bit sweet for my taste but enjoyable, again it was served at room temperature. I haven’t tried much of Ethiopian cuisine so exactly can’t say if it’s supposed to that way. But I can confirm the taste were great and filling. Outdoor seating was nice and they have cozy indoor. Clean Toilets available.', "The restaurant had a cozy, old-fashioned vibe and lots of people seemed to like it. We tried the vegan food, and it was really tasty. The owners and staff were always friendly, which made the place feel nice. It's smart to book ahead because it gets busy. If you're into Ethiopian food, this restaurant is a must-try!", 'I had dinner at Bejte-Ethiopia with a friend and we ordered a non-vegetarian combo for 2 people. This was my first time eating Ethiopian food so I cannot vouch for authenticity, but to me it tasted quite good, perhaps a way to describe the food would be that it’s somewhat similar to certain Indian curry dishes. Their special coffee was also very nice. I liked the decor, atmosphere and the friendly personnel. The 1-star reduction is due to the service being extremely slow, unfortunately. Luckily my friend and I weren’t in a rush so it was an overall positive dining experience. Quick note: you have to eat everything with your hands, so it can get a bit messy. This isn’t a criticism as it’s the traditional way to eat Ethiopian food, just be aware and wash your hands well prior.']

Name: Berkis
Summary: Traditional Greek meze & souvlaki in an understated, family-run restaurant with outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Very nice Greek restaurant.  Great food, great service, great location.  Very busy place.  Outdoor seating full.  Was able to get a window seat.  Had the Spanakopita and land chops with a nice glass of wine.  Food was delicious.  Chops cooked excellent.  Nice portions.  Definitely worth a visit!', 'First and last time. I paid 14,50 Euros for a grill meat plate and got less meat than what you would get in a pita. Not even a full pita bread and half of the plate was filled with fries. That is what i call stealing. About the taste, they could at least use some salt.', "Went here on a friend's recommendation, we were able to get a table without reservation but it was quite packed, so definitely make one! The food is really good and honestly very affordable for how much you get! Also whatever those fried dough balls in honey are called, get those for dessert if you have a sweet tooth, thank me later"]

Name: Sakura Restaurant
Summary: Modern Asian restaurant with an all-you-can-eat buffet featuring sushi, dim sum & noodle dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['The cafe is a buffet, but the choice of food is very small. Several positions of similar meat in sauce, two waters of fried fish, there we no seafood, at least when we were there. Side dishes were also few.
The sushi were just awful, they were crookedly rolled, there were no options with salmon or tuna at all. Basically sushi were only with vegetables or with vegetables and crab sticks. There were only a two desserts and they were not tasty.

In addition you must order at least one drink, the prices for them are overhigh.

However, by Berlin standards - this is a pretty cheap place and the food is unlimited. So if your goal is to eat a lot for little money and the taste is not particularly important, then this is the place for you.', "Visiting Berlin for a couple of days with my 13 year old son who is very fussy about food so a buffet was a wise choice! We found the place very easily, a few minutes walk from Nollendorfplatz U-bahn station. We visited on a Friday evening and there was no waiting time. The food was fresh and there's a large selection of sushi, grilled meats, cooked dishes and a small veggie salad bar + deserts and ice-cream. The meat is freshly grilled before your eyes, everything we chose was delicious! The cake selection was small and my cheesecake and berry jello weren't very tasty but the ice-cream was lovely. There were two choices of noodles and they were more Chinese than Japanese style. There are no English labels for anything so we intuitively chose with our eyes! Our server was nice but didn't go out of her way to explain anything about how the buffet works but I guess is self explanatory if you've been before to similar places. The place is clean and has pleasant Japanese themed decor.  45 euros for two, with a glass of still water and a glass of sparkling water. I don't drink alcohol but they seemed to have a wide selection of alcoholic beverages, classic choice of soft drinks and a small cocktail bar. Definitely worth the time and the money. My son loved the food too and we had a good time. I would eat here again.", 'We went there at around 20:30
Unfortunately the food was not fresh anymore. Fried foods were too greasy. I suggest a different pricing for those late hours to be fair']

Name: Saigon Com Nieu
Summary: Vietnamese soups, noodles & fragrant curries in a low-key space with lanterns & sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Average food : crispy duck was lack in crispiness and flavour, mango sauce was kind of too sweet and it did nit go well with the duck.
Could have added some spiciness to make it better.
Atmosphere looks good
Service was fine, could be improved and see how they reply to your review below , how rude! So taking 2 stars out of service.

Update: reply to the comments, it’s the item in the menu I am talking about, does it mean that only that noodle you mentioned is good there?
For that price we paying, you should make sure it have good quality and taste!
Where is your customer service???
So better remove other food item from your menu!!!', 'The food was quite authentic and we liked the choice in the menu! No westernised boring Asian “fusion” that you can find in any other average place. The Banh Xeo was fantastic 😊', 'Fast service, good prices and amazing, amazing food. Would highly recommend. I got the peanut satay with crispy duck and I loved it.']

Name: Restaurant Winterfeld
Summary: Italian mainstays like pizza & pasta, in an elegant room with floor-to-ceiling wine shelves.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Very good food and nice people. It’s in a quiet alley at Winterfeldt‘s.', 'A beautiful place with so much potential. My meal was regrettable and I just hope they redo their menu and replace the kitchen staff.  Candied walnuts in a pasta dish? Frozen inedible beef carpaccio?  The ratings are a ruse, this place needs to be avoided—many greater options for Italian food just around the corner.', "I dont know about this one... the staff seemed nice and attentive and the food was good. We were a group of 5 people, getting steak and pasta. It got served in a reasonable time but I ordered pizza and had to wait for ever until I got served. Everyone else was literally finishing off their plate, the moment the pizza was served. Very disappointing and an unpleasant experience. The food was good tho. I wouldn't come back and can't recommend this one."]

Name: Restaurant Ambrosius
Summary: Unpretentious German dishes, plus breakfast, in a wood-lined, country-style dining room.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing authentic German restaurant! This little gem was just around the corner from our hotel, we decided to give it a try. It's 30 degrees Celsius in Berlin today and there's no A/C inside so we had to sit on the patio, but it was lovely atmosphere out there.

Server's English was "not so gut" (his words) but they had an English menu so it was all workable with our "not so gut" German. The rest of the family had various schnitzels (yum!) and I had the turkey steak with pepper sauce (super yum!), even though there's hundreds of restaurants in Berlin we're already talking about coming back again. Absolutely excellent!', 'If you desire traditional German cuisine in a warm, inviting environment, this is the place to visit. They have a seasonal menu as well as a standard menu in multiple languages. I had the goulash to start and the pork knuckle as the main. The food is delicious and the servings are large.

The staff is welcoming and friendly. It felt more like a family environment and we will be back!', "Stayed in a nearby hotel and managed to steal some me-time from an otherwise hectic programme. A positive review of their pork knuckle caught my attention. I must say that this is probably the best pork knuckle I've had. The flesh was amazingly tender even though it looked dry. The red cabbage was just the right level of sweetness and sour, while the dumplings were lighter than the usual. Everything came together well. Managed to finished everything, except for an inch of crackling which would have tipped me over the edge! Well worth a try if you are nearby, and possibly even a detour to enjoy both the quality of the meal and the warm service."]

Name: Ulrichs - Café, Küche & Kultur
Summary: Non-profit, volunteer-run cafe & eatery offering coffee, light German fare & cultural events.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Friday: Closed, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['They were super kind, the atmosphere of the local is very free and nice, and the personal was very friendly!!\nToday we were looking for a beer and a knife for making our pocket-lunch and we went inside for asking them. They were super kind and offer us a seat, two plates, butter and cucumber. Very suggested! If I came back to Berlin I will return here.', 'We ate some of the most disgusting Waffles in our whole lifes! Waitress decided to put her coffee on our table while she was smoking her cigarette near us. When we ordered we had to repeat our order at least 3 times. Cannot recommend, even to my worst enemy.', 'Cafe run by volunteers serving different dishes every day. Tried the red lentil soup today - it was basic but super yummy.']

Name: Restaurant & Supermarkt Persepolis
Summary: Kebabs, grilled meats & stews, plus vegetarian options & traditional drinks, in a relaxed setup.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['This is a quite decent Persian restaurant. We were a group in f people and the service was really good. The staff were also very nice and friendly.

Unfortunately, I can’t speak of prices as we were invited.

The appetizers are pretty good and the food was also decent.', 'I had a vegetarian option which was tasty and plentiful.  They seemed to be short staffed and they need to improve a bit on their cleaning of the tables.  Also, if you’re bothered by cigarette smoke, people smoke in the outside section and the smell does penetrate the seating inside.  I would eat here again as my meal was good.', 'Very Yummy !!!
Salad & side dishes not very special But the main is Amazing. I expect grilled chicken may be dry but it is really really juicy and tastes just right. lamb is really good too.

Staffs sooooo nice and have smile always.
SOOO clean toilet as well !

Recommend you have to visit here 👍🏻']

Name: April
Summary: Laid-back cafe/bar for breakfasts, salads & light meals, with an extensive selection of wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['The best breakfast I’ve ever had! The staff were great and the place itself was charming. 10/10', 'April is a charming breakfast café that delights with its cozy ambiance and welcoming atmosphere. The menu offers a wide array of breakfast options, from classic favorites like pancakes and eggs Benedict to creative, seasonal dishes that showcase fresh, local ingredients. The coffee is rich and expertly brewed, perfectly complementing the delicious food. The friendly staff make you feel right at home, providing attentive service with a smile. Whether you’re starting your day with a hearty breakfast or just grabbing a quick pastry, April is the perfect spot to enjoy a relaxing morning.', 'Small evening menu but still something for everyone. Not busy on a Monday night but enough tables to create an atmosphere. Intimate venue with almost a classic feel. Lovely friendly, attentive staff. Food was excellent and plenty there, worth the price. Would definitely visit again if I was in the area']

Name: Elefant
Summary: Variations on schnitzels, plus beef goulash & meatballs, in an easygoing space with exposed brick.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["What a fantastic restaurant! I absolutely loved the schnitzel—it was perfectly crispy and flavorful. They offer so many different varieties, it's hard to choose just one. They also have a range of specialties from Berlin that I haven't tried yet, but they look amazing. I'm already looking forward to my next visit to explore more of the menu. Highly recommend!", '🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 We had a delicious meal, starting with a goulash followed by an incredible Schnitzel Bolognese. The portions are huge and well-presented; you can even swap fries for a salad! ☕ The coffee was also very tasty. Special shout out to the waitstaff who served us with big smiles and great kindness. We visited on a lovely day, so grabbing a table on the terrace was definitely the best choice! Came with my partner and we had a wonderful time, it was quiet enough to have a good conversation. I highly recommend this place, it’s one of the best spots for German cuisine I’ve tried in Berlin! 🇩🇪🍽️', "This restaurant delivers an authentic German dining experience like no other! From the warm welcome to the delicious schnitzel and refreshing local beer, every aspect exceeded my expectations. With its cozy ambiance and attentive staff, it's a five-star gem in Berlin's culinary scene!"]

Name: Shayan
Summary: Classic Iranian fare, including baked fish dishes & stews with lamb & lentils, in a cozy setting.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Solid food, tasty spinach balls 😋\nWe shared the veggie platter for two and drinks.\nVery affordable.', 'One of the best rice dishes in Berlin. The chicken is perfectly cooked, soft and tender yet has a char from the grill. Food comes with a complimentary salad. Portion is big and well worth the price.', 'Great authentic Persian food and hands down the best in Berlin. Very friendly staff and welcoming environment.']

Name: Nafis Restaurant
Summary: This small, modest Persian spot with traditional decor offers classic dishes & sidewalk seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Reviews: ["Super fair prices for tasty, authentic Iranian food. The Kubideh is big, cooked well and delicious. It's a great spot to get some good Iranian food without breaking the bank. Service is also very nice, we'll be back!", 'The meals were really delicious and the price was quite normal. The only negative thing was that the staff was not so professional as they were sitting outside and having a good time by talking. We had to wait quite a long time to ask for the tea and the bill. Overall I would only recommend.', 'Small, cozy place with very good food and pleasant staff.\nYou can feel that the meat is good quality, and in general the restaurant has special kind of charm.']

Name: Phojito
Summary: Pho, rice bowls, Vietnamese tapas & cocktails prepped in a little, brick-walled eatery.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["A really nice place to have a drink and some tapas. There is a lot to select from the menu, a very nice selection of side dishes.

The place looks very clean and they play modern music. The waiters are friendly as well. The amount of food in comparison to price could be a bit better, because they don't serve like other Vietnamese restaurants, but i understand this is kind of a tapas bar.

So good so far, i can see myself returning for a next time.", 'Delicious food and nice ambiance.', 'Worth every euro! Pho was just how it supposed to be. Home made lemonade also was good!']

Name: Da Jia Le
Summary: Northeastern Dongbei Chinese cuisine & local Berlin beer, served in an unfussy dining room.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['This place made me homesick for the Chinatown restaurants in New York. I love it and it’s my new go to Chinese spot as a New Yorker in Berlin. The food is on paar with some of New Yorks best Chinese food. Authentic and stellar. This place made me very happy.', 'As an Asian person who’s now living in nyc - I have to preface that Asian food I’ve tried in Berlin has much room for improvement. I’ve been to a couple places with great reviews and ended up mildly disappointed.

The food here is ok, not authentic the way I’ve had in China or Bangkok, or some really good places in NYC or London, but it wasn’t bad.

The service was fast and the servers were attentive. We thought the price was fair too

One down side is that we found a crumbled paper in our rice bowl.

All in all, if you’re used to Chinese food from China or Asia, don’t expect this to be the same', 'Great restaurant!!! The food was delicious! Maybe the best Chinese food I have ever had and maybe one of the best in Berlin! Almost all the tables were full so make sure you make a reservation first. This was also the reason why we had to wait for the waiter to take the order for quite a while, but once he came he was very polite and the food came pretty soon. A great choice for Chinese food in Berlin!']

Name: Meyan Mediterranean Restaurant
Summary: Middle Eastern dips, Turkish mains & sandwiches, at a cozy, brick-walled space with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews: ['Really good place for breakfast. You can find everything and coffee is good. Prices are not that expensive. The bad thing is when I asked for a glass of water they brought me a shot of water !', 'I went there with two more people and the service was not as expected.. the waiter forgot the order so I had to wait while others ate. Not only that, but also we had to ask for simple things like culinary and bread which was forgotten from when we initially order along with my main order too.\n\nOverall, the food was in small portions for the price paid but was delicious.', 'Delicious foods in a beutiful atmosphere. Women who serves was very kind and nice. We paid 68€ for 3 dishes of meal, 1 dish of appetizer, 2 drinks and 2 cups of coffee.']

Name: Mutter
Summary: Typical Thai curries, soups & meat skewers, plus cocktails, in a laid-back setup with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
['Visited today,
Ordered Tom Yam soup, duck breast and a glass of red wine.
The soup was nice, cost 11€, the glass of wine was OK cost 8.5€, the duck breast was absolutely burnt and not edible, cost ~18€.

The chef has not agreed to cancel the burnt meal and offered a compensation of extra glass of wine which I was not happy about.

The waitress was nice so I tipped her 15% anyway, and the place was cosy overall.', 'A lively, welcoming spot with very friendly staff. The service was a little slow, perhaps short on staff that evening but the food was worth the wait. Beautifully presented and full of fresh ingredients and flavours. Highly recommended!!', 'Well, best food I had in a long while! Staff is very friendly and competent. We were a group of 8, first time visiting Berlin, came here on first evening, then repeated on second - that good 🤗 keep it up guys, doing a great job!']

Name: Fadi Food
Summary: Unpretentious restaurant serving shawarma wraps, falafel & hummus, plus flatbreads & pizzas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Amazingly decent food that tastes exactly like home, I wish I find this quality Arabic food in London.', 'Please try thymium and erdnusse. Spectacular. Guys super friendly , good simple but very good. Will come back to try more', "Very very very good authentic food. Don't miss it."]

Name: Domino's Pizza Berlin Prenzlauer Berg Nord
Summary: Delivery/carryout chain offering a wide range of pizzas & a variety of other dishes & sides.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Their customer service is absolutely terrible. Pray they get your order right, because if they don’t, you’ll be made to feel stupid for complaining and asking them to rectify it. To save yourself the hassle, better to just not order from here.', 'We made an order and it was delivered I think in 30 minutes, that was very fast!\nAnd pizza, good, as you wait from American pizzas!', 'I’ve ordered 2 hours ago and never received my order I tried to cancel my order but I couldn’t what a bad service. Never ordering again. Best advice NEVER ORDER they don’t answer they accept the order and they don’t show you any progress or where your order is.']

Name: Hisar fresh food
Summary: Meat, chicken & vegetarian kebabs, plus sides, served in a low-key spot with a take-out window.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:45 PM
Reviews:
['One of my favorite Döner shops in Berlin. It‘s usually packed. There‘s always a long line. Especially on the beef window. They have a chicken window as well, which is usually quicker.

They mostly cater for take away customers. But there is a small seating section as well. Not very cosy. But it is fast food after all.', 'This place is usually full of people in line, probably because of its location, right next to the S-Bahn station, and they offer good döner. Luckily for us, there was no one there when we arrived. My friend and I ordered beef döner, we both enjoyed it a lot.
There are two order windows here, one for chicken meat lover and the other for beef, pick your line wisely.', "Ordered dürüm as i was super hungry, but take a look at the meat. Almost none. Literally, i had salad instead of a döner. Besides, the meat was too dry, you can't get any meat taste because they slice it too thin. I don't recommend any one to waste money on their döner."]

Name: Ristorante Café Aroma
Summary: Long-standing evenings-only venture with a terrace & an old-school vibe serving pasta & pizza.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Since the place has changed ownership it has improve 180 degrees. Pizzas were fantastic and served in time, although the place was full we did not have to wait that much and drinks were well done and refreshig. This place is one of the top Italian ones to recommend in XBerg.', 'One of the hidden gems in Berlin, loved by the locals...an interesting locale with a large outside area, the street is off the beaten path,and the food/service truly Italian . Excellent 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻', 'Very slow service and instead of Linguine and Pappardelle we both got Fussili. The food was but definitely not worth the price. Do not recommend.']

Name: Barkett
Summary: Stylish cocktail & craft-beer hangout with a mod vibe, open-mike nights & regular live music.
