Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Reviews: ['Went there for a pop up filter café event on Sunday and I really enjoyed it. The bar is in a very nice neighbourhood, the staffs are friendly and the coffees are tasty. Will definitely recommend this place!', 'Went there for the first time last summer, since then every time I been in Berlin I had to go for a drink.\nGreat vibes, nice music and a five star service.', "Quite expat-ish bar, but they do have a smokers' room, one changing craft beer, alright wines and it gets even better when you sit outside watching the bridge."]

Name: Cielo Di Berlino
Summary: Relaxed stop with sidewalk tables & a menu of classic & buckwheat pizzas, plus housemade pastas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 2:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Another visit to this amazing place. Great service, great atmosphere and delicious food. I highly recommend it especially for people on a gluten-free diet.', 'tasted great! The buckwheat pizza dough is very filling. Remember to indicate when ordering that you wish for gluten free. Not all menu items are. Friendly and helpful service. Good to see their friends drop by for hugs.', 'Great gluten free options.  Friendly service\n\nFound this place through research when looking for gluten free friendly restaurants as I am Coeliac.  Upon translating the menu it said that their buckwheat gluten free pizzas cannot be kept free from cross contamination which was concerning. But after speaking to the waiter he advised that everything is done separately and that it was okay for those with gluten allergies.  The pizza was good and I had no reaction to it and so assume everything was kept gluten free.']

Name: Ripieno
Summary: Charming, down-to-earth place offering traditional Italian pastas, pinsas & wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM
Reviews: ["I went there with my colleagues for a team dinner, we were 13 people, and the food was delicious, i was quite disappointed that they ran out of Ragu and meatballs pasta, so ended up with Clara pizza and Pasta with beef in red wine both were perfectly flavoured, and the textures were spot on. By far the best pasta I've had in years.\nThe staff are friendly to the point you feel like part of the family - thank you for the great service and food", 'Thank you for taking us back to Italy. We missed authentic Italian food in Berlin. If you are looking for real carbonara or Tiramisu then Ripieno is the right place to dine and enjoy. Grazie mille', "The first thing that caught my eyes was its vibe! For an hour I felt we're in Italy. Owners were Italian with strong accent and even people there were also warm and hype! I liked it in general. The food was acceptable maybe was not my best Italian experience but still was good. The only average point was the service. There were just two owners who were handling orders and many customers so we had to wait a lot just to order or receive check."]

Name: LA Paz
Summary: Mexican classics served in a warm, colorful space with a convivial vibe, full bar & sidewalk seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["Food was great! Kind and fast service! Very recommended!
Went for lunch, the place is quit big and was a bit empty (maybe it's more busy later in the afternoon/evening). At first the dishes looked a bit expensive, I ordered the chicken burrito and it was huge! And very tasty and it was worth it for me. Also ordered mango-colada cocktail that came with a delicious melon on it 🍈", 'Great food. Huge portion. Corn soup was sweet and like it slightly spicey, but that is my own preference. Bathrooms have been remodeled, but are on basement level.', 'Very nice place to sit and talk to a friend over the dinner. Music is not loud, unobtrusive. The interior is interesting, chairs are quite comfortable.👌
The food is yummy, served a bit slow, so be careful planning fast dinner - prepare to spend at least 1 hour here. Also looks like if one person orders soup, and others not, everyone on the table will wait for the first one to finish the meal before the second course is served.⏳
Overall impression is very positive, so if you have time and want to eat nice food, I would recommend to visit this place.👍']

Name: Moon Cuisine Weißensee
Summary: Pho, curry with chicken & other Vietnamese classics served in relaxed surrounds with outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Hidden gem in Weißensee. One of the freshest Vietnamese places in Berlin. Definitely get the glass noodle salad and papaya salad for starters! They also have their home made lemonades and juices including watermelon and aloe vera flavors. Also a Great lunch break spot as they have a deal for food + beverage', 'I had the magic moon tea - it changes colours depends which fruit juice you add!!\nMerkur plate was very delicious!\nIh and the shared appetizers for two - super yummy you can make it all vegetarian as well!', 'I enjoyed my food a lot. Was craving for curry and decided to go there. It’s not just an eatery, guys are actually trying to do something special, the menu is pretty big, a lot of food and drinks/beverages options. Prices are very acceptable, service is good. I ordered red curry with tofu and a homemade limo with strawberries and lime. Really recommend this place, gonna come there again.']

Name: Zur Gerichtslaube
Summary: Eatery in 13th-century building with beer garden, serving Berlin/Brandenburg fare in vaulted rooms.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Very impressive historical site where in medieval times your fate was determined but now you can eat from fully packed plates (be sure to be hungry before you walk in). I’m not too familiar with German eat culture but they’re big eaters for sure if this is the standard.', 'If you are in Berlin this place gives the full German experience🇩🇪
It’s located in the Altstadt in a lovely medieval town and the place has a story you can read on the menu.
Food is great and the portions are massive. Staff is friendly and the dining room is medieval style.', 'Amazing place. The staff was very kind and funny. The suggestions were very good. The best knuckle we have eaten ever. The starter and dessert were very good as well.

The beers made only for them are very good, especially the black ones. Moreover, they have
Schneider-Weisse as well as wheat beer, is a safe bet.

We recommend it 100%. We will come back to Berlín only to eat there. It is worth crossing the city to eat here.']

Name: Brauhaus GEORGBRAEU
Summary: Beer garden & rustic tavern with copper piping, serving house-brewed beers & hearty German cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['This is a popular spot! For good reason. If you plan to arrive after 6pm, I highly suggest making a reservation.
We had tasty dunkel beer, schnitzel, bratwurst and a pretzel. All excellent.', 'Quite surprised by how good it was. It’s in a tourist zone so thought everything might reflect that. However, everything was great.
Speedy and knowledgeable service, good food and great beers.
Located right on the river so outside views made it a nice relaxing lunch.', 'Great authentic German food. The schnitzel was delicious as was the duck. The side dishes that came with it were good but the main dish was the star of the show. For a appetizer we had the pretzel and butter. It was pretty good as well.']

Name: Mutter Hoppe
Summary: Multi-room bar-restaurant with a retro look, home-style German food & live music weekend evenings.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['The food was delicious and the beer even better.  We like that the location was close to so many attractions.  Go there hungry.  Portions were large.  You might even want to share portions.', 'The food was okay to quite good depending on the dish. Portions were large. The service was horrendous. We were forgotten about and then they tried to charge us for a bottle of water that we were never brought. Also it genuinely seemed like our waiter was high. He made a jerking off motion while taking my order, questioned our age, made a comment about our nationality then mocked us.', 'I recommend this place. Excellent German restaurant. The duck was particularly good. Service overall good. Nice restaurant and atmosphere']

Name: Rotisserie Weingrün
Summary: Typical German-style meat dishes served in a stylish dining room with an exposed-brick roof.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Very friendly and welcoming staff who went above and beyond to ensure we had a great meal. The fish and meat dishes pictured both were enjoyed thoroughly. The vegan burger was good but wish there was more vegan options.\nWould recommend for a great meal.', 'All around fantastic place. Great service, delicious food and some great wine selections. Get the ribs or the sausage plate if they are available. Definitely make a reservation and, if the weather is good, opt for the magical terrace seating.', 'This was a great low-light German restaurant with attentive servers and an inviting dining room. We ordered then Veal and salmon, along with salad and sides for a very filling and satisfying meal.']

Name: Zum Nußbaum
Summary: Bar with a long history, rebuilt after WWII, offering local dishes, table service & outdoor seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Service was lovely. Food was okay, hearty German affair. In fairness we all cleared our plates. Nothing at all fancy, but that might just be, the order of the day. Good location in the old town for a simple feed.', 'An excellent traditional German restaurant in the Medieval Nikolaiviertel right next to the church. The prices are OK and the food is tasty. Service is good. I suggest you try their special kind of schnitzel and the cocktail Strawberry Punch. The Berlitz guide for Berlin was right about suggesting this place, we came across unknowingly and realised only later how reputable Nußbaum was. Highly recommended.', 'The food was great, fast service and super friendly attention. Recommended if you are in the area and want to try typical German food. Danke!!']

Name: Zum Paddenwirt
Summary: Robust, homestyle meals served in a wood-paneled dining room or a large beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Located in a really nice area. If we did not find this restaurant we would not be able to explore the area surrounding the St Nicholas church.

Food was great and in big portions (normal Germany portion) and the service was good, efficient and fast.

We sat outside due to the stroller and since it is a garden, there were bees and flies wanting to taste our food constantly. Not the restaurants fault but next time I aim to sit inside.', 'Good traditional and no-fuss German restaurant combining a selection of Berlin specialties with other regional dishes, including from the South. Very nice beer garden in summer months overlooking the quiet and charming Nikolaiviertel in central Berlin. Service is friendly, rapid, and efficient. Portions are on the large side and prices are totally fair considering the area and the food quality.', "Best German food that I've had in Berlin! Comfortable and friendly atmosphere, kind staff, and delicious food."]

Name: Ristorante Piazza Rossa
Summary: Pasta, pizza & homemade gelato in a big space with checked tablecloths & views of the Rotes Rathaus.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["The pizza was pretty good! But you have to cut it yourself so it can get messy. I didn't love the vegetarian lasagna, it was very plain. And there is no complimentary bread with your meal.", 'Food was fine, service was okay. Our waiter was a bit confused and handling two tables at the same time causing him to place the wrong drinks at our table, just to pick them up a few minutes later and putting them down at the right table. Not a big problem, just a bit weird. But it can happen to the best of us. Would still recommend overall.', 'This was a pretty great restaurant, and the food was delicious. The food was actually very affordable, and this restaurant made me feel like I was in Italy! It provides a great atmosphere and experience. The waiter & staff were very nice and friendly!']

Name: Restaurant Balthazar 2
Summary: Innovative Japanese-Italian fare in an elegant dining room with a riverside terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Nice view and easy location.
Seafood was successful.
Service capacity is low, cannot serve main menu to groups with 10+', 'It’s a dining, but not fine.

I’ve been here with friends for a special occasion; we had a tasting menu (4-course meal). The starter was perfect, the soup was salty, and my friends couldn’t finish it even with beer. For me, it was ok and delicious. The main dish was nice but too simple. The dessert was a total disappointment (strawberry theme); the taste was artificial.

But if the food was more or less ok, the service was a disaster. We had to wait a lot for someone to come and get our order, and when they finally came, they turned to another table in the middle of the conversation with us. Only one girl explained the dish when we asked her. Others didn’t know the menu and didn’t care about our experience.

We paid €170 for three persons for average food, bad service, and a loud street musician nearby, and they wanted us to tip 🤡

Please note that in Berlin, you must choose the tip amount on every terminal. And they have it starting from 10% to 20+. Zero is not an option on the screen; you have to choose it manually.', 'We stopped for wine and stayed for dinner.
Exceptional service, very good wine selection, and the food, we had the tapas and risotto, were an absolute delight.']

Name: Zille-Stube
Summary: Old-fashioned restaurant with outdoor seats preparing traditional fare & cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['May 2024 update.\nFantastic spot directly at the water. Personnel was very friendly and food was great. Berliner dishes looking great and tasting even better. Highly reccomended. Large and clean toilets are a plus.', 'A beautiful place well located overlooking the Spree River, pleasant atmosphere, good food and generous portions', 'Excellent spot to sit by the River Spree, have a few drinks and order some pretty good food, service was excellent, food was great, and the views amazing. A little pricey but you are paying for the location.']

Name: Coffee shop in the Nikolai Quarter
Summary: Casual eatery with an outdoor patio serving hearty German staples & desserts plus coffee & beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["I stumbled upon the place while walking through the city.

For context, I do not speak German but I've worked in hospitality for over a decade.

They are understaffed and the one server was clearly overwhelmed and newer.

I had just ordered a glass of white wine and a bratwurst.
When it came to the bill, they were basically arguing with me about payment and items. This only occurred because the other server who wasn't serving me was helping close the bill.

In the end I paid cash, they have something on their menu about how they only take German credit card. No problem with that, I did read that before I sat down and ordered.

I get people get frustrated and overwhelmed but I had actually just wanted another drink (just a glass) not my bill. And again the original server placed the wrong thing on my bill and then tried to charge me for it.

I know I saw a male manager walking around to the other groups. Please help and train your team better.", 'I loved the atmosphere and friendly service
The curry wurst was delicious but the schnitzel was a little chewy for my taste', 'I was attracted to this restaurant by how beautiful the exterior was, looked really traditional.

It’s a beautiful cozy restaurant, seemed pretty old like it had been passed down from generations. I loved it. In my opinion I doubt the menu is extensive. Well I came here for breakfast. I had English breakfast in my opinion it looked great but I don’t think it’s nice to serve baked beans and bread together close to each other on the same plate. It makes everything messy.

For the same price, I’ve gotten larger English breakfast spreads. The coffee was cool.

Card payment is allowed so that’s a good thing.

I dislike pickles 🤭😬😣']

Name: Ephraims
Summary: Long-running spot for classic German dishes in a historic mansion or on a terrace with river views.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Real authentic German food. Went there because a friend was visiting and wanted to experience traditional German cuisine.\nSo there we were, in the most German looking restaurant, with the most German tasting food. Coming from a place where German food was often regarded as bland and boring I was pretty surprised to discover it’s not really the case! I mean, not a huge fan of boiled or steamed food so I guess I wasn’t going to be a big fan of it anyways but it’s some of the nicest boiled potato and steamed fish I’ve tried. Also the decor and the service were perfect. Thanks!', 'Really good food, the Pike was fantastic. Brilliant atmosphere and excellent service. Most amazing Apfel Strudel to end a perfect lunch.', 'Best food I have had during my 5 days in Berlin, and cheap price as well! Salad had very fresh vegetables, smoked salmon was wonderful, and presentation was pretty. Service 10/10; super helpful and friendly.']

Name: Café & Restaurant Spreeblick
Summary: Elegant setting for German & international dishes, plus a terrace with views of city landmarks.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['An almost excluded spot away from the main area with a great location on the Spree and the Saint George and the dragon statue. Nice restaurant with good local food for a quick meal and even better drinks! Our first experience of a German classic curry wurst and we were pleasantly surprised. This place really stood out for the service which was attentive and super friendly. You couldn’t have asked for nicer staff.', 'How delightful! I came here, ordered an apfel strudel and a hot chocolate with cream. It was soo good. Lovely flavours, the vanilla sauce, the apples and the ice cream. It was a perfect mid day break. The strudel was not too sweet and had incredibly balanced flavours. Great experience and a good, fun waiter. It did not take too long to receive our order as well which is a huge bonus. Thanks and Hello.', "Stopped in randomly for a small bite and a drink, and were very pleasantly surprised! The vegan currywurst and ragout were excellent, and we didn't find anything comparable to the Dutch coffee or Porter black beer in all the rest of Berlin!"]

Name: Humboldt Forum im Berliner Schloss
Summary: Originally built in the 15th century, this stately royal & imperial palace offers exhibits & tours.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30 AM – 6:30 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 6:30 PM, Thursday: 10:30 AM – 6:30 PM, Friday: 10:30 AM – 6:30 PM, Saturday: 10:30 AM – 6:30 PM, Sunday: 10:30 AM – 6:30 PM
Reviews: ['Visited Humboldt Forum in June 2024 on a sunny weekend. The Museum Island was crowded with visitors relaxing and enjoying the sun. The Forum is located at the center of the island, and next to the subway line 5. The visit to Humboldt Forum was very pleasant. The collections are mostly free. Couple of highlights about its facility: 1. lockers and cloakroom allows flight carry on size luggage, and check them for visitors for free. 2. There is a bistro with various reasonably priced lunch options. 3. Roof terrace costs 5 Euro for access. But one can make a reservation at its roof terrace restaurant Baret to enjoy a cup of coffee and the Dom view. I went there for its Asian Art collection located on the third floor, and happily surprised with its temporary collections there, especially with the Wang Shu designed exhibition hall. Of course, one question the visitors might have after reading the descriptions of some of the objects in the hall is  the museum\'s efforts and role in addressing the ethical dilemma of preserving those admittedly "looted" during the Boxer Rebellion. Overall, the Forum also made efforts in including more English language description of objects that\'s more friendly to non-German speaking visitors. At the beginning of the Asian Art collection, there is also a timeline of the transformation of its collection since 19th century. One suggestion for future improvement of presenting such a timeline is to use different colors for English and German texts, and explain acronyms on the side. It would be easier for the visitors to follow.', "Lovely and magical place, for me it's one of the best places and one of the  best areas in Berlin. Not only is the museum free, but it contains great exposition and great items inside.\n\nThere is an observatory which is around 5 euros to access but you'll have one of the best views in Berlin. You won't regret visiting here.", 'The rooftop must be one of the best places to see the sunset and also see couples of tourist attractions like Berlin Cathedral, TV towel, etc. Plus, the staff at the roof top are very friendly, there wasnt anything I like on the main menu, so I only want to order drinks. And he said, dont worry. Just enjoy the view.']

Name: Cafe am Petriplatz
Summary: Coffee, cakes & simple meals in a quaint room with chandeliers & framed art, plus a courtyard patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Reviews:
["A wonderful little cafe in Central Berlin.

We came for brunch and had a lovely meal. The waiter / manager / owner was absolutely the most polite man I've met in Germany.

The food and coffee were excellent. We had heard the open pancakes were amazing in Germany and this did not disappoint.

We sat outside and had a great time, the inside was also charming looking.

Highly recommended.", 'Scrambled eggs with onion and potatoes was delicious but a bit salty and peppery. If you do not like salt and pepper that than be aware. The service was kind. The inside is very small but if the weather is good try outside.', 'This became our favourite cafe in Berlin and we went there multiple times. Very friendly and accommodating people and service. Great food (farmers breakfast, pulled pancakes and bratwurst) and really good coffee. Will become our regular stop every time we are here.']

Name: Alte Münze
Summary: Berlin’s former State Mint, built in the 1930s, now operating as a venue for meetings & events.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Gorgeous place! Huge and very clean to dance. The led wall is very impressive and the high ceiling makes this space very imponent. But... The bar is sooooo slow... Sorry, girls, but a bar is not a catwalk... But I wish to be back!', 'the venue’s staff is the most unwelcoming, hostile and sour i’ve ever had the displeasure of dealing with at any arts event. i got frisked 4 times, 2 of them while i was already inside of the venue by the same staff member for no particular reason, while also having an attitude of a frustrated wannabe police officer. the rest of the staff kept a similar attitude throughout the event and even the promoters seemed to be frustrated and having arguments with the venue’s employees.\n\nhighly advise both promoters and attendees to avoid putting themselves through the ordeal of being treated in such a disrespectful and demeaning way for several hours of their day.', 'Went their for Monets Garden… The atmosphere was so magical that I didn’t want to leave that place and spent their around 3 hours, however the whole exhibition is not that big. But interaction and new technologies are making you wanna stay their for a bit longer. + movie room is something, where you definitely should stay for a bit longer.']

Name: The Brooklyn
Summary: Classy American steakhouse with beef sourced from the U.S., plus a cozy dining room & outdoor seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Fabulous meat. Perfectly cooked. Great sides, good portions. The service could be leveled up a little bit, however, they were\nvery lovely and when the waitress wasn’t sure of what wine to recommend she quickly got someone to assist in recommending a delicious wine to a decent price. It was our last night in Berlin, super happy! If I had to give one improvement it would be to get better outdoor seats for summer and for the staff to describe better size portions and concept.', 'The best steakhouse restaurant in Berlin! We tried the beef fillet black Angus, the NY strip loin and the Ribeye! All of them were very tasty! The first one was very juicy, the second one had an excellent balance of flavour and tenderness and the third one had a really we special smoked flavour! We also choose the Barbecue sauce and the Pepper Sauce! The second one was an excellent choice for our steaks ! The salad with spinach and arancini was also very tasty! The service was very helpful and attentive! The atmosphere was very nice! I totally recommend it!', "We had an amazing dinner at The Brooklyn. The service was very neat. I came here for my boyfriend's birthday and they served the dessert with a cute candle. The food was amazing of course. Thank you so much for everything to have a wonderful night 💛\nWe will definitely come back."]

Name: Tapas y más
Summary: Varied menu of modern tapas & Spanish dishes served in a bright dining room & large courtyard.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Very good main courses, big portions. Second evening order only tapas with drinks as well good', 'Maybe my expectations were too high, but the chicken was dry, the menu itself doesn’t explain with details how will be the food, if you haven’t tried Spanish food before will be a mess. It wasn’t bad but was not good either. If you run out of options, is still decent to eat there, but I wouldn’t come back.', "Ordered a mixed plate of tapas for 2 and it can easily serve 3 people. The price overall is fair, but it was a bit hard to get the waiter's attention. Nonetheless the whole staff was super nice, I definitely recommend it."]

Name: Spätzle Club
Summary: Schnitzel, goulash & an array of Swabian spätzle dumplings at a bright, relaxed eatery.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Can you say SUPER! Run don\'t walk to come eat here. The space is limited and I\'m praying they burst out with money and get a larger place. The tastiest most flavorful schnitzel. We know what a bad schnitzel is we live in Poland. Homemade spaetzle so fresh and  precisely seasoned your mouth says, "thank you". The service with a humingo smile and kindness. I believe I am in a dream. Just lovely.', "We are staying in the area and were looking for a local spot for lunch - we found it 🙂👍. The restaurant is rather small (seats around 30), and at first glance, it may not seem like a restaurant with the street work in front of their place. When you come in, you'll see there is nothing fancy about this place, but there are empty plates and happy, full customers hahaha. We ordered a few Schnitzel meals (with spätzle and potatoes with bacon and onion). They came out very quickly and wow were they tasty. Serious comfort food done right - we added to the empty plate count in the restaurant hahaha. The staff was very friendly and the menu is in English as well. People came in with all tables full and ordered food to go as well - a sure sign of a local gem. To add to the at home simple feel, if you need another drink, feel free to walk up to the drink fridge and grab whatever you need (opener to the right on the shelf table 👍). As well, people bring up their dishes to help out the small staff/owners. Awesome. If you are in the area, definitely stop by. Thanks.", "A nice quiet place I found while I was walking around Alexanderplatz and needed to burn some time before my flight. I needed my last Germany meal to be official. Huge schnitzel with spätzle and mushroom cream sauce. It was a little salty but very delicious and I'm surprised I liked it as much as I did. Restrooms in the basement were very clean, staff was kind and service was fast."]

Name: Suppengrün
Summary: Cozy restaurant serving seasonally changing soups, salads & quiches, plus housemade loaves of bread.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Thursday: 7:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Friday: 7:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Such welcoming and helpful staff when a group of us visited for breakfast! They have such a range of delicious breakfast items, from scrambled eggs and baguettes, to Bircher muesli pots, fruit pots, and an assortment of croissants including vegan croissants.

Delicious hot chocolate and a marzipan croissant, and the Bircher muesli was also fresh and beautifully presented.', 'What more could you want from a place than really well constructed foods across the board..salads, soups, rolls and cakes, as earnest as a tee totaller at a wake. Service is patient and on point...the variety surprisingly wide for the size of the place. Every block on the planet should have a place like this.
BUT, they need to train in coffee making...it too is very berlin', 'One of the best restaurants in Berlin. I had the soup, salad, and a dessert. Everything made here tastes so fresh, flavorful, and good. Service is amazing! And they take credit cards.']

Name: Cana Restaurant & Catering
Summary: Meze platters & grills at a polished Middle Eastern eatery with canal-side tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['best middle eastern food tasted in Berlin, it was during middle of week, it’s next to a beautiful canal, staff speaks English as well, food is amazing a true taste of Middle East. staff is friendly and price is reasonable.', 'It’s an oriental Lebanese restaurant with all decorations and vibes .
The kofta was well seasoned and smoked.
Chicken was tender and delicious.
The meat was tender and the sauce was flavorful.
The drink wasn’t as expected but not bad as well.
The staff were really friendly with us
They accept card payments and cash too.', "This restaurant offers two dining options: a buffet, which I recommend, and à la carte selections from the menu. We opted for lunch here, finding the food tasty, albeit slightly oily. The buffet is priced at 10 euros per person, making it a great choice for a quick and economical meal. I'd suggest this place for those looking for value and convenience."]

Name: Shezan
Summary: Spicy curries & biryanis at a canalside restaurant with an annex on a richly decorated, moored boat.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['This is my first review in Berlin German and what a success it was..staff so friendly and helpful they made a chicken dansak curry for me that is not on the menu.the food was outstanding and good size portions,I highly recommend this Indian restaurant if your out and about in Berlin….', 'Really cool restaurant with amazing decorations, styles and atmosphere. The location is unique with possibility to sit directly beside the river. The food portions are big enough and reflect the prices. They provide special meals during business lunch hours (11:00 - 16:00) from Monday to Friday with only 8,90€. The food is very delicious and tasty. The restaurant is very chick and elegant. Staff are very nice and friendly and also English speaking. Highly recommended.', 'We visited this place today on a rainy evening for dinner and truth be told, we were pretty satisfied with the food. Though it was a bit confusing from the menu as the dish descriptions are not appetizing, the taste was okay.

We started with mango Lassi which was a little bland. Then our main course dishes were Chicken Mughlai and Mutton bhuna with Basmati Rice. Both tasted good. Nothing overwhelming but good. Obviously the preparations were not authentic.

We finished off with Elaichi milk tea which was okay but also lacked depth of flavor. The liquor was also pretty light.

To sum it up, room for improvement is everywhere.']

Name: Agora Restaurant
Summary: Warm, spacious eatery serving an array of Turkish, Arabian & Greek dishes, with wine & beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['super spacious restaurant located in a residential area. loved the atmosphere of families dining together, kids running around and the aroma of food from the kitchen.\n\nwe got the meat platter to share and ordered Tzatziki to cut the meatiness with acid :)', 'Great Turkish restaurant with a wide menu and very good flavours. Friendly service too!', 'Exceptional food, amazing service, very good atmosphere']

Name: Restaurant Z
Summary: Eatery with exposed brickwork & stripped wood flooring serving Mediterranean fare with Greek wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['A very nice restaurant. Real greek food, not expensive and very friendly personel geving a personal touch to the experience. Recommended!', 'I spent a nice time here with three friends.  Good starters, very good main courses, professional service, very nice.  the only drawback is the coffee that nobody liked and I drank coffee from all over the world, but this one did not taste good to me.', "Great restaurant, waiters very helpful but without bothering you too much. Proper Greek food. Probably the nicest calamari I ever had( didn't have better in actual Greece). Highly recommended for anyone looking for some Mediterranean cuisine in Berlin."]

Name: Restaurant Austria Das Original
Summary: Classic Austrian dishes in a long-running, wood-paneled tavern with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Can’t say about other dishes but the Wiener schnitzel with asparagus (seasonal menu) was delicious, and so was the red wine they suggest pairing with it!
We got recommended by friends as “the place” to try wiener schnitzel in Berlin and it didn’t disappoint…
Portions are also HUGE, even when you order the “small size”.', 'My favorite Austrian restaurant in Berlin. An institution in the Bergmannkiez. This place has been around forever. I love to sit outside in summer as well as inside in Winter. Very cosy , wooden atmosphere.

Service is good and the portions huge. I think I always go for the traditional Wiener Schnitzel. But I always get a different appetizer. I was never disappointed. Prices are ok too.', "Simple and very good. You should know what you get there for, not a huge selection, but you don't need more than that. We tried the original Wiener Schnitzel which was excellent, top-notch. And the prices are fair. Solid choice if you have been fed up with all the vegan-fusion-new age Berlin restaurants and you want something simple but excellent at the same time. Well done"]

Name: Clash
Summary: Buzzing alternative bar & club, with a beer garden & weekly menu of global bites.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['This place rules. PLENTY of space, inside and out. Good bier list (one of the only places in Berlin that serves a good Snakebite), plus pinball, pool, and foosball. The music selection is EXCELLENT, not too loud as some reviewers have said', "There were two cocktails and it was good that they were recommended. The music is rock and funky and it's a closed space.", "This classic old-style pub in Berlin is a cool spot with a vibrant crowd. However, the loud music can make conversation a challenge, requiring you to practically scream. The tables could use some more attention as they are often left uncleared. The presence of billiards and table soccer is a plus, and the mix of middle-aged folks, bros, and punk individuals adds to the unique atmosphere. The bar itself is good, and the beer is both nice and reasonably priced. Just be prepared for the high volume of the music, and don't expect a quick game of billiards, as the queue can get quite long!"]

Name: Pagode Thai Kitchen
Summary: Classic Thai curries, soups & rice dishes, served in an unfussy dining room with a giant fish tank.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['It was okay. But not really authentic in my opinion. I don’t get the hype. It’s like every other fast asian kitchen place. Self service. If you’re looking for a cheap meal and be satisfied then it’s the right place. Other than that it’s mediocre. There are much better places in Berlin to eat Thai food.', 'How does this have five stars! This is the most expensive and worst Thai food I ever ate. I ordered with Garnelen and it came with tofu. The pad Thai was just noodles in ketchup sauce and cost €17!! Avoid this place at all costs', 'I was used to order from this restaurant on Uber Eats and planning to visit in person. What a wonderful place, the food is even better on-site. It will be a regular spot for me from now on!']

Name: Hostaria del Monte Croce
Summary: Longstanding rustic-style Italian restaurant in a coach house, offering set menus.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['" Un'esperienza culinaria ricca di gusti e sapori autentici. "

If you're looking for a true taste of Italy, Hostaria del Monte Croce is the place to be.

The ambiance at Hostaria del Monte Croce is equally captivating. The rustic decor and traditional Italian artwork, creates an inviting and cozy atmosphere. Soft lighting and the gentle hum of Italian melodies in the background further enhance the dining experience, making it the perfect spot for a romantic evening or a gathering with friends and family.

The service here is impeccable, with staff who are not only attentive but also genuinely passionate about ensuring you have an unforgettable meal. They guide you through the menu with expert knowledge, making recommendations that cater to your tastes and preferences. Their hospitality is second to none, making you feel like a cherished guest in their home.

The menu at Hostaria del Monte Croce for July 2024 is a delightful journey through authentic Italian and Mediterranean flavors. Each dish, from the antipasti misti di verdure to the risotto al limone e zucchini, is crafted with fresh, high-quality ingredients that bring out a harmonious blend of tastes and textures. The combination of classic Italian dishes with innovative touches, such as the Scampo lardellato with grilled radicchio Treviso and yogurt sauce, ensures a memorable dining experience.

I can't wait to return next month to discover what new culinary delights await!', 'I visit here every time I travel to Berlin.
The atmosphere is welcoming, the staff is nice and the food is excellent. If you’re up for a good vibe evening with a fixed Italian menu, this is it.
Last time I’ve been there (Feb 24) they had a new chef and I personally think he’s way better…
Would definitely visit again in the future thank you!', 'We went for a special occasion, and loved the service, super friendly and made us feel like we belonged. Most of the food was simple but high quality, even though I expected more complexity of flavours. For the price one pays, I expected a nicer Pasta-dish for example. Making an last minute adaptation for a guest was not a problem. They use good quality ingredients, the prosciutto and melon course was excellent, but also hard to go wrong with, good melon, good prosciutto, è tutto. The bread was somewhat peculiar, as if they took a recipe for good fluffy Italian bread and then tried to make it heavy and dry (the way Germans like their bread), the halfway solution was not my cup of tea. The desert was absolutely excellent, the red wine very potable. It´s cool they have Ichnusa and the apple juice was great. Will I go back? Maybe.']

Name: Sarod's
Summary: Classic Thai curries, noodle dishes & spicy soups at a contemporary venue with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Very small portions, but good location and nice environment inside. You can try a lot of Vietnamese dishes, and they have a nice vegan menu. But I think it’s not amazing, but normal if you want eat something quick. But if you want alternative with more taste any more delicious food, try to find out anything else)))', 'Hands down for the most authentic Thai restaurant in town…. I am asian and I approve the spices here, it’s proper. There is heat in some of the dish but it is the nice kind of heat…been coming back 2 times in a week. We love it here. Service is pleasant and atmosphere is nice, good for dates. Recommend!', 'I had a really yummy Lab Ped here, my partner asked if she could have it with Tofu which they were happy to do. The Coconut Dream drink was great too. The staff were friendly with us and especially with our small infant human.\nChild seat available! Wooo']

Name: Mokkabar
Summary: Brunch, coffee & specialties like stone-oven pizza & tarte flambée in a bright cafe with a patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Perfect staff, delicious food, cozy atmosphere. Only thing is that their portions are too big. ( but fair price )', 'Our food took an hour to come out because the waitress sent the order in 20 minutes after we already ordered and the were very neglectful of my boyfriend and I even after they forgot to send in our order. The food was okay but they even forgot some parts after all that. Did not feel welcomed there, maybe because we are tourists.', 'More beautiful inside than outside. It does have a terrace, that is, tables on the sidewalk. But Gneisenaustrasse is a busy street, even though quite green. The food was ok, coffee was ok, service was quick, prices were fine.']

Name: Felix Austria
Summary: Schnitzels, goulash & other Austrian classics at a laid-back setup with wooden seating & a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Foods were alright. Schnitzel was good but the beef in goulash was too hard and too dry to eat. We sat outside for almost 15 minutes without service and had to come inside and ask to be served. Price was expensive but justified by the large portion.', 'An absolutely lovely meal! We enjoyed all of our food and basically licked our plates clean. The Spätzle was outstanding. We also really enjoyed the Gurkensalat and schnitzel. Don’t miss dessert!! Can’t wait to come back', 'Foods were excellent, we ordered veal and goulash, they were great but they forgot to dessert after making us wait for 40 min and when we asked the waitress with the glasses , she sounded very condescending. Well , food were great but service was rather mediocre.']

Name: Amici Amici
Summary: Comfy kitchen offering Italian classics & Sicilian specialties in cheerful, traditional surrounds.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['We had lunch here on a Sunday. The food was quite good. The restaurant was very full, with all tables inside and outside being completely occupied, which overwhelmed the staff. We waited a long time to get drinks and then the food. Apart from that, the staff was friendly and tried their best. We sat outside by the street, which was extremely loud as the restaurant is located on the cross section of main roads. Police cars, cars horning, etc. tainted the atmosphere.', 'It was pretty good but the food was a little bit too spicy. They have a very delicious bread with great olive oil. The staff was very nice and friendly.', 'Lovely food and good atmosphere, all dishes were really nice. I was served by Riccardo which was very attentive and friendly. Great service and food.']

Name: Maselli
Summary: Refined pastas, meaty mains & Italian wines in an intimate space with string lights & framed photos.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["Whenever I crave delicious food, this is my go-to spot. The menu changes often, keeping things fresh. They serve Sicilian wine paired perfectly with their dishes, each one meticulously crafted. The seasoning is just right, letting the ingredients shine. Whether with family or on a date, it's a great place to unwind and enjoy", "Very nice and cozy place for good Italian cuisine. The food was great, with some vegetarian options and a specials menu written on the wall. Had a nice selection of wines. The starters were the best part of the meal. The Burata salad was amazing and the seafood salad. The staff didn't know too much English but they were very nice and understanding. Highly recommend.", 'A very beautiful surprise. The service, the quality of the food, portions, price, all top. A cosy atmosphere, very well cooked, fresh and seasoned food, with amazing deserts, drinks and attentive staff. Congratulations!!! I highly recommend this place, and I will return 🌿']

Name: Han West - Home of Dumplings
Summary: Bao buns & dumplings are dished up at this compact, unassuming restaurant & takeaway.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
['Decent food. The bao bun was quite ok, the dumplings were good. The fries were good, but it was quite unusual to eat them with peanut sauce.

By the way, they have lunch options

The accept only card payment
They also speak English', 'Exceptional!
The dumplings are soft inside and nice an crispy outside, the sauce is to die for and the fries, even I had some time to get home where still crispy.
The bao is massive and filled to the brim.
Absolute highlight!', "Really nice and unique food! Ordered the Combo Box with Chicken to have a taste of everything. It was 14.50€ and very nice. The peanut sauce was really tasty, and there's no question that the dumplings and bao is good. Also, there is quite a lot of food, so you will not leave hungry if you order the combo.
Can recommend!"]

Name: Uferlos
Summary: Pizza, pasta & other Italian classics presented in an easygoing restaurant with a beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['After a fairly uneven beginning, things got endlessly better as the night went on. The menu is changed and offers something for each taste. There are week after week evolving dishes, occasionally. In the mid-year you can sit outside under cover, however, there is likewise sufficient room inside. The rosé is incredible!👍👍😍😍', "Without a doubt the best meal we have had in a while ! They are always so kind to our dog, bringing him water and sometimes a treat. The atmosphere is so cozy and warm and the lighting perfect. And the food. Wow. Really just wow. The pizza is always perfect and we had risotto di mare and it might be the best risotto I've honestly had ! Thank you :)", 'Not sure what to say. I guess it was okay. The people were very nice. Just the place was really nothing too specially. Felt empty. And the food was just the same.']

Name: Panke Culture
Summary: Casual garden setup by a brick factory covered in street art, for drinks, sandwiches & DJ music.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 – 1:00 AM, 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 – 4:00 AM, 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM, 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM
Reviews: ['Tiny yet very Berlin club. Design, music and friendly atmosphere.', "I loved the experience, I will definitely enjoy it again. The atmosphere is super queer, people don't bother you at all, it is a great space for dissent and freedom. The accessible entrance. Beer not so expensive. The only thing I could suggest is that the bathrooms were always clean. For the rest, get ready to spend an excellent night full of music to enjoy freely.", 'It is one of the most friendly places in Berlin. Amazing crew and good sound system']

Name: Burger King
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Well packed take away and friendly staff.

I had a take away meal and it’s well packed.

The staff there was very friendly and nice.

The burgers tasted just like usual, nice whoppers!', 'The kassen were not working, apparently workers are lazy. The self service machines were also out of order, only 2 out of 4 works', 'Ordered two double whopper menus and received two out of four burgers and the wrong sauce... great place']

Name: IKEA Restaurant Berlin-Tempelhof
Summary: Chain store restaurant featuring Swedish-inspired food, including classic meatball & salmon dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['A lovely ikea restaurant with nice staff and a beautiful sitting area. The schnitzel came with nice fries and a side of peas which I had not experienced at other ikeas. The dish was big and filling (enough for two people even) and the sauce options were great: the usual mustard, ketchup, many salad dressings and the best one being the Lyngonberry jam!

A solid meal that really makes a trip to ikea take up a good portion of the day and feel comprehensive.', 'Even though there is not much variety, I think the food is delicious. I especially loved the cheesecake. It gets crowded after 6pm on weekdays. Along with the cheesecake, I also tried the schnitzel, and I recommend it too. I generally like the restaurant section of IKEA stores anyway.', 'The price-quality is pretty good for the restaurant. However, the restaurant is very crowded and if you are sensible to the noise it might be overwhelming. Overall experience of the restaurant is good, toilets are clean and there was enough of soap and napkins.
Also had a negative experience with the coffee at cafe part of it. For 3 euros there is a little cup and the latte i got was more as a cappuccino.']

Name: Ariston Taverna Hellas Berlin
Summary: Restaurant with Classical pillars, a summer terrace & a smoking room plus a traditional Greek menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["The food was delicious, we ordered a mixed grill platter and all of them were delicious. I had Mousakka and I really liked it. I highly recommend it to those who like eggplant and potatoes. The napkins were very nice, attention to detail. We had our dinner outside so I can't comment on the inside of the place. The service was also very good, we were satisfied.", 'Even though the staff was really nice and friendly, I was disappointed with the experience. The Greek salad was bland making the meal unenjoyable. Unfortunately, both me and my girlfriend have also experienced stomach issues shortly after the visit, which raised concerns about food quality. I hope the restaurant takes this feedback to improve both their dishes and hygiene standards.', 'Me and my husband like the place. Big portion. Price is Expensive but worth to try. Keep up the good work. I order menu 43 Grilled lamb and my husband order menu 62 the Mix Grilled plate. Yummy!!']

Name: McDonald´s
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 7:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews: ['So I bought a McFlurry… look at this thing… is not even filled to the half… wth 🤦🏻\u200d♂️😂\n\nCome on, I understand this happens when there’s a lot of customers, ok I get it man, there’s a lot going on, you prob just looked at my order and thought “oh a single McFlurry,  I’ll make it fast,  boom, done, next” it would be ok like on a Friday or Saturday afternoon when there are a hundred of customers placing orders... But man, it’s Sunday at 11 pm 😂 the place is empty, there was nobody else… I order a single McFlurry with Lion, nothing special… and I get this half empty thing 😂 Anyway, what do u expect from Mickey Ds…', 'Minus two points for that they did not have tea at al at 10 am Monday.  There were also no soya drinks available.', "the institution is very dirty! the toilet stinks! ordered a Caesar salad, they gave a different sauce because there was no Caesar dressing! Don't give a fork to eat! napkins were not given! terribly!"]

Name: Domino's
Summary: Delivery/carryout chain offering a wide range of pizzas & a variety of other dishes & sides.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["Pizza's are very delicious friendly staff recommend it
Ajay ist the best", '5/5 for the pizza
Hollandaise Sause
Beef strips
Olives
3/5 for the strips
They were soggy :(', "Everything was ok, the pizza was delicious. The guy that took the order speaks english so I wasn't difficult to order."]

Name: Sam Yuk Gu
Summary: Laid-back eatery preparing traditional Korean BBQ, hot pot & other dishes in hip surrounds.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["Sam Yuk Gu is a fantastic spot for Korean barbecue, offering a variety of options that capture the fun of dining in Korea. The beer is great, and the friendly staff are always ready to help if you're new to Korean barbecue. The interior design is basic, and it can get quite crowded, especially in the evenings and on weekends. Despite that, I love this place and plan to bring many friends to share in the great barbecue experience.", 'We ordered no. 26 and no. 32.  and Korean fried chicken. Not very recommended. Bowls are full with salad. No.32 meat is all „Hackenfleisch“.  Taste is just okay, average in Korean food. Overall deco of the restaurant is quite Berlin style, many German, little Asien people. Maybe better try Korean BBQ. Better to reserve a table before going.', "We really enjoyed the chicken bowl and the glass noodles, reminded us of a vacation we did a few years ago when we ate something similar. The service was pretty quick and very friendly. It was a bit loud when the ambulance drove past but otherwise it's okay sitting so close to the street."]

Name: Osteria N°1
Summary: Classic pizzas, pasta & grilled seafood entrees in an easygoing osteria with a leafy courtyard.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['There is a nice summer garden, which has some kind of natural cooling system, which makes it a good choice during hot days.
Though the food is quite pricy and has dissapointed with the taste and the way it was served.
I would recommend it only for drinks and bruschetta.', 'The hopes were high for this restaurant, unfortunately expectations fell short. There is a lovely garden and I recommend reservations if you care to sit outside.

Service was quite slow. We ordered a pizza and two pasta dishes, Pappardelle with pork, and seafood spaghetti. Both pasta dishes were rather bland and the pork was extremely overcooked.  For the price the food was very disappointing.', 'The inner garden is nice, but if you want to try proper Italian food, this is definitely not the place. Also the service can be messy and slow. Yesterday we had to wait 50 minutes just for antipasti.']

Name: Mustafa's Gemüse Kebap
Summary: Popular, hearty chicken kebabs with grilled veggies, doled out from a tiny kiosk.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 2:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
['Mustafa’s Gemüse Kebab used to be my favorite kebab spot ever. Coming all the way from the Netherlands, we knew exactly when to go to avoid the long lines. We would always order two kebabs each, sometimes having them for breakfast and other times as a late-night snack. The memory of enjoying the perfect kebab for just 3 euros (back in the day; now it’s €7,10) still lingers as one of my fondest food experiences.

Unfortunately, the flavor and quality have declined. The kebab just doesn’t hit the same way anymore. The dash of lemon no longer gives that refreshing kick, the meat is not as flavorful, and the bread has become dry. My partner and I recently returned to Berlin and tried it again, only to look at each other and nod in disappointment. This kebab just isn’t the same anymore.

I don’t mind paying a more for a good meal, especially at a beloved spot like Mustafa’s, but it’s disappointing when the quality doesn’t match what it once was. Mustafa’s Gemüse Kebab no longer holds the same place in my heart—and my taste buds—as it used to.', 'A must visit place in Berlin. Very nice and friendly place to eat traditional duner in a casual atmosphere. Thoroughly enjoyed the view and food sitting at the walk way edge. People are crazy about this place and the time we left there was a long queue and everyone was waiting desperately. Very economical but full of mouth watering taste.', "Queue was extremely long, food tasted just like potatoes 😆 - Not worth the wait, but if you want to experience it, go for it.
The staff was really nice, points for it.
The portion size was also  good, but the taste just didn't cover up enough."]

Name: VINO e CUCINA
Summary: Upbeat restaurant dishing up Italian cuisine in compact surrounds with sidewalk seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["You feel at home. Gigi the owner is gentle and he sings sometimes while serving the guests. If you like true italian kitchen and atmosphere, don't miss to visit this restaurant", 'Very nice atmosphere, singing waiter, cozy and warm 😊 Nice selection of wines. The food is good, although they seem to be quite difficult with extra wishes or changes.', 'My favourite place for pasta!\nI usually refrain from ordering pasta in restaurants…but I purposely go here just for the pasta and the amazing starters. You can taste the freshness of the ingredients in every dish and the owner Luigi never disappoints when it comes to picking the perfect wine to pair the dish with.']

Name: Antonello's Cevicheria & StreetFood
Summary: Snug venue serving Italian & South American fare including ceviche, pasta & seafood, plus cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["The ambiance was cozy, and the staff were friendly and attentive. The food was delicious and well-prepared. The only downside is that they only accept cash payments, which can be a bit inconvenient. Overall, a great place to eat if you're prepared with cash", 'Pretty disappointed with the experience as they brought a meal we didn’t order. We immediately informed the waiter that said: “it’s fine, you can have it”. Then, they charged us for it.\nWe did pay the full bill without mentioning it.\nFood was good but small portions for the price and sadly, a negative experience.', 'Good food and friendly staff. Only cash in 2024! That should be forbidden.']

Name: Girasol
Summary: Relaxed Mexican eatery with colorful murals & sidewalk seats serving tacos, enchiladas & margaritas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Tasty tortilla soup, but stay way from the nachos! Taste is not bad, aside from the nachos, nothing to blow your mind, though. Friendly and attentive staff', 'I was amazed by their presentation, attentiveness, portion size and quality! Really loved the Vegetarian burrito, and the baked cheese in it surprised me. Cherry on the top was the delicious watermelon flavoured schnapps to end our lunch. Hands down recommended for all.', "The stuff were really nice, the food was tasty, the portions were quite big and the cocktails were good (especially the mango colada) if you like Mexican food you should give this place a visit and when you come make sure you're hungry, one main dish and your full.\nWe are tourists but there was no language barrier what so ever, one guy even spoke my mother tongue which was a pleasant surprise.\nWould come again but we're in Berlin just for a week :)"]

Name: Thüringer Stuben
Summary: Beef goulash, apple strudel & Thuringian beers at a traditional tavern with bench seats outside.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["I had a great German meal here. Pumpkin soup was great, cucumber salad was great. Sausage with potato was very full portion and great taste. The pasta dish wasn't amazing. Dog friendly also indoors.", 'Very good, traditional food. We tried the Eastern special dishes: lamb, rabbit, goose. Everything was perfect. Here you can have real German quality beer. Around all this good stuff to eat and drink, a nice and cozy atmosphere is built to make you feel a bit less in Berlin and a bit more in the heart of Germany.', "The staff it's so nice and the food incredible good and typical. If you want some of the best local stuff this place is higly recocmend\nWine and beer stunning as well"]

Name: Liebling - Café & Bar
Summary: Artisan coffee, cakes & salads, plus wine & beer, in a compact, relaxed venue with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['We just arrived in Berlin and found this welcoming nice spot. Beside the nice drinks they also provided us with some late night snacks. The humus is really good!', 'Delicious breakfast.. eggs were just perfect.. Will be back!!', 'Unbelievably rude behavior from the waiter- don’t ruin your night there
Sometimes the only thing that you ask is to find a place to enjoy peacefully a drink and catch up with your friends. So simple! But unfortunately for some people it’s not as simple.

We were 5 friends going there to get a drink. It was not our first time visiting this bar. The drinks took actually quite some time to arrive..almost half an hour after our drinks arrived and just when he saw that one of the 5 drinks was over the waiter came to ask if he should bring new ones. We said kindly not yet. We can call you if we need something. This behavior happened 3 times in half an hour!! And every time he was more intense. Just before we all finish our drinks he came and said that there are people waiting and we should leave to free the space! because “we didn’t drink fast and enough”. What?!! It’s even more surprising that they think they can treat people like this and nobody will react against this unacceptable behavior. He even said with pride and irony that we can complain to his boss and even what his name is if we want to use it for a review. Such a behavior definitely worth 0 stars. It’s quite dangerous how some bars feel strong and powerful because we -the people- have supported them and then they treat the customers with arrogant disrespectful behavior feeling untouchable. But even little reviews can inform others and at least rescue them from ruining their night

Edit: apparently the response of the owner below that accepts the complaints, apologizes and offers a free brunch IS NOT goodwill neither valid since google forwarded to me the complaint for defamation!!! And applying access restriction because of expressing my complaint against the unbelievable rude behavior of the waiter. Proof that is extremely important to share any experience']

Name: Al Hamra
Summary: Bright corner cafe for Middle Eastern meze, wraps & salads, with a weekend brunch.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Location is their saving grace with a decent drinks menu. Service is warm if absent (better to walk up to them to get things like cutlery in a timely manner, after food arrives). Local competition on hummus and flat bread left me feeling disappointed, this was notably basic.', 'I loved this place. It was some of the best hummus I’ve had. The environment is a beautiful welcoming environment with amazing decor. There were people of all nationalities ages and cultures here and the food was perfect for what I needed at the time. I had a great pomegranate salad and a chicken and rice dish that was beautiful.', '"Hands down one of the best bars in Berlin! The staff is incredibly friendly, always ensuring top-notch service. The vibes here are unbeatable, creating the perfect atmosphere for a great time. And let\'s not forget their fantastic Arak selection – a definite must-try! Can\'t recommend it enough! 🍹🎉"']

Name: Trattoria Zoe
Summary: Stone-oven pizza, pasta, classic mains & Italian wine at an elegant restaurant popular for brunch.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['This is probably the worst bruschetta I have tasted. The way it is presented is also bad. I took a bite and threw the rest away.', 'The last minute of a great night, our tattooed waitress gave us the cold shoulder. For that I reward you with one star. Congratulations', 'Got the carbona after someone in the reviews raved about it. Ordered some bruschetta for starters. When that arrived I already started worrying about the place, it was on a piece of pizza bread, really basic and without any love for food. The carbonara was fairly bland but not a complete trainwreck. My partners scampi linguine literally tasted like cardboard. The couple scampi\'s were accompanied by supermarket precooked shrimps. I can\'t understand how people rated this as a good restaurant, the grumpy "Berliner Schnauze" waiter almost threw the plates on our table and the whole place just screams tourist trap.']

Name: Restaurant Bricole
Summary: Sophisticated, high-end restaurant featuring innovative 5-course dinners with global influence.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Bricole truly lives up to its Michelin star rating! From start to finish, our dining experience here was exceptional. The dishes were expertly crafted and bursting with flavor, showcasing the chef's culinary prowess. Despite its prestigious accolades, the ambiance at Bricole is refreshingly casual, allowing diners to relax and enjoy their meal without feeling overly formal. Personal favorites included the snow crab, cauliflower, and beef dishes – each one a culinary masterpiece. If you're looking for a memorable date night dining experience in a laid-back setting, Bricole is the place to be!", "In short: all around great experience with minor drawbacks
The food was in line with what you'd expect from a 1 star place. Especially the beef and the crab-cake starter were real highlights for us. However, some courses had clashing flavours were elements of the dish completely disappeared which was a bit disappointing to see.
The portion sizes are also on the smaller side even for fine dining which was a little disappointing when you want to dig into something you enjoyed.
Service was friendly and attentive but the whole experience took us 3.5hrs. It seems that all courses are served at the same time for all guests so if you come early you better have a lot of conversation topics.", "The food here is excellent, and the wait staff was stellar. When I'm in Berlin again, this is the place I'll go to for dinner. Isabelle was my server and she was absolutely outstanding , great wine recommendations and a wealth of knowledge of the menu. The gilthead and Nebraska beef courses were absolutely out of this world . The mackerel dish was sadly quite fishy, and the dessert course was a little too sweet and didn't quite taste like a classic dessert, but other than that every other course was AMAZING. I am very much looking forward to coming back. This restaurant definitely earned its Michelin star."]

Name: Bu Kon
Summary: Family-run restaurant offering classic Vietnamese dishes in a cozy, laid-back atmosphere.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['The food was quite good and the staff was very friendly there. Authentic Vietnamese food.', 'Food was amazing! Everything was freshly made, prices not very high, nice choice of food and drink, the service was awesome', 'I love this place, quick service, food is always tasty, (I’ve tried maybe 1/4 of the menu at this point and have enjoyed it all), and really reasonably priced.']

Name: Birra - Italian Craft Beer
Summary: Informal hangout with outdoor seating offering bottled & draft Italian craft beers, plus panini.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['This is a small Italian pub with 10 types of beer on tap. Here you can try the rare smoked stout, rye beer, or raspberry beer without syrup, which are hard to find in Berlin. In addition to Italian beer, you can also enjoy German and French varieties. The staff is very welcoming. Seats fill up within the first 10 minutes after the bar opens, so make sure to arrive right at 6 PM. The prices are affordable. We will definitely come back here again.', "They have really good snacks and paninis, the beer options are very good. Usually you can't find many places in Berlin where you have good tap beers and finger foods.", 'The vegan sandwich is amazing, and the beers as well. The service is great because the people that work there are smile and nice. The prices are fair. I recommend.']

Name: China Restaurant Laoxiang
Summary: Dumplings, soups & a long menu of traditional dishes in an elegant dining room with Chinese motifs.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['Laoxiang is definitely one of the best Chinese restaurants in Berlin. We came for their Sunday brunch deal; 16€ per person for three dishes and free green tea. The food is authentic as you can get!! They are delicious and the portions are huge. I’d highly recommend to skip breakfast if you are planning to take the Sunday brunch deal.

Pro tip: you must come early around 11 am to get a table, otherwise you’ll need to queue.', "I ate here years ago and I think it used to be better. The soup dumplings were not very juicy,  The Kung Pao chicken was generous but the mildest I've ever had. Almost no chillies, really weak hints of Sichuan peppercorns and doesn't look at all like in the menu.
It wasn't bad but definitely not a place to come back to", 'Ordered mapo tofu for 14€, says with “pork and chili sauce”, but WHERE IS HACKFLEISCH ?!?! Was only garlic and chili powder, not a single meat.
Looks sooo different from the picture in the wolt app']

Name: Delizie D’Italia
Summary: Warm, informal Italian restaurant featuring checkered tablecloths, outdoor seating & daily menus.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["Great pasta and even greater service. They really treat you well, they enjoy what they do, they want you to have a good time. Will come here more often.\n\nYou can really feel that it's a family run business.", 'Very authentic Italian food. We had the liver which was amazing and the truffle and ragu pastas too. The staff was also super nice to us', "Very good Italian food in Prenzlauer Berg. Pesto Sauce is one of my favorites for sure! The pasta is always al dente, and good quality. The staff is friendly and the environment is cozy. Don't forget to try the Tiramisu."]

Name: Kanaan
Summary: Meat-free Israeli & Palestinian sharing platters with homemade pita & hummus in a laid-back space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['We had researched vegetarian restaurants before our trip to Berlin. This venue was highly recommended and we throughly enjoyed our visit. We booked a table in advance and we took a tram from the centre of Berlin and it was hen only a short walk from the tram stop to the restaurant.
