There were many people sitting around the pavements nearby eating food they had taken away from the restaurant.The food was excellent and the staff very friendly and helpful when we were deciding what to order, guiding us regarding portion sizes suitable for the size of our party. Were we to visit Berlin again, we would not hesitate to return to the restaurant.', 'Everything was amazing. Best hummus I’ve had in Berlin. The portions were bigger than expected', 'Our favourite Berlin restaurant - unfortunately you did not live up to our expectations this time around.

Tonight we went for the belly dancing show and set menu offer.

Positives first:
Very generous portions, be prepared for a big feast and lots of lovely flavours!
Their lemonade is very fresh and delicious, definitely recommended as a refreshing aperitif.
The belly dancer show was so energetic, excited that we finally got to see it! Great fun!

Our prior experience, both at the old location and new, has been nothing but positive. Attentive staff, busy vibe and amazing food. However, there were some issues this time around that has made us wondering if this was our last visit.

Our reserved slot was 18.00 to 20.00. We were welcomed and seated immediately upon arrival but then had to wait nearly 20 minutes before staff took drink orders. The starter wasn’t served until almost an hour after we arrived. To our knowledge at the time this left us possibly with only an hour to finish a 9 course meal. The dessert was served at about 20.00, so luckily it wasn’t as tight as feared.
Yet again when we had finished our meal we also had to wait a long time at the bar to get to pay our bill.

Unfortunately staff did not have time to pay much attention to our table during our stay. By the time we left staff had not taken a single drink-order from us, we had to make the request and generally it took some effort and waiting to communicate, as they were super busy running back and forth. Even presenting the menu and taking orders they appeared in a rush, talking very fast and «on the go».

Starter:
The seasoned bread was nice but dry. Some of the dishes that we expected to be served warm arrived cold at the table. Unsure if it was supposed to be like that, but the grilled cauliflower, falafel and roasted potatoes would have been nice served warm. The potatoes were somewhat chewy and falafel was not moist like before, unfortunately dry. The hummus was lovely, like before, however served with much added tahini now which camouflaged the hummus flavour and made it somewhat bland.

Mains:
By the time our mains arrived we were starting to feel full already. So great value for money, but quite overwhelming.

Dessert:
Coconunt pannacotta with pistachio crumble and a fruit sauce was lovely, but then again we were very, very full at this point.

All in all we spent the majority of our visit waiting, and less time enjoying the food and taking the time to process and taste the lovely foods and flavours. Such a shame.

The large portions are great if you have a big appetite and are a fast eater. We could’ve enjoyed half the size and therefore miss the opportunity of a la carte.

The belly dancer was definitely a highlight, thank you for the entertaining show and spreading love!

Edit: Would like to add that the staff was very friendly also this time. They were constantly running and probably did as best as they could given the number of staff available and dinner set-up, serving a full restaurant within a very short time frame.']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 7:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews: ['My last visit to McDonald’s was disappointing. The music was loud and sometimes stressful, making it hard to listen or have a conversation. Inside it was very cold, with cleanliness needing improvement.\nThe food especially the fries were also underwhelming, served lukewarm and lacking freshness.', 'Food was disgusting. Chips were greasy and had an unusual taste. Coke was flat and no ice.', "Macdonlads illiterate staff says to all courier's wolt uber and liferando that we will never give bag for drinks. We have question that how can i hold drinks our hand . You must give a separate bag for drinks. Your staff is behaviour is something wrong for couriers"]

Name: La Piccola
Summary: Laid-back cafe with a patio offering pizza, Italian pasta & meat dishes & Middle Eastern bites.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Friday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 10:30 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['An impulsive pizza craving brought us here. The staf was so friendly to help us close to midnight. Now we are enjoying a pizza and focaccia.

Next time we will bring cash, so they would be more happy with us.

Till next time', 'Very tasteful food, menu offers variety of dishes, portions are big and in good prices.', 'I’m based in Italy so an Italian restaurant in Berlin is a little bit atypical for me! However we went here because we were starving. The menu is brought into a lot of non-Italian dishes too. The service is good and the waiters are really friendly, they check up on you quite often to see everything is working out smoothly but the wait is a bit long. We ordered the garlic soup which was good. The bruschette were made with fresh tomatoes and sapory olive oil. The pasta was a bit over cooked (I like it al dente) but I think you can easily ask them to cook it to your favorite extent. Overall, it’s a good place for decent food and reasonable prices!']

Name: Zhong Hua
Summary: Old-fashioned choice with traditional decor serving Cantonese classics & Thai options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Went in randomly because it had average ratings. I ordered a soup and a salad which have nothing to do with any cooking skills or Chinese cuisine. The soup is literally an instant soup with noodles you cook in the microwave, and pieces of not fresh chicken. The salad was some sad German kraut. They give you forks to eat with 🥲', 'This place is fire. I live in the land of 50 Chinese restaurant in a 15 km radius. No joke. This food is really good. Nice change from the other food here. Brovo.', 'I really liked this restaurant. Everything was good. It looks like a typical authentic Chinese restaurant and has the decor of one as well. The food tastes really good and the serving is good as well. Prices are economical enough for Berlin. The owner (and I presume the server) is very kind and friendly. The whole place has the vibe of a family run restaurant and not of a profit minded restaurant that’s just there for milking money.']

Name: Delhi 6 Restaurant - Berlin
Summary: Delhi street food-inspired Indian dishes at a lively, colorfully decorated venue with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['We had lunch at Delhi 6 Restaurant on our final day in Berlin, and it was a fantastic experience! We ordered the Veg Thali, which came with three curry dishes—Paneer Korma, Mixed Veg, and Chole—and added a Paneer Onion Kulcha as an extra. All the dishes were absolutely amazing, bursting with authentic flavors and rich taste.\n\nI must say, the Paneer Onion Kulcha was one of the best I’ve had outside India in many years—perfectly prepared and truly delicious. Thank you for such a delightful meal. We highly recommend Delhi 6 to anyone looking for an authentic Indian dining experience in Berlin!', 'I have been wanting to try Indian cuisine for a long time, where you can taste a variety of dishes in small portions. Finally, I got the chance. Everything was delicious. Especially the chicken and lamb. The chicken biryani was tasty as a whole dish. The rice and vegetables were cooked well. However, the chicken itself seemed average in the chicken biryani. The Mango Lassi was fabulous. At our request, the waiter provided a high chair for our child. We were sitting in the side extension. They opened the shutters there, and when it became hot, the air created a pleasant coolness. We really enjoyed the Indian cuisine. I definitely recommend this place to those who were nearby the Jewish Museum.', 'Delicious.  This was our first experience trying authentic Indian food for my son and I, and we loved it! The Delhi 6 Special #23 was amazing.  Thank you so much for an excellent meal.']

Name: Nobel Restaurant
Summary: Basic eatery offering burgers, pizza, pasta, salads & more, plus an expansive outdoor seating area.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["Good experience. Very nice pasta with a fair price.\n\nNeed to improve on a few things like the clutery cleaning. Both forks we took at first were completely dirty. The toilet is available to the public but it's also a place where some things are stored.", 'Very yummy dishes in fair price. Friendly staff. Kind of self-serving. Good for quick meal.', 'Very delicious food, good service, nice personnel and surprisingly cheap. Only the toilets are a bit uncomfortable but everything else is great! I absolutely recommend!']

Name: NaNum
Summary: Elevated Korean cuisine served on trendy dishware in an airy, bi-level space with a leafy patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 2:00 PM, 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["You can  have a chance to enjoy premium and being like authentic Korean cousine. It is differentiated from normal Korean restaurant.  A kind of Michelin style Korean experience under the owner's philosophy who has majored vocal music at the berlin university and studied ceramic art and made all food utensils by herself!", 'Went for dinner on a Saturday evening, ordered the fish menu. Food was absolutely amazing. Brutalistic concrete decor juxtaposed with delicate and beautiful ceramics (that often compliment the texture of the foods served in them). Impeccable yet relaxed service. Wine pairings mostly good, sometimes great. Owner is such an interesting and lovely person. Would definitely recommend a visit!', "One of the best dinner experience I've had in my life! Definitely recommend. Extremely welcoming and friendly staff! The taste is out of this world amazing. Every detail and thought in the menu is outstanding and we'll thought with a gentle touch by the heart.\nIf you're seeking a nice fancy dinner that will rock your world, this is the place to come 🫴\nDefinitely recommend and will come back 🧡"]

Name: Café Dix in der Berlinischen Galerie in Kreuzberg
Summary: Globally inspired bites offered in a bright, modern space within an art museum with outdoor seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ["Nice, not great café but definitely decent. The soup was delicious, and nicely served with a drizzle of olive oil and herbs, I just wish they would've told me about the sour cream as I would've asked without it due to my milk intolerance. There was also no other gluten free food at all, just the soup, not even a brownie. The waitress did her best to be nice but also seemed very stressed, probably not her fault but more that it was probably understaffed.", 'Our pasta was really tasty (liked the spicy touch). The coffee and cake was also good. Service was friendly but a bit slow, probably because they are understaffed...\nWe definitely can recommend this place for a little lunch/ coffee break 👍☕🍝', 'Terrible sunday morning experience. Thet staff here is completely ignorant and arrogant. On a dark winter day I turned on the little table light and the waiter to turn it off again with a very bossy and unfriendly tone.\nFoodwise: the new york cheese cake was extremely small for its high price. The coffee was totally average. Never again.']

Name: La Sardegna
Summary: Laid-back choice with an old-school vibe serving pizza, pasta & classic Italian meat & fish courses.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['The best part about this restaurant is the atmosphere and the service. All the waiters were very kind. The food was mediocre and overpriced for the quality. I felt the meat wasn’t as fresh as it could be.', 'I had the best salad ever ,the service was top notch 👌, the atmosphere was fantastic, and the food was delicious, had a very lovely dinner with hubby', 'Excellent food. Ambience is all about aroma… want you to order your wine and settle down with some seafood. Pizza and calamari was top notch.']

Name: Baba đu Restaurant
Summary: Hip eatery in an industrial-style space with outdoor tables serving sushi & familiar Asian dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["Nice selection of dishes. We initially came there because we saw pictures of Sushi in Google, however this place no longer offers sushi. But the other dishes we tried were good. The prices were IMHO higher as usual in this area, but the main dishes are really large and satisfying.\nIt's quite well located, near a tram station.\nIt's recommended to reserve a table before coming.", 'Solid Asian restaurant in Pankow, and for me, one of the best in the area. The menu has great choices, and the portions are generous. Prices have gone up a bit, but this is not surprising, especially considering the current inflation. Still a go-to spot for satisfying Asian cuisine!', "Nice atmosphere and very delicious food. We had salmon teriyaki dish and another dish with meat and noodle. They were both very delicious and big portion. Usually I don't get full from eating fish but the salmon piece they gave was very big. The oyster mushrooms in my dish were also super delicious. Moreover the waiters were also very polite. I can't recommend this restaurant enough!"]

Name: Bornholmer Hütte
Summary: Old-school joint offering German pub eats, local brews, a pool table & nine-pin bowling.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ['No nonsense down to earth original Berliner Bierkneipe (a beer pub) that serves the local lager beers and an assortment of spirits as well as a small selection of typical Street food. The walls are still tar stained to a brown yellow and smoking was still permitted inside the guest area. Service was friendly and welcoming.', 'The place is super smokey and the ambience not really nice. BUT they have a really old Kegelbahn from 1904 downstairs, which is just awesome to play on. For this you need to make a reservation though!', 'Fantastic authentic Berlin bar with friendly staff. Also very nice to watch football 🍺⚽ They even have a ninepin bowling alley 🎳']

Name: Tbilisi
Summary: Georgian venue with wooden decor, serving chachapuri dumplings, lobiani bread & a choice of grappas.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['What a wonderful restaurant!  We were so impressed with the food and the service--the wait staff was so friendly.  We started with an order of Khatschapuri Spinatit to share and each of us ordered our own dishes as well.  We all thought the food was delicious.  Their Georgian wine is excellent as well.  The prices are definitely reasonable given the great service and quality of the food.', 'Came there for an impromptu dinner. The outside tables were full (or reserved) so we agreed to sit inside next to the window and move later but ended up staying inside. Good at the end, could observe all the traditional decorations and learn a bit about Georgian culture.

The staff was extremely nice and helpful.

We asked for katchapuri, khinkali with cheese (never seen this anywhere else), a beetroot salad (great for a starter) and a chicken in a sauce. It was a lot even for the 3 of us. Depends how hungry you are but 3 dishes to share for three people should be enough. It was very well made and we also got to show the Georgian cuisine for the first time to our friend, which he loved.', 'This place is simply marvelous and one of my favorite restaurants in Berlin. The cozy atmosphere, filled with nooks, crannies, and candlelight, creates a warm and inviting setting.  have been to Tbilisi multiple times, and I love the authentic Georgian dishes, especially the khinkali and katchapuri. Just remember to order them a day in advance since they take time to prepare. I have laughed here, celebrated, and savored every bite. While it is a bit pricey and the food takes time, the wonderful company makes it well worth the wait.']

Name: OMONI 오 모 니
Summary: Simple, wood-lined environment with counter seating, offering sushi, sashimi & rice dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing sushi place.
Probably I would keep the crown of best sushis of Berlin between them and Sasaya.
Loved the super fresh fish, delicious combinations, perfectly cooked rice, beautiful ceramics and a lovely, calm and peaceful atmosphere.
Extra kudos for an AC (not so common in Berlin) and for being pet friendly.
Absolutely wonderful experience, can only recommend!
Thanks for the great service as well.', 'Wow, if you are looking for some amazing and authentic sushi in Berlin, I definitely recommend this restaurant. Make sure to book your table as it can get packed and it’s so worth it! It’s a chill spot where you can enjoy some great sushi for a great price.', 'Absolutely bizarre experience very badly handled by inexperienced staff.

This is not a food review as we werent served. We were visiting our friend in Berlin who reserved the table for us a week in advance. He’s been to this restaurant many times and is (was) a loyal customer.

When we showed up they told us that our name is not on the list and that they dont have any table for us (most of the tables were still free as the people didnt show up for their reservations).

They even asked my friend to show a call log to prove that he called. Which he did! It was an obvious mistake on the part of this restaurant’s staff, but instead of serving a customer who was already in the restaurant and arranging us a table while rescheduling someone who had a reservation later, they just behaved silly, repeating the same „we see you called but the list..” like a broken record.

We finally left because it was clear they were incapable of correcting their mistake and found much better option for dinner at the end.']

Name: North Andes Coffee | Prenzlauer Berg
Summary: Snug, straightforward source for premium coffees made from Colombian beans roasted on-site.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
['One of the best coffee spots in Berlin! Every drink is made with two shots, so you get real coffee, not just a flavored drink. Definitely a new go-to for me!', 'The most excellent coffee in Berlin can be found at this café. Cappuccino and flat white are indeed coffee-based beverages with a robust flavor profile. After visiting this cafe, you will find it difficult to enjoy any other coffee in Berlin. Additionally, they offer pastel de natas with chocolate, which are both delicious and not excessively sweet. The baristas are polite, and the service is prompt. The prices are quite reasonable considering the exceptional quality provided (Cappuccino €3.50, flat white €3.60).', 'The coffee I had was flat white to go and I was perfect for my taste. Creamy delicious tonic for my sleepy body!

I had also one Columbian enpanada, that was with chicken filling. Was not properly warm or spiced enough for my taste, but otherwise fresh.

Service also was very friendly and there is enough space inside or on the outer table to sit and chill. That makes the place a gem find in a busy city area.']

Name: A Mano
Summary: Refined choice serving Italian staples such as pasta, fish & meat plates, plus a robust wine list.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["I guess the guy thought he was funny because I didn't speak very good Italian in Germany so he thought he could be slick rude to me. I understood every word. The rest of the staff seemed very nice. He probably should be able to find another job since he speaks so many languages. It might be the reason more people were at the Italian restaurant just a few meters away instead.", 'Probably our best meal of our trip to Berlin. Great service from the (English speaking) waiters. The food was fantastic. Great atmosphere sitting outside on a warm dinner evening. Thoroughly recommended. Not many vegetarian options though.', 'Service was amazing and really funny. The food was amazing. The steak was cooked amazing and just like we asked. The pasta was nothing wow, but really nice and with really balanced tastes. The arugula and cherry tomatoes salad was really nice (simple but nice). For sure would visit again.']

Name: Sofia Bar
Summary: Convivial restaurant with sidewalk tables, serving up grilled meats, plus Bulgarian salads & wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["I'm no specialist in Bulgarian cuisine, so I won't give my opinion regarding the flavors of the dishes, but I can attest to the quality of the ingredients. I ordered the pork skewers, and it's a well established fact that pork in Germany is excellent. Well, they have the worst quality pork I've ever seen here. Half of it was not meat, just fat and cartilage. Uneatable.
Cash only.", 'Good Bulgarian food with very friendly staff

I recommend the Schaschlik', 'Great and authentic food, beautiful setup, friendly and involved hosts . Awesome for a traditional Bulgarian experience. Hosts are happy to help with special dietary requirements where necessary.']

Name: VIET HA - Goldener Karpfen
Summary: Simple eatery serving sushi & pan-Asian mains in compact, unassuming surroundings.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["It's a cosy Vietnamese restaurant. The food is really good and has a great quantity. Great ambience and polite service. Highly recommend. It's a few meters from Strausberg platz U bahn. I don't know if it's available on wolt, I have added the menu as well.", 'This little restaurant is one of my favorite ones around the neighborhood! The staff is always so kind and friendly and the portions are huge and very tasty!

5/5 🙂', 'This is perfect restaurant to treat your taste buds for Vietnamese food. I being a frequent visitor to this place have tried multiple Vietnamese dishes and have to say they are worth it for the price they are offering.

The staff working here is really helpful and if you are first time visitor to this place they will help you to choose a perfect dish according to your interest.

This place offers both veg and non-veg food so you have big menu to try from.

Always served piping hot and freshly prepared noodles, chicken and veg options. You can visit here for breakfast, Lunch and Dinner.

The payment can be made by card or cash depending on the option you have available with you.

And most importantly, they have both English as well as German Menu Card so they can serve a large number of customers( yes, staff speaks fluent English 😀 and obviously German).

Enjoy your dish and hit like if you find this review helpful.

Tschüss 🤟🏼']

Name: Vesuvio
Summary: Stone-oven pizzas, classic dishes & Italian wines in a wood-lined space with terrace tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['We love this place!

By far our favourite restaurant we have been to in Berlin.

The food is incredible,  especially the pizza 🍕

The service is top class, we felt so welcomed every time we came to have food 👨‍🍳

A very classy restaurant with good food and great service, highly recommend!!', 'The food tastes very good, and all the staff are very friendly, if you want good Italian pizza, pasta, and food I really can recommend this place.', 'Really good tasty food, I had a reallyyy generous portion of carbonara and was not able to finish it, even though it was delicious! All the rest was also perfect, positive stuff was bringing good mood, nice cozy atmosphere, not a lot of tables (which is great for me personally). Highly recommended for a date']

Name: Chuan House
Summary: Informal dining room filled with intricate, Asian-inspired decor & furnishing Chinese specialties.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: Closed, Friday: Closed, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: 5:30 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['The food is really good. I had just a few starter today but will come back for more! Had some wan tan, dumplings, and dim sum. For real origin spiced food, this is a good place to go.
If it says spicy at this place, it means Asian typ of spicy (dragon dance on your tongue)  not european ahh a bit of spicy is OK I can stand it.

The host was quite busy, but still in a good mood and was able to read my mind to have another coke before I was able to order one 😀

Will come back soon, for sure!', "Delicious and flavoured Chinese dishes. The place is nicely decorated, Chinese style, and it has a good selection of meals. We got the R2 and H2, they were both extremely tasty. We also tried the eggplants under the vegetarian dishes, which was good but not as good as the other main courses.
The place is now on my shortlist of Chinese restaurants in Berlin. I'll surely visit soon this fine restaurant again.
A clear recommendation from my side!", 'WOW! What a hidden gem in Alexanderplatz. I have found Chinese/Asian style restaurants to be very hit and miss across Europe. But this is so FRESH, you won’t mind the wait for the courses!

Even though there was a language barrier, I politely wrote down on my phone my order and they were happy to use this!

Definitely a revisit next time I’m in Berlin. The prices cannot be missed aswell!']

Name: Volkskammer
Summary: Concept restaurant inspired by East Berlin, with meaty dishes prepared by chefs from the former GDR.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
["The place is very atmospheric. The food is great, I'd like to highlight the goulash, it's really delicious. Just a note: jagerschnitzel is very simple and there's no meat in it. Don't expect it to be tasty. But I still leave 5 stars because it's supposed to be like that. Other dishes (like goulash) have real and tasty meat though", 'As an Eastern European, I have to say they did a great job! The restaurant feels really authentic. They used to be situated exactly like this on the floor level in a communist bloc of apartments. The decoration is a lot, which takes away some of the authenticity, but I understand why. The details are so fun, I love it! The food and service are also very good!
Overall, it was a great experience and it is worth a visit!', "Despite good reviews on maps, visiting Volkskammer in Berlin offers an immersive dive into a GDR-themed ambiance, complete with dim lighting and quirky, communist block-style decor. Unfortunately, the dining experience didn't match the interesting setting.
The schnitzel was disappointing, made from breaded ham instead of fresh pork, and the penne was overly simplistic, tasting mainly of ketchup and sweetness.
Additionally, being charged 4 euros for still water felt excessive. The service was adequate, and the only consolation was the quick arrival of our meals, which was a relief as we were eager to leave."]

Name: Bierhof Rüdersdorf
Summary: Relaxed, convivial beer garden offering picnic tables & couches, plus beer, coffee & finger foods.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['A local Biergarten with good atmosphere, cool crowd and clubbing music, in the yard of the Berghain & Lab.oratory clubs. Reasonable prices (0.5 L Bier: 4.5 €, Hamburger: 7.5 €, Pommes: 3 €).', 'Nice bar with a rooftop next to Berghain. No card accepted so make sure you have spare change for a beer.', 'Perfect spot to relax with a beer and snack in Berlin!']

Name: Panda Meister Berlin Ostbahnhof
Summary: Humble counter-serve snack shack doling out Chinese treats, such as dumplings & bubble tea.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 10:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 10:30 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
['The food, atmosphere and service are extremely authentic! The male cook is businesslike and a little chaotic, but very fast and good! The lady is smiling and charming, throwing in some Chinese words. The prices are great, especially for the dumplings - which are probably their specialty and most ordered dish.', "Panda Meister is a hidden gem (but I guess everyone knows already this place). This food truck serves up the most delicious dumplings I've ever had, with a perfect balance of tender, flavorful fillings and delicate wrappers. The pork and veggie dumplings are a standout, bursting with juicy goodness. The dipping chili sauces are the perfect complement, adding an extra layer of flavor. Service is quick and friendly, making it an ideal spot for a tasty, on-the-go meal. To top it off, the lady is always nice and friendly. If you love dumplings, you need to go here ASAP!!", "Good dumplings for good affordable price. The place may looks a little rough but doesn't reflect the food quality at all. It even makes it more authentic. The service is quick and very friendly. The food overall was delicious and filling. The bubble tea is alright but not my taste. It had too much syrup in it. All in all I can recommend everyone who like street food Chinese style.
Also i recommend the other food stalls there. This won't be my last visit and will definitely try Mapo Tofu next time.

Side note: you can also pay electronically (credit card, apple pay etc.). Very convenient."]

Name: Sigiriya
Summary: Warm, understated restaurant specializing in traditional Sri Lankan meals & desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['the kottu was pretty good, not exceptional and definitely needed more salt, and more flavour in general. the curries looked super good though and menu was typically Sri Lankan.
sweet staff, nice chill local vibe. would come again to have hoppers & curry 😇
(half vegan menu, half that you can add meat or fish :))', "Went on Saturday evening no crowd at all.  Get plain Hoppers which are soggy and blent Don't recommended) and nothing is provided to dip in
And vadai is also not tasty at all but served with jam but a good combo

We Get mutton biryani and chicken biriyani
But its not buriyani at all
Just chicken curry and mutton curry mixed with basmati rice with excess oil.
They use an excess amount of salad that does not cut the stems of the leaves also very uncomfortable to eat

Service was good", "”Sigiriya” is an absolute must-visit Sri Lankan restaurant for anyone seeking a delightful culinary adventure in Berlin, Germany. From the moment I stepped in, I was transported to Sri Lanka with the restaurant's cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. The service was impeccable - the staff were incredibly wonderful, lovely, and kind, making me feel right at home.

But the true star of the show is the food. Absolutely amazing.  Sigiriya's dishes are mouthwatering and spectacular.  Every bite was a delicious explosion of flavors.

If you're looking for an unforgettable Sri Lankan dining experience that combines exquisite food with exceptional service, look no further than ’Sigiriya’ restaurant.

Their hospitality is truly unmatched, and I wholeheartedly recommend this Sri Lankan restaurant to anyone who visit Berlin. Defenitely we will visit you again. Cheers! (Sam & Ruwi - Sweden🇸🇪)"]

Name: Kurhaus Korsakow
Summary: Rustic haunt with wood tables & outdoor seating, serving regional German dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['was surprised by how much i enjoyed my meal here; it’s casual and classy, the staff are really lovely and service was seamless, and the food was amazing - the ‘64 degrees egg’ starter was an absolute standout! so savoury and creamy and a bit cheesy. the food is served beautifully and the mains were also delicious. the price is completely worth the quality of everything. literally have no complaints.', 'It is a great place with friendly staff and a cozy atmosphere. Real candles on the tables and fresh flowers. Places are comfortable and food and drinks are very good. Maybe a bit on expensive side, but I would say that is worth the price. We were a group of 7 people and were quite comfortable. Staff is friendly  and not invasive. It is also a very good location. Tram stop is not far.', 'Lovely restaurant with amazingly delicious German food. I was happily surprised by the quality/price rate.']

Name: Plusminusnull (+-0) Restaurant Bar Lounge
Summary: Pasta dishes, salads & burgers, plus breakfasts & cocktails, in a modern locale with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Nice atmosphere on a cool street. Perfect for evening or night chilling.\nThe cocktails were really good too.', '5 stars for the place designated for smoking, and you find yourself in the warmth while the street outside is covered with snow. The waiters are very nice. The place is beautiful. I recommend it in summer and winter. I like the place that cares about the comfort of its customers.🌷', 'Familial size of foods could easily satisfied many couples and families, the savor is also adequate. General good selection of foods, but the service is bit of slow.']

Name: Café Tasso - Das andere Antiquariat
Summary: Cafe with modern artwork, a selection of used books, newspapers & magazines, plus regular events.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["Highly recommend eating here, they have both light sweet/salty breakfast and more consistent food, plus great selection of cakes, including many vegan ones. I recommend the lentil soup. I also got the vegan breakfast but I didn't like they mix fruits with veggies. Plus the view over the window is great. Unfortunately didn't find any book to like", 'Lovely and cosy cafe near U-Bahn Frankfurter Tor. Beautiful and appealing interior. Currently you can have coffee inside with covid test, but outside, on the terrace you can stay without any tests. Tasty and beautifully decorated breakfast. Especially tasty fresh baked, and still warm croissants. Also friendly service. Beautiful place! Thank you :) Btw, there is also books store and shelfs with cheap, second hand books to buy.', 'A pleasant café place along Frankfurter Allee in Berlin- Friedrichshain, with an integrated book store/sale. We stopped for a espresso & cappuccino and enjoyed both. There is some cake (nothing extraordinary) and some breakfast plates. The lady serving us was friendly and smiling. In some side rooms books were offered and a flyer with events was placed at each table. We will definitely check some of these musical events soon.']

Name: euphoria Restaurant Bar
Summary: Cocktails, Italian staples & a popular Sunday brunch at an industrial-chic space with a big terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['We went for family dinner on the Christmas Eve 🌲 We ordered a couple beers and a Long Island Ice Tea for drinks. For dinner we just went for the main course item. We got a beef steak 🥩, pork steak, halloumi salad 🥗 and a Euphoria burger 🍔 with fries 🍟. The food was amazing, so was the service. Being a burger fanatic, I personally loved their burger with a soft bun and perfectly cooked patty topped with veggies and a fried runny egg. The fries were fresh and tasted delicious. I will surely be visiting soon just for the great burger. Thank you for a great evening.', 'I love the cozy atmosphere here. So warm and clean, but does not look so expensive from the outside. I was with an old friend of mine who does often visit this place. For me, it was my first experience. I tried "euphoria"-signature drink, just the same with the restaurant\'s name. It wasn\'t expensive at all. During happy hour, all cocktails cost 6,90€.', 'Aceptable prices, aperol spritz definitely well balanced and a good service even in the busier days. I can not complain. The football day, they used 5 projectors to see the match.']

Name: Kürbiskern
Summary: Lively cocktail bar with occasional magic shows & global comfort foods from pizza to fajitas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 1:30 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 1:30 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 1:30 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 1:30 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ["Haven't laughed that hard in ages!! Amazing little magic tricks. Loved the Bella mi cocktail (tropical sweet) and just a good atmosphere. This truly was an experience and the owner is just a real character and doing what he does with a passion. Would highly recommend if you want to escape every day life and just have a laugh with friends", 'BEST BAR IN BERLIN. The highlight is the magician who does amazing tricks and entertains all guests. Staff is fanstantic and very hospitable. Lot of amazing cocktails. Strongly recommend this bar.', "This place is always very entertaining. The owner, a very funny man, sometimes comes to your table and does magic tricks. During the winter months the smoking area can be a little bit cold and the music or the DJ, if there is one, is kind of annoying because they don't play songs/tracks till the end but mostly skip or cut them in the middle."]

Name: Lisboa Bar am Boxi
Summary: Tapas & typical Portuguese dishes like pastel de nata tarts in a compact setup with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['I guess I am very picky after spending years in Lisbon. It’s ok, from what I tried the cheeses and bread were fresh and good, you can see it’s freshly made with care. Maybe main dishes are delicious. Overall nothing bad to say. Good place for tapas and drinks.', 'The food was pretty average and generally overpriced, location nice, except for the shaky tables/benches, service also nice, one star less only cause at the end I asked for a glass of tap water and I got it with a receipt of 2,40€. It was a very small glass of warm water, so I don’t understand why I had to pay it so much, but also I would have liked to be asked beforehand if I was willing to pay that price since me and my boyfriend were leaving anyway and it’s usually free in most places. Perhaps I was misunderstood and given water from a bottle, but still 2,40€ for a little glass is more than overpriced. Especially after spending almost 70€ in two. Not sure if I’d go back, but recommended if you’re just looking for a place where to drink nice wine, in a nice setting and with some appetisers. Not recommended if you’re hungry and don’t wanna spend 35€+ per person for an average dinner. There are better tapas places around', 'Excellent spot in an excellent area. The menu was very enticing and the meals tasted even better. The service was timely and the vibe was exciting. I will definitely recommend this place for a nice dinner and drinks with friends']

Name: Zensation Restaurant
Summary: Vietnamese dishes, plus sushi, in a quirky, woodsy-chic space with a statement cherry tree.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['The food was okay, nothing special but still tasty. The service was nice but the food delivered almost 30 minutes to our table. The restaurant ambiance was nice and the price was reasonable. Overall it was ok.', "Really liked this place. Good interiors and ambience. Outdoor seating also available. Went out for an impromptu dinner during a weekday. I reserved a spot for 9 PM. This place was packed so I'm very glad I reserved a spot.

I initially thought this was a sushi bar seeing that more than half their menu is sushi. But my partner and I both had non-sushi dishes and they were awesome!

Starting with the Little dragon dumplings - 4 rice flour dumpling with shrimp filling and sweet and sour sauce. (Pic attached but we ate 2 of the dumplings before remembering to take a pic! 😂)

I had the Zensation bowl with fried chicken which was beautiful, fresh and flavourful.  Perfect for a summer dinner. Portion size was good for me.(Pic attached)

But the true star was the chili on fire with crispy duck. Packed with flavour, a little spicy and succulent crispy duck! (Pic attached)

The only con was that they did not have a very extensive drinks aka cocktails menu but they do have good beer and wine options.

All in all, definitely worth a visit.", 'Food is good, it’s not amazing, but it’s good enough that you wouldn’t have something to complain about. I ordered a delivery service via Wolt and came in intact. This is their “Sushi Menu 7”, which is basically a salmon menu. Portion of ingredients to rice is decent (again not amazing, but way better than others where the 70% of the roll is rice), that of course is not applicable for the nigiri 🍣.

What I would definitely not recommend though is their “Golden Season”. Supposedly it’s baked chicken dumplings, but in reality it’s oily disappointment of undercooked dough. Save your 4.90 Euros. Filling is barely existing, not to mention tasteless. But it comes with a nice garlicky sweet chili (watered-down) dipping sauce.

Overall, nice decent sushi that does the job. But nothing special.']

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Last week I ordered a sandwich from you guys. It was really tasty.

staff was really friendly and was hygienic too. I definitely recommend them.

Keep it up.', 'Was with you today. An Afghan young man helped me choose a sandwich.

was really tasty. especially the vegetable combination and the sauces.

I will definitely come back again.', "The place was cold and they only take cash, which is pretty lame for a Subway. The sandwich was okay but they were greedy on the vegetables, they barely gave me any, so my sub was a bit empty. I payed 10€ for all of this, my drink was a 30cl one, i don't know if refills were accepted though."]

Name: MacLaren's Pub
Summary: Burgers, beers & cocktails lie in store at this themed hangout for 'How I Met Your Mother' fans.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ["I'm thrilled to have discovered this pub! Every detail is meticulously crafted. The cocktails are fantastic, the service is excellent, and the atmosphere is amazing. Highly recommended!!!", 'Felt just awesome seeing all the decorations from the actual show and the whole bar is filled with references, great unique pub with a couple beers on draft although it’s a bit away from other attractions of the city', 'Pub created by 2 young men inspired by the series "How I met your mother". Suited for a drink in the night rather than a place to serve food because the food diversity is not that big. But it is good indeed. Also a bit cold because the outdoor is kept open even if late October. But the general atmosphere is nice and the service is very good.']

Name: Lemongrass
Summary: Pad Thai, coconut-based curries & rice dishes in a relaxed venue with colorful decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Had a great dinner in this restaurant! All dishes taste authentic as they should be. Good vibe and good service. Highly recommended for everyone who loves authentic Thai cuisine 👍🏾👍🏾', 'I was passing by this place and the Tom Yum soup looked delicious so I decided to book for the evening. My mum’s pad Thai was truly delicious while I was expecting better from the green curry — I kinda left hungry, the portion wasn’t big. Anyway for the price I will definitely come back again, surely for the pad Thai. They had many take away orders but the staff, the guy who served us in particular, was attentive and kind with clients in the restaurant. Thank you!', "Worst pad Thai I have ever eaten. It's super salty and too wet. I have to drink half a glass of water after one bite. I added an extra noodles and it was still super salty, so I had to leave it😢 But the fried rice is good. Service attitude is a bit rude but acceptable"]

Name: Il Ritrovo - Cucina Casalinga Popolare
Summary: Italian-style pizzas whipped up in cool space with wall scribblings & vintage posters.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["Usually I really like this place. But sometimes the pizzas are completely burned underneath which definitely is a health issue. Unfortunately I didn't check my take away pizza before I left and only saw it today when I noticed a bad taste.\nPlease please please control your pizzas before you give them out like this...\nIt's 30€ for two pizzas which are burnt... :-/", "Honestly one of my favorite restaurants in the world. Ritrovo encapsulates the rebellious grittyness that Berlin radiates and combines it with top tier Italian food. I've come here pretty much all my life and they never disappoint with a pizza crust so thin and delicious any future pizzas you order will seem like American deep dish. Come here to get great food, experience a great atmosphere, service is serviceable. Also they left a little complimentary drink on the table with some bread to wash it down, very thick and tasted like olives, good tho.", 'The staff was really friendly, the pizzas aren’t expensive and they’re super big. So for the price it’s a really good deal. The pizzas are authentic Italian pizzas and the menu is in Italian and German. I really like atmosphere there, and that’s probably why it’s so popular. I had a really good time there. Would recommend this place']

Name: Asia Wok
Summary: East Asian pho soups, crispy duck dishes & nasi goreng in a no-frills space with tables outdoors.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['A total hidden gem. Great food, great price and great service. Bun Spezial and Bun Royal are must try.', "I'm happy to have discovered this place in the area. This is my new favorite place for fried rice (Gebratener Reis), it was very tasty. I also tried the spicy sauer soup and it was also very, very good.
The service was nice and fast.
I'm definetly returning to this place.", "Don't hesitate, for that price and that taste I'll push everybody to try it !
Took the crispy chicken with peanut sauce and Jasmin rice, absolutely exquisite !"]

Name: Pizzeria Meyman
Summary: Quaint Italian restaurant providing wood-fired pizza, plus casseroles & pasta dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Ordered the 28. Pizza Mista (top) and 30. Pizza Maymen (bottom). Both were cheap, excellent, and large. For 2 people I would recommend ordering a single pie. Staff was very friendly and gave us some espresso for free afterwards. Highly recommend.', 'Pizza was freshly made on the spot, and the service was amazing\n\nOrdered Mista Pizza and Lasagne Bolognse, and they were good', 'Unbelievable pizza and at cheap prices. The staff were patient whilst we chose what to order. Honestly this has spoiled pizza for me now because it will never be as good as it was here.']

Name: Brauhaus Südstern
Summary: Bustling brewery featuring specialty beers, hearty dishes & schnitzels, plus a beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 2:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["Very nice, good typical brewery house. I've been here in a company event and as a regular. I've had fun times! Beer is very good (very heavy tho). Food was good. Nice location next to the park. Totally recommended.", 'During my stay in Berlin, we visited this place for lunch and were seated in their delightful outdoor seating area. The food was quite good, featuring typical German dishes, and they served beer from their own brewery.\n\nIn our case, the service was friendly and excellent. The prices were reasonable and average for Berlin, making it an affordable option.', "We've had a dinner at that place. Food quality was very good and the beer was excellent which they produce and have their own brand. Cosy atmosphere and very friendly young lady who served us. We were very about everything."]

Name: Restaurant Hasenheide
Summary: Robust German food in an old-school tavern with arched ceilings, dark-wood accents & a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['The best Wiener schnitzel ever! Great sauce, fantastic potatoes served any way (mashed, roasted, fries, salad). The Kalbsleber (liver) was also delicious. Cocktails a plenty and service was awesome. Highly recommend this restaurant if in Berlin', 'I really appreciated the atmosphere at our table outside at this restaurant. However, besides that this was a poor experience.

Overall, the food seemed overpriced for what it was. We got a pasta which was pretty bland and a small portion size. Not worth the price. We also got a schnitzel from the kids menu and it was not bad for the price.

We also ordered a water for our table. When it came out I decided to check the menu and saw that it cost €6.50. As I looked at the bottle, I realized that there was no cap, the sticker was peeling off, and the glass the bottle water made out of was worn down, and scratched. As I tasted it again, it was evident that this was tap water that they put in a nice bottle. Very disappointing to discover the lack of integrity in this restaurant.

When this bill came out, we thought it looked like a little bit much even considering the expensive water. The staff had accidentally charged us for an espresso that someone else ordered. We only found this out because we requested the receipt that they otherwise would not have gave us. The only good part about the restaurant was the staff spoke English.

This was an unsatisfactory experience and I discourage people from going here.', "Superb food, traditionally German. Huge portion sizes, four of us had the pleasure of dining out here this evening. Wholeheartedly recommend the pork Schnitzel served with salad, roasted potatoes, salad and a fried egg. And the sharing platter starters were generous in size, fresh and tasty. And all this great food wasn't expensive! The terrace and inside tables were full of locals - which is always a great sign.
A wonderful dinner for our group. Than you so much!"]

Name: Gasthaus Figl
Summary: Retro-chic restaurant & bowling alley offering pizza & elevated pub meals, plus a few beers & wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Absolutely outstanding service! The team was incredibly warm, welcoming, and I felt right at home. the team went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect. Every interaction felt genuine, and it’s clear that customer care and quality are their top priorities. I felt truly valued as a customer and I absolutely loved the pizza 🍕I recommend it to anyone looking for a a wonderful evening', "This place has a great, old Berlin charm, but I stopped coming years ago because there was never a table. Post-lockdown, they've expanded the interior so no problem with seating. Even better, the food was exceptional - the Bauernpizza, or Farmer's Pizza, was the best pizza I've had in years with a crust that was light and crispy. I'll be coming back for more!", 'The pizza was really tasty and the staff friendly! I can recommend the homemade hibiscus lemonade, it’s good and not too sweet.\nUnfortunately on my partner’s pizza the bacon was missing and when we asked about it they just said they’d talk to the kitchen and never got back to us. We were quite a big group (~25 people), so sometimes orders were mixed up and brought out more than was ordered.']

Name: Tangs Kantine
Summary: Dim sum & classic Szechuan & Shanghai cuisine served in a modest eatery with a sidewalk terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Tasty authentic food. I ate dimsams, a small portion of wonton soup and cucumber salad (be careful, it is really spicy. I ll be glad to return here. Any smell of cooking in the restaurant, by the way.', 'It gets really busy during lunch time, cash payment only. Food was tasty, love their fluffy white rice!', 'Had imagined it’s a good authentic Chinese place. Maybe it is, if we go back and try some more selections. But overall, it was pretty underwhelming.

Seating outdoors is possible and we got the wok tips (fried dumplings) and the Shanghai Ente and Ente im Glück. Neither of them are that great, the dumplings were fine, nothing spectacular.

Starters came out pretty quick, but food took a pretty long time to come out. So as mentioned earlier, give it a shot but it wouldn’t be on my list of recommendations. An average place for me.']

Name: tulus lotrek
Summary: Inventive, multi-course menus & a huge global wine list in a contemporary space with rustic flair.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Honestly… one of the best fine dining experiences we ever had in Germany!
Make sure you put this restaurant onto your list.

We are still dreaming about those mouthwatering, umami sauces! 🤤 From some we would have loved to get a bucket full of them.

All in all - amazing food and outstanding wines. We went by bottle and we got some amazing recommendations.

We especially loved the laid back vibe and the warm and welcoming staff.

In our opinion they definitely deserve more michelin stars 🤩', "Great atmosphere! We were greeted warmly with our names written on the table in chalk. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive. However, when it comes to the food, while it features many fancy ingredients—caviar, carabinero, truffle, buck meat, top-quality sushi rice—and utilizes special preparation techniques like purée, tartare, and bouillabaisse, the flavors don't always hit the mark. I was a bit disappointed with the €225 set menu. For instance, the buck meat had a strong gamey flavor mixed with blood, which was quite challenging for me to enjoy. The addition of fried dough made the dish even heavier. On a positive note, there were some delightful surprises. The chawanmushi had a subtle hint of hazelnut flavor, and the scallops featured a pine nut flavor that paired beautifully with the truffle. Given the price, I would probably not return, but it was an interesting experience overall.", 'just excellent menu curation
great for celebrations
atmo is relaxed, calm, everyone minds their own business
we love the staff’s explanation to each course']

Name: St. Bart
Summary: Bar & kitchen with simple tiled décor plating contemporary gastropub dishes & oysters.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['Really tasty meal and superb experience! All the veggies were done so well, I would also recommend the pork neck. Delicious cocktails, wines, etc. and very friendly staff. Will be back again!', 'Had a lovely dinner with a friend here and we tasted our way through most of the menue. The produce is fresh and of food quality, great to accompany a drink or two or which there are also cute and tasty non alcoholic versions. The atmosphere of the place is phenomenal especially inside.', 'OK Gastropub in Berlin.
Heard a lot for this place and food and booked for Sunday roast.

All food was a bit flat, we took lamb shank, roast beef, and half chicken..

Price with wine was 50 euros per person.

Nice atmosphere and good personnel.']

Name: Ristorante Masaniello
Summary: Casual Italian restaurant with a patio & rustic surrounds, offering Neapolitan wood-fired pizzas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['We took pizza take away, but we waited inside and there was sooo nice atmosphere 🔥and pizza was awesome!!!

Thank you very much!', 'Pizza....and Pizza...After the restaurant got bigger, it lost a bit of the atmosphere, but the food keeps the quality over many visits and gives some variation in the daily menu, so you can get surprised. Maybe the best pizza in Berlin (Maybe no more since 2019 but still good). Pasta with swordfish was delicious! Great with kids in Summer... Friendly and attentive Staff. P.S. Number 16 is really great!', "Down to earth place serving hearty southern Italian cuisine. Popular for its pizza. Large variety. We ordered both pasta and pizza and it didn't disappoint.
There were a lot of families dining when we were there during dinner. Perhaps a testament to its quality and value for money.
Servings are rather large and it's inexpensive.
Service is attentive too. Highly recommended."]

Name: Le Bon
Summary: Laid-back, cozy restaurant serving brunch & light meals, plus smoothies & cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 3:30 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 3:30 PM
Reviews: ['The Eggs Benedict and Lemon Avocado Toast were absolutely delicious! The flavors were perfectly balanced, and the presentation was spot on. The waffles, though, were the best—crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and simply unforgettable. Plus, they serve you tap water, which is a nice touch. A must-visit spot in Berlin for a great brunch!', 'Amazing eggs Benedict and pancakes. Coffee and OJ were good too. Decent price and cozy bar in a quiet space close to the park. Service was kind and friendly and very quick. Definitely would recommend', 'Great place, i had a very good brunch, the music was really good and the staff very nice for the first time since im in Berlin. Very friendly. I had a delicious moment. Thank you, I’ll definitely come back for something savory this time ☺️']

Name: Hamy Cafe
Summary: Noodle & rice dishes of the day, specialty teas & shakes at a no-frills cafe with a deli counter.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['The food is really delicious, service was fast, not that friendly. Price to the value and quality you get is fantastic. Tables are shared with everyone, so you expect to sit with a stranger, but that’s lovely anyways.', "One of the crowded Vietnamese restaurants I have been to so far. Not fancy but authentic food. The menu is simple. Service is fast. Flavours are so good. Yummy and fresh. Prices are reasonable. Most of the dishes are below 10 euro. Serving is in a large bowl , quantity is very good for a person. It's a small place so it's not recommended if you wanna sit relax and have food.", 'A classic. Incredible quality price offer. It gets very crowded and it might take some time to get attended. The pho bo was very nice']

Name: Hallmann und Klee
Summary: Innovative, seasonal dishes in a chic, airy venue best known for its breakfast & brunch offerings.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Amazing food, fantastic flavours and the alcohol free pairing was exceptional. This combination was simply perfect. The service team was knowledgeable and friendly. The whole experience was superb. It got kind of noisy when the restaurant filled up. But overall super good.', 'What a wonderful restaurant! It was one of my top culinary experiences in Berlin.
We had the non-veggie menu with alcohol-free drink pairing.
First of all the savoury courses were just amazing. Everything was very well prepared and balanced - but in combination with the drinks it all went up to a whole other level. The drinks complemented all dishes perfectly, big thanks to the sommelier for this amazing job. Really hard to say which dish was the best, all had their own twist.
We had the feeling that dessert is not their strength, compared to all the savoury dishes before but it was still good.
The service was attentive and really nice. We also liked the laidback atmosphere outside at the Böhmi.
I can 100% recommend this place and the star is more than well deserved :)', 'After quite a long time thinking about visiting Hallmann & Klee, we finally made it. If you think about it and are able to afford it: book it! We had a very very good time, food is amazing, wine pairing could be shared and is a must, menus could be adjusted on a course basis between veg and non veg. Service was attentive and spot on. Standout dishes were the scallop, the dove and the kohlrabi, which doesn’t mean that the rest was not also absolutely delicious. Thank you so much for this evening!']

Name: Restaurant Grill
Summary: Estrel Hotel's sophisticated option for steaks, burgers & grilled seafood, paired with wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Good steak restaurant within the Estrel hotel/conference complex. Service was quick and attentive, but did not feel rushed, food was very good and well presented. The prices for the higher end steaks were quite expensive, but not unreasonably so. I would have happily eaten here for more meals if my stay at the hotel had been longer.', 'The food was good. Not excellent but good enough. The service on the other hand very rude. I was shocked. The restaurant was basically empty and the waiter didn’t want to seat us as we were a large group. He finally rolled his eyes and showed us to our table. Gesturing and swearing all the time. We stopped because we were in shock and didn’t know what to do. He made some impatient gestures and taunts. Do not recommend. Other waiters were nice.', 'Very good tasting italian food ! The starters are à little bit to expansive, but really good too. The service is fast. I recommand this restaurant ;-)']

Name: Adak Restaurant
Summary: Compact outfit with a casual vibe serving doner kebabs, kofte & other Mediterranean staples.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['It was the worst lahmacun I have ever eaten in my life. There was no meat in it. We ate an empty lavash and paid 2.80 Euro.', 'The food is very tasty, recommended!', "Ah, the good Adak... I used to live nearby, and I'd go get a dohner very regularly. Every now and then, when I visit Prenzlauer Berg, I still visit the place. Family run business, super friendly... 10/10"]

Name: Café Restaurant Jolesch
Summary: Red-painted dining room with large artworks on the walls, serving Austrian cuisine & pastries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['I wasn’t too hungry so I just ordered a ceviche and did not like the carrots inside, why largely cut the carrots? I eat carrots normally but I had to fork out (literally) and segregate and eat all carrots in the end due to this mismatch of a dish.\n\nWe sat on the street table which was lovely.', 'Good food, fine, nothing special, but tasty. For me best schnitzel is in Vienna. For me 8/10. Great selections of all kind of gin if you like.', 'The veal schnitzel was delicious and crispy.  I loved the Basil Smash that was recommended to me as a drink! For dessert, we tried creme brule and apfelsturdel. Both were very good, especially apfelsturdel, which is a classic and should definitely be eaten in a place like this.']

Name: Markthallen Restaurant CLOSED
Summary: Cozy restaurant with wood-paneled walls & a long bar, serving German cuisine particularly schnitzel.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Great place! The food is very tasty (best Kasespatzle I've ever had!), the tap beer os delicious and the staff is super nice!", 'At previous visits to Berlin the restaurant was closed, perhaps for good I thought. I was pleasantly surprised when on this trip I discovered the place being open again.  Perhaps it is under new management, so I’m not paying attention to old reviews.

The room with a long bar and some single and communal tables was buzzing and the young and vibrant staff had apparently everything under control.
The menu is concise and covers all bases, so does the beverage list.
Weissburgunder, Grüner Veltliner were tasty. Crispy sourdough bread, oysters, veal tongue and as main course mackerel were fantastic.

There are plenty of restaurants in Berlin offering the usual fare, schweine haxen, schnitzel pommes frites etc.  this is not one of them.

This is a refreshingly “new” German restaurant with a farm fresh ever changing menu.  Hurray!', 'Nice veal schnitzel, service is quick for drinks. The bathroom is shared with Markhalle.']

Name: Baraka - Moroccan Restaurant
Summary: Traditional mezes, couscous dishes & tagines in a relaxed Moroccan-style spot with rough-hewn walls.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Not gonna lie, I am a foodie and we have a google maps list with 100+ places to go eat and drink, but this is definitely on top of my recommendations for anyone who visits Berlin.

The food is incredible nothing will ever top a good warm meal that was made like this, yes maybe trendy places and boozy slushies are what you want, but it’s not comparable to the best falafel I’ve had, don’t even get me started on the spiced rice with dried fruits!

We came here pretty late after not finding a place to eat and it blew our minds. The service was so nice too! Our waiter was super nice and came to ask if everything was alright with a big smile. Def coming back, thank you!', 'A very nice restaurant with tasty food. They have a big terrace with plenty of seats, so you don’t need a reservation if you’re not a big group. We tried Tajine Oase and Tajine Casablanca. The portions are big and the food is delicious. The service is fast and everyone is friendly. We also liked black tea with rose water. Definitely recommend!', 'I went to this place to taste Moroccan for the first time. We ordered a vegetarian plate for 2 people. The amount of food they gave was quite good. They also clicked pictures for us.']

Name: Cafe Morgenland
Summary: Corner meeting place, with sidewalk seats & a mirrored bar, serving brunches & a Mediterranean menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM
Reviews: ['Good food, price and nice athmosphere. The waiter was really nice.', 'This is a classic German "price performance ratio" spot. It may have been OK when it opened. Now that there\'s actually good brunch food in Berlin, it\'s outdated. The food is just OK, but it\'s relatively cheap, and that\'s all that a lot of people care about, unfortunately.', "It's almost impossible compared to just 3 years ago to find a nice place with a self serving buffet for brunch. Very friendly stuff and all the time refilled plates in the what could be only described as grab'n'stuff room. We were most likely very lucky as someone just left and we got the table i a blink of an eye. But after seeing sad faces standing at the corner, I'd suggest a reservation 🤷\u200d♂️😉 The price of 17 euros is in my opinion totally fair considering the variety you find."]

Name: Miss Saigon Restaurant
Summary: Vietnamese specialties & standards, plus many vegan options, in a casual, colorful venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['I went to Miss Saigon after a solid recommendation from my boyfriend about their Pho and Bao bun, and honestly, I was very happy with my choice of going there. This place is a gem and it is my second time there.

The Pho Bo here, priced at around 12€, is a flavor bomb - rich, aromatic, and loaded with fresh herbs, solid 8.5/10.
Marian (that is the name of my boyfriend) went for the Bún Bò Huế at 13,90€, and it actually took the leadership of "best dish for the night" after my already impressive Pho Bo. Even though I strongly recommend the Pho, you wouldn't not be sad by choosing this soup =D

We also tried the 4,90€ Bao bun. While it didn’t top the charts compared to what I’ve had back in São Paulo (my hometown), Marian’s enthusiasm for it was infectious. In Brazil we have a huge chinese/japanese/korean community and Bao is chinese so over there it is just better (in my opion, of course).

This place just don't get the 5 start because when we went there, there was a table with 1000 kids screaming and that took a bit of the magic away from our dinner. Not their fault, I know, but was our experience.', "Nice medium sized Vietnamese restaurant with an elaborate menu (not only what you get everywhere, daily specials) and reasonable prices. Seems that salt is missing in every food but then they say that's typical for Vietnam - and there's soy sauce available.
Really friendly service. Quite noticeable for Berlin! And a nice outdoor sitting area if the weather allows.", 'Nice Restaurant with outdoor seating. Menu is ample, service was quick. Liked the appetizers, though the summer roll was not up to par. The pho was not as good as I hoped after reading the reviews']

Name: Ta’Cabrón Taqueria
Summary: Burritos, quesadillas & enchiladas, plus tequila cocktails, at a mellow, colorfully decorated spot.
Opening Hours: Monday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['The food is super delicious. Cochinita pibil is my favourite. The chili sauce goes well with all dishes we ordered, really recommend if you also like spicy food. Service is very nice. Music makes me wanna dance. A great Saturday night, all in all.', 'The food is so good - tacos, nachos and drinks (margaritas & cantarito)were delicious! The place is authentic, you have typical latin music und the staff is friendly.
You have Selfservice, but they bring the food to your table:)

It was really easy to make a reservation via instagram dm.
You can pay only with cash.

(The sanitary facilities were not so clean, here are some areas for improvement).', "Amazing home made mexican food by true mexicans. I had the potato and nopal quesadillas but also managed to try the enchiladas with a red sauce that was made with chile ancho.
I trie the burrito with mole and chicken. My favorite was the quesadillas, my sister's was the enchiladas and my girlfriend's the burrito with chicken and mole.
We got some cochinita pibil tacos as dessert. Good environment and amazing service. I recommend it 100%!"]

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 1:00 AM, 7:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: Open 24 hours, Sunday: Open 24 hours
Reviews:
['I have never eaten something that disgusting before.
Food came within 1 min to the table. In the worst presentation. Very cold, bacon stinked, fries was old and soaked in oil. Frankly it seemed that the whole meal was very old and sat there for some days. No idea.
I went to the manager and said that my burger is very bad and not edible. He ignored me. So I paid money for nothing and left without touching this meal ofc
I really do not understand how can any restaurant operate with such standards.', "Food is good, taste good I didn't say is healthy is not , people who work here should be more careful with orders, cuz sometimes I didn't received everything I paid for", 'The service is really bad. I’ve waited for my order around 15 minutes. The workers just didn’t want to accept my order. They made hot coffee instead of ice latte.']

Name: Café Quitte Espresso Bar Kreuzberg
Summary: Laid-back venue for espresso drinks, pastries, housemade cakes & light fare like bagels.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['We went with friends for a coffee and we discovered a nice place with a nice atmosphere, very delicious cakes and fresh  and the most beautiful thing is that the coffee has art on it. Very good service and very kind the guy who attended. You can talk with your friends because the music is not so loud  so if you want to chill with good food you can come here.', 'We tried some croissants and had drinks.
The food and drinks were ok, the service and the ambiente good.
Maybe the other food options are more special.', 'Nice place in Kreuzberg to sit down, relax, and enjoy a homemade cake and/or drink.

Vegan options available 🌱
I really liked the vegan mango and peach cheesecake!']

Name: Restaurant Paris Moskau
Summary: Fine-dining restaurant in a timber-framed house with garden terrace, serving an international menu.
Reviews: ["Had a few hours to fill, before my train home and was looking for a nice restaurant not too far away. Wow, what a find. The service is exceptional. The food was beautiful and the wine and atmosphere finished the meal off. Located next to a road but the settings mean you don't really notice traffic noise. Salad starter and veal main course   both full of flavour.  Would highly recommend", 'Old school staple in berlin, great central location rustic house with friendly staff.
