The food left a little to be desired. It’s ok and that is the problem it’s just ok. It’s your standard tartar’s steak seafood etc while it tastes good I find for the price it should be perfect. Great date spot as the outdoor seating is lovely and the wine list is perfectly priced!\nMight return,', 'Adorable atmosphere. Lovely service and fantastic food. Starters and mains were displayed lovely and tasted even better. Definitely worth a visit.']

Name: Zollpackhof
Summary: Restaurant with central fire, 2 patios & beer garden serving German food with Mediterranean twists.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Fantastic place to eat, drink, and relax. The terrace is lovely and has the full menu from the restaurant (German and English menus available). Service is perfect - efficient and friendly. We came back another day and tried the biergarten, under an ancient wide spread tree that sheltered us from the sun or sprinkles.

I really liked the white asparagus, only in season during early summer, and the cheese sauce for the pretzel.', 'Relatively high end German beer garden with tasty food, great beer and wine, also friendly attentive staff. Been here a couple of times and it never disappoints. Great buisness lunch deal 14 euros and water included. Will return again when in the neighborhood', "Just sat down for a beer to enjoy the view and it started raining!
Stayed to eat and enjoy a beer or 2 , lovely calming garden area , good food and drink , tried the snapps, it's not for everyone! Lol
We had to ask nicely, but the restaurant did allow us to take away a cake for birthday 🎂"]

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 3:00 AM, 5:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: Open 24 hours, Sunday: Open 24 hours
Reviews: ["Served very quickly, but the food was quite bland and stingy with the bacon. I can honestly say that I've never had a McDonald's with less seasoning! Two stars for the hot chocolate and the self service machines that allowed us to choose English as an option.", 'Not that good hygiene, okay food, opened 24 hours I guess, takes 0.50€ for WC.', 'This got to be the worst mc Donald’s I have ever been to. Obnoxious service , hat to wait 15 minutes for an egg sandwich despite that everyone after me came and left and the worst thing is , they were not even apologetic! Amazing !']

Name: Burger King
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes, plus breakfast.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['ordered big king teriyaki beef, the burger is super dry, no sauce.\nthe staffs are however nice.\nyou cannot use the mobile app coupon here, no store number for the burger king feedback', "Should I say that the food in the photo and the real food are very different, I don't demand that they be exactly the same but it shouldn't be that different", 'This is probably one of the worst fast food I have ever been.  The management, at some level, really needs to step up and do some serious quality check on the products.  The fries were freezing cold, they have been sitting there for hours.  The burger, see the picture, was assembled rapidly without even making sure the cheese would melt.']

Name: Dunkin' Donuts
Summary: Long-running chain serving signature breakfast items & a variety of coffee drinks.
Address: Hauptbahnhof Europaplatz 1 Einkaufsbahnhof Berlin Hbf, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['I liked the donuts from here. Ordered a few times. Also tried the vegan ones (wish there was a bigger choice of vegan ones). These donuts are not wet from the oil, so it’s pretty nice. Maybe they sometimes have quite a lot of sugar and I would prefer to have less of it. But regardless, a lovely place. You can buy a box of donuts and pick whatever you want there (try one with pop corn toping, it’s delicious)', "Wanted to try Dunkin Donuts for first time. I'm not impresed. They are too sweet for my taste, but staff was friendly and there was plenty of room to sit down.", 'The donuts look like they were decorated by a toddler. The taste is the same as everywhere else. 2,5+€ for some dough with sugar is quite high though']

Name: VAPIANO Berlin Europaplatz
Summary: Laid-back restaurant featuring made-to-order fresh pasta dishes, along with pizza & salad.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['Good price for the cost benefit of it. Food was prepared quickly. The place is a bit confusing, on where you should order the food, where you take it, and etc. The carbonara was average, and the pizza was good. Super convenient the location.', "Great value for money! Food is prepared at the moment so it's hot and full of taste.
Very nice ambience too.
The only con was a member of staff named Ahmed who was totally unhelpful with no willingness to be proactive regarding customer satisfaction, so somebody else had to come and take our order.
But that was a minor stain in our otherwise flawless meal😎", 'Debating if or not to do this review. The lady at the order counter was either really trying to be incredibly rude, or she is just not good at her job. I asked for a Funghi Risotto with beef to go (don’t judge my order please) and had to repeat it 5 times, slowly, and she still didn’t write it correctly. The kitchen staff was rude when I pointed out that I had ordered it differently and to go. The risotto in question was very mid, at best. No flavour at all. And then the guy at the door, who if was any snarkier would probably show up on one of MTV’s reality shows. Overall, the service was bad, the food was okay, and if I never have to eat at the Hauptbahnhof again I will never visit this place.']

Name: Pret A Manger
Summary: Counter-serve chain for ready-made sandwiches plus breakfast, coffee, soups & salads.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Healthier than German food. Just don’t order the miso soup. It’s made in front of you form hot water mixed with some liquid that comes out of a plastic, looks artificial and not so healthy', 'This location is always crazy busy because it is in the main train station of Berlin. having said that it is an easy place to grab food for your train ride or a quick coffee not very comfortable to sit inside', "I love the quality of their food, it is mostly healthy, lots of veggies, salads, nuts and herbs. They could add more spices and/or sauce though, to make it even tastier. Unfortunately they have not too many vegetarian options.

Today I bought a sandwich for breakfast, a wrap, a bowl and a cheesecake, crisps, tea and a chai latte. Now sitting on the train with no cutlery, looks like they just forgot about it.

How will I eat my cheesecake and my bowl? I have no idea. Probably a 30 minute walk to the train's restaurant which I wanted to avoid by buying so much food in the first place.

The service was good, otherwise. Friendly, professional and fast.

P.S.: The oatmilk chai latte had an artificial aftertaste, a bit like sweetener maybe? Cannot recommend it."]

Name: Rice On! Berlin
Summary: Modern counter serve offering create-your-own bowls featuring Asian-inspired ingredients.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Located at the right spot at the very entrance of Food court in Berlin Central train station, this Asian food joint is more than awesome for its food quality, taste and price! Service is courteous and quick and the meal portions are great enough to fill hungry tummies either before the journey or after! The taste is one of the true definitions of fusion with all overlapping on one another like Indian, Chinese, Thai and Malaysian, suiting all types of taste buds. We bought their chicken ball bowl and tofu bowl and both were simply great! There is a great differentiator in the name of various sauces they carry like green sauce, red sauce, peanut sauce and tamarind sauce and all sauces are great! I would certainly go back again whenever I cross the station! Highly recommended.', 'Fresh, big size dishes, with love. Very tasty. Ate rice with chicken, broccoli, green beans, as much as you want coriander and tastey sauce!', 'I liked it at first glance it, everything looked fresh and clean. The staff was so nice and everything was delicious! I found it quite filling and was fully satisfied with the quality and price. I’m very happy to have a fast, healthy, delicious food :) definitely gonna revisit when I’m here again.']

Name: Fatih Servet Döner
Summary: Petite counter-serve member of a chain serving meat skewers, plus salads & pizza.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM
Reviews: ["I enjoyed my visit here. The staff were super friendly, which made the whole experience even better. One thing that really stood out was how fast they cooked everything. If you're in a rush, this place is perfect for grabbing a quick bite. No long waits here, just speedy service and hot food. I went for the dürüm, and it was filling. The taste was good—nothing too crazy, but good. Plus, the portions were pretty generous, so you’re definitely getting your money’s worth. All in all, this döner spot has a lot going for it: friendly staff, quick service, and decent prices. It's a great pick if you need something fast and tasty.", 'It is very tasty and delicious food is delivered there. It is very strongly recommended to have your meal after a long trip and tiredness.  And the price is good and not expensive.', 'I was there at the main station after 9.30 pm, and not everything was open. So, easiest pick was kebap. I ordered a Döner box. I have to say the kebap had a different and good taste. I picked Kraüter sauce and it was tasty. The service was a bit chaotic for me, as the person who took my order forgot to process my order. Nevertheless, they were able to realize fast once they asked me to pay for Sis Kebap, which I did not order. 😅']

Name: Mirabelle
Summary: Regional dishes like tarte flambée, plus vegan options, in a laid-back cafe with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ['They have delicious German food with a fun vegetarian twist, as well as all the usual meat-based options.', 'The food took around 50 minutes to arrive, something really annoying considerably when you only order two simple dishes from the menu. The kitchen is very slow and the service is very slow. The food was not something spectacular for all the waiting time. no wonder..!!!', 'Exemplary German comfortable feel and cordial staff with a cutting edge (thus exceptionally delectable!) take on the cooking, particularly the soups. Strongly suggested.😍😘😘']

Name: Trattoria Rossini
Summary: A wide Italian menu (including a kids' selection) is prepared at this relaxed & welcoming venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["The spaghetti carbonara was a bit disappointing. The egg texture wasn't quite what I expected for a carbonara – it seemed scrambled rather than creamy. This made it feel more like pasta with scrambled eggs than the classic sauce.

The apfelschorle unfortunately came without gas, which took away from the refreshing quality.

However, my husband enjoyed his calzone, so there were definitely some good options on the menu.", "We came here for lunch and the place was great.
We ordered a ministroni soup, spagetti Bolognese, pizza capriciosa, and a diavola. The servings were big, we couldn't finish everything, even though we were hungry.
The prices are average, but the servings are bigger than average, so a good value overall.
The dishes were well made, and they took into account our wishes.
The service was great, the personnel were very friendly.
Overall we liked the place and would come again.", 'Delicious food, amazing staff, strong cocktails!
Lovely experience here, the pizzas are very large and also delicious. Tiramisu is worth a try too! Well priced and conveniently located from the S-Bahn at Wollankstraße.']

Name: +39 Piùtrentanove
Summary: Traditional pizza & pasta, plus wine & aperitifs served in a relaxed, airy, wood-accented space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['Lovely place to spend the evening outside at in Kreuzberg. Great Tuna antipasti and a nice Buffala Pizza. Huge pizzas 🍕🍷 Next time the two of us would share one pizza ❤️\nVery friendly service.', 'Authentic Italian restaurant in Berlin. Recommended. The pizzas are big and the quality is really good. It has a good atmosphere both inside and outside.', 'food was really good, staff was nice and helpful. prices were also really reasonable. the limoncello in the house was a nice added bonus. Good place for a nice pasta in Berlin!']

Name: Kindercafé Kreuzzwerg
Summary: Colorful global-fare cafe with stations & attractions for kids, like a ball pit & sandbox.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['Superb recommendation! Our daughter was the happiest playing there as we had a nice time while talking with the staff. They were also super helpful when we needed help after our kid felt a bit sick. 100% recommended!', 'Absolutely lovely. I can not recommend it enough. It is delightful, my baby had a blast and us adults enjoyed breakfast. 10/10 ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐', 'Amazing place! There should be more cafes like this. My son had the best time and I enjoyed delicious drinks and food. On Sundays they have a huge brunch offering. It’s not cheap but for what you get it’s worth paying a bit more than the usual. I have a lot of respect for the staff too who manage to dodge tiny people while carrying hot drinks and plates. I’m not sure why there are some negative reviews here, would you expect staff to constantly smile while working in such a loud and busy environment? They do very well. I will happily come back']

Name: Golgatha Biergarten
Summary: Easygoing hangout serving breakfast, grilled meats & vegetarian eats, plus cocktails & draft beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
["Great location in a park. Loads of seating at tables/benches, swing chairs, upstairs patio.

We didn't eat but it smelled wonderful.

Friendly bar service.", 'Located in a beautiful park. Though it’s a bit small and tables are close together, making stroller navigation tricky, the cozy couches are a nice touch. The food selection is very good, especially the chili sausage, which is a rare find in Berlin beer gardens.', "It was 2 years ago, but we didn't like it. The vibe was sleepy chill. Young parents with babies and kids seem to congregate here. Most tables had signs saying they're reserved. It felt like an odd vibe. Babies took a stroll wherever, going into the restaurant, getting in the way of the servers, with parents not to be seen or didn't care because they were so involved in their conversations. They were okay with their kids throwing the biergarten's rocks onto the stairs and things or were not paying attention to their offspring that they cared. It was a very weird vibe. Go here if you have a baby, toddler, or very young kids. Beer was okay, person working there was very nice, it was pretty empty when we were there, odd, narrow spacing. Yeah, odd vibe. We didn't feel comfortable, so we left before finishing our beer. It felt like it was a place exclusively for young parents with small children or babies. Crawling around, stumbling about with parents carelessly in their own world. Very weird. Tired and depressing vibe."]

Name: Tomasa
Summary: Modern 2-story eatery in a villa with a modern German menu, courtyard tables, stove & bar area.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['1) 👍It is the best place to have a dinner with your small kid
2) 👍foods are delicious
3) 👍people are friendly
4) 👍nice decorations and atmosphere
5) 👍many parking spots in front of the building

6) 👎serving time is little bit long. We were able to start eating 45 minutes after we sit our table.', 'Nice venue and outside area. Great staff. But the food is comparable to airport food: Supermarket bought smoked salmon, bland scrambled eggs, mediocore sausages, and really bad coffee.', 'Fancy breakfasts for really decent prices.
The places is very charming, historical building with many types of seating, two floors inside the building and many outside seating in many different corners and terraces.
We were 4, had 4 meals and drinks (see photos), bill was 62 EUR (not including tip).']

Name: Tirelli's
Summary: Informal Italian venture furnishing pasta dishes & wine in a homey, compact dining room.
Reviews:
['I ordered ravioli it is very good but not a perfect. It has some salt problem as much as a Italian raviolis maybe I am using more than acceptable :). anyway they have little service problem(English menu, I had to chance my knife) still good restaurant. You could go there.', 'Great service, only one Vorspeise tho, was really tasty. We had carbonara and pesto pasta! Super flavorful ⭐️', '🙏Simply Fantastic 😍❤️

Great Italian food, super fast and very reasonble prices 👍👍👍

Totally worth driving through the city for. It is consistently good and one can talk a very nice walk in the parkafterwards.']

Name: The Neighborhood
Summary: Laid-back restaurant & bar offering homestyle American cooking like wings, tacos & mac ’n’ cheese.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ['Ask for the frozen margaritas if they’re not on the menu cause they’re phenomenal! Also the food! Do much comfort food and proper buffalo wings which isn’t something easy to come by in Berlin! But also their Mac& cheese Cajun style! Yum', 'Went for boozy brunch/lunch here. Great staff and in house doggo (pepper)! We had so much food and drinks over the time we were there.\nHighly recommend the brioche breakfast bun and the tatter tots.\nWill go again!', "Was so happy to find The Neighborhood around the corner and all the comforts for a fellow American. Where else can you have mac n cheese, a BLAT, elote, and wings and a magarita. I've had take out a few times, always yummy and hot and fresh tasting even with takeout. I like to get a double mimosa to-go. 😍 the owner is super sweet and makes you feel like home. Can't wait to enjoy everything they have to offer on the patio. Must try!"]

Name: Burger King
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['The service was quick, the food was delicious, and the portions were surprisingly generous. Special shoutout to the friendly and handsome employee who offered me a bag – a small gesture that made a big difference. Would absolutely come again!', 'Took very very long, then forgot 2 fries and a burger. Drinks half full. Not acceptable. Would like to arrange a refund as i am typically happy at other burger kings.', 'Unfortunately this Burger King mixes up order quite frequently. If you order for take-away please check right at the counter, what is in the bag. Just ordered two menus and none of the burgers have been like ordered. Cheese, where no cheese was added and a completely different burger for the other menu. QUite dissapointing.\nThe location is okay. The tables as clean as you might want to expect. I will definitely visit another Burger King in the next time and skip this one!']

Name: The Bird
Summary: New York-style steakhouse & bar offering fresh sauces & home-style burgers, plus fun themed events.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Review based on  blue cheese burger
Burger

Good ;
- wide options of American style burger
- choose degree grilled ( rare, medium rare, medium, ..)

Bad:
- The restaurant recommendation is to order medium rare but since in some burgers types the patty is very thick which means most of the core portions will be rare meat', 'Nice atmosphere and super friendly staff.
But the food does not live to its hype.
The hamburger was dry, the filet was good but no good sauce to it.
Nice place to meet friends shot a Ducks fart. And have ok meal.', 'One of the best burger in berlin.
Grate atmosphere, cold beer, tasty meet (recommended to order it medium rare).
Relatively small scone (a good thing so you can finish the dish).
A decent amount of french fries)
Overall we really enjoyed it.']

Name: Mauersegler Berlin
Summary: Down-to-earth beer garden dishing up burgers, fries & currywurst amid a lively ambiance.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["Visited Mauersegler Berlin during the Champions League final in 2024, and it was an incredible experience! 🏆⚽️ The place is an open-air venue, which added a unique and enjoyable atmosphere to the event. 🌳🍻 There were plenty of good drinks available, and the space was more than adequate for watching the game comfortably. 🍺📺 The ambience was fantastic, with a vibrant and energetic crowd that really made the night special. 🎉👏 If you're looking for a great spot to enjoy sports events or just have a good time with friends, Mauersegler is definitely worth a visit! 🌟🏟️", 'Hi,

Thanks for your reply. First of all, I want to clarify that we were not under stress, so it's disappointing to see that assumption made about us. If your staff was feeling stressed, perhaps they need more support or a break, but that doesn’t justify being rude to customers.

To clarify the situation, we visited your place yesterday and ordered four drinks: two beers and two house lemonades. We intended to pay by card, as we only had €5 in cash. Since you require a deposit for the glasses, we needed an extra €3. However, before we were even served, a staff member impulsively insisted that we pay the deposit upfront.

My girlfriend then went to ask our friends if they had any extra cash. During this time, one of your "friendly staff" started mocking her and even called her a "gröserlig."

This kind of behavior is unacceptable, regardless of how busy or stressful the environment might be. We understand that everyone can have an off day, but we expect a certain level of respect when we visit an establishment. I hope you can address this internally so that future customers don't have a similar experience.

Thank you for your time.', "I visited this bar last week with my husband and small child, and our experience was highly disappointing. After buying drinks, we were sitting there for half an hour when, five minutes before the Germany game started, they abruptly kicked us out. They claimed the area we were in was reserved for their friends, despite there being no reservation sign and the place being semi-empty. We even asked everyone around if the seats were free, and no one indicated otherwise.

Our child was very upset, and we had to leave despite there being plenty of space available. To make matters worse, they only accept cash payments, which raises some questions in this day and age.

Most importantly, the staff showed zero empathy for a family with a small child who was clearly distressed about being kicked out. This is simply unacceptable behavior. If you're a family, avoid this place at all costs. They are neither family-friendly nor child-friendly, and their actions were downright horrible."]

Name: Prater Beer Garden
Summary: Seasonal, self-service beer garden with 600 seats under chestnut trees, for locally brewed beers.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['My first beer garden experience, and it was everything I could have hoped for! So much seating, lively atmosphere, and 1L pints of beer. Food was good. Would like to spend more time here.

At my time of visit: when ordering beer you have to stand in one line, food in another. You have to pay a few € extra as a deposit and they give you a token, and when you return the glass and token you’ll get your deposit back (another line for returns).', 'Prater Beer Garden in Berlin is an exceptional spot for enjoying a lively and vibrant atmosphere. The crowd, full of energy and enthusiasm, adds to the enjoyable experience.
The beer garden offers a fantastic selection of food and beer, all of which are delicious and satisfying. With tables occupied well into midnight, it’s clear that this is a popular destination.
Whether you’re planning a team party or a casual meet-up, Prater Beer Garden provides the perfect setting for a memorable time. Highly recommended for its great ambience and delightful offerings!', 'I love a good beer garden on a sunny summer day and this place ticked all the right boxes. It has cold beer, warm food and a laid-back atmosphere: an ideal place to sit and chat.']

Name: Oderquelle
Summary: Typical dishes like roast pork & tarte flambée at a rustic bar/restaurant with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['I love roast pork. We got lucky by coming in without reservation, but reserve a table if you want to come here.

My friend is vegetarian and he got several options. 💚', "We came here for a traditional meal on the last night of our honeymoon as we wanted something suitable for a vegan and a meat eater.

What a fantastic place! The vegan pretzel dumplings with mushrooms are superb; a truly unique meal I will be dreaming about for a long time. My husband's pork and potato went down a treat. The staff were superb, the location was easy to find and the ambience was perfect for a cosy Sunday evening meal.", 'I had schnitzel and potato-cucumber salat. It was perfect summer food!']

Name: Les Valseuses Restaurant
Summary: Classic French bistro cooking & wines offered in relaxed quarters with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["I always come here with my French friends when we want a good meal, good wine, and a catch-up. The quality of food is incredible, the staff are friendly, and we always have an amazing night.
It's a small menu, but perfectly cooked.
The fries are the best in Berlin", 'Gorgeous little place. The food was amazing and the server was very sweet (and hilarious). I will definitely be returning! I can especially recommended the chicken with romesco and asparagus and the steak tatare.', 'A bit biased about my experience: loved the starters, the duck and the meat but didn’t like french fries a homemade mayo as much. Nice vibrant atmosphere and good service in general.

Noise level was way above average, we could hardly have a conversation and it felt like you’re surrounded by a cloud of voices coming from neighbor tables. This was the first time I ever had a problem with it since I’m not very sensitive. Might come back and just pick a table in the front room next time']

Name: Café Krone
Summary: Sandwiches, brunch & pancakes served in a rustic, warm venue that has a terrace & vegan options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['Definitely a gem in the neighborhood. I see a looong queue here a lot of weekends and now I understand why.

The food, staff, service, ambiance, all was great and we left with a smile on our faces.

The menu is extensive and we both love the savory and sweet plates.

We’ll be back to try more delicious food for sure.', "Loved the variety in the dishes they offer! We tried the pink beetroot soup, pistaciho pancakes and omelette toast and it honestly all tasted great. Also particularly loved the cold brew martini, highly recommend! They don't do reservations on weekends but do take card!", 'Although the café was really busy when we arrived, we only had to wait 10-15 mins and once sat down, our food and drinks came quickly (good job to the waitresses and chefs).
The tender surrender sandwich was easily one of the best sandwiches I’ve ever eaten 11/10!!!! My friend got the eggs benedict and said it was a great classic however considering the price, it could’ve maybe been decorated more. Would still highly recommend!!']

Name: Meta Restaurant
Summary: Schnitzels, meatballs & cheese spätzle, plus breakfasts, at a classic tavern with outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Looking for a traditional german place? Close to Mauer park, we found this really nice place with a german family vibe.\nWell served plates and great beer! For sure a tasty schnitzel!', 'Authentic German cuisine. Nice staff and friendly service. I would only wish for them to add a couple of more non meat options on the menu.', "Had a nice weekday dinner at this place. It was not crowded and is much larger on the inside than I originally thought. I had the kasespatzel and it was really good. It arrived quickly after ordering. The man working was also very nice and helpful to me. Will definitely come back when I'm in the area."]

Name: Naan Indische Spezialitäten
Summary: Samosas, pakoras & a long menu of spicy curries at a cozy, candlelit venue with a sidewalk terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['A nice Indian restaurant. I like the dal with vegetables here. The garlic naan here is simply amazing. The samosa we tried was nicely done too. The staff is friendly and gave us some good suggestions.', 'Bhatura with spinach curry sauce it was just amazing! Very nice to sit outside. Good price and perfect quality, must to visit if you like real indian food🫶🏼', 'A great location in a lively area where residents, locals and tourists meet. If you choose the ourdoor seats, ask for a blanket to stay warm. If you prefer to sit inside you are closer to the bar and the waiters to draw their attention. In any case you will be flashed by the great choice of drinks and food. And the prices are fair. The service is very atrentive and friendly.']

Name: Prinzen Falafel Imbiss
Summary: Compact eatery whipping up Middle Eastern fast-food staples such as falafels & shawarmas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ["Very tasty falafel and shwarma wraps, much better value than in the nearby mauerpark flea market stands.. only complaint is the salad j side, towards the bottom of the wrap there was nore of the chunky salad than anything else, it felt like it was a bit stuffed out for volume.. Still, I'd go back and give it another chance..", 'Few falafel joints even offer baba ganoush, let alone nail this most delicious of all Middle Eastern dishes. Their falafel, hummus, and tahini sauce are likewise on point. Overall, an unbeatable price-to-quality-to-quantity ratio, and all their vegan items are clearly labeled as such. Cash only.', 'They do the best Baba Ganoush in rollo in Berlin. The falafel is exquisite and super fresh also. And the have not increased the prices like most of the competence!!']

Name: Burger World Berlin
Summary: A big menu of burgers, including vegan options, in a hip, shabby-chic place with a large terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['We had the vegan options chili cheese fries and the chicken wings. The taste itself was quite good but definitely overpriced for what it was. 11€ for fries is crazy…

Btw, I wonder why they call it «\xa0vegan chili con carne\xa0» instead of just chili sin carne lol.', 'The place is clearly unique, with a very nice atmosphere. The burgers are delicious, including the vegan options. Service was fast and friendly. A must go!', 'The burgers are beyond delicious!
The service is fantastic, the waiting staff made our visit incredible they were highly attentive and made us feel special even though they were very busy! There is a wonderful atmosphere. Great music at a volume where you don’t have to shout to talk, and lots of happy well fed folks.']

Name: Mediterraneo
Summary: Old-fashioned restaurant with outdoor seating offering pizza, pasta, steak & other standards.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
["This is such a great location and it's a shame about the food. Both of us ordered pasta and neither of us were very satisfied. I won't say this is the worst carbonara I've ever had, but it comes close. Barely any ham, lacked seasoning, very sure it was roux based instead of just cream and egg. Tasted more like a stodgy Alfredo and the majority went back to the kitchen uneaten.", "We got there 20 minutes before the kitchen closed, but I don’t think that should excuse the quality of the pasta dishes we got. I ordered the carbonara, which is my favorite pasta dish, but it really didn't taste or look like any carbonara I've had before. My partner had the bolognese, and honestly, we’ve had better from a can. The portions were big, but that’s the only positive thing I can say.

Also, our server never even asked if we liked our meals, which kind of says it all.

Usually, I read reviews thoroughly before trying a new restaurant. But we were nearby for the Filmrauschpalast. My bad because, wow. I really wouldn’t recommend eating here. We certainly won’t come back.", 'The food was ok , nothing to complain about, beer 🍺 ist good also the dessert is very good ! Totally is not expensive, so I gave them 4 stars .']

Name: Güllü Lahmacun
Summary: Humble counter-service operation dispensing informal Turkish bites like gözleme & manti.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["Simple place, serving great and very cheap freshly cooked food. We just had a spinach and cheese gozleme and a drink, sitting outside in the evening, all of which was really pleasant. It was quiet when we arrived but by the time that we left,  all 4 outdoor tables were full. It's a popular place! There is indoor seating too.
No alcohol is served here and because of street construction works that are going on in the daytime, it was very quiet and peaceful at 9pm on a Saturday evening.
The main chef speaks English too which helped us
Like so many other  places in Berlin, it's a cash only place.", 'First time trying manti and surprisingly taste so good. The yoghurt sauce was not overpowering, overall everything combined very well. Definitely will come back. They also sell the manti for you to cook at home', 'Excellent manti (had the classic) gozleme (had with chilli and cheese) and borek and great prices. Yes,  I actually ate all of this, alone. That’s how delish it all was. You can see the women in the back room rolling out the dough and making the manti from scratch.']

Name: Belle Alliance
Summary: Global breakfast fare plus coffee & cocktails at a chic brunch spot with a flower-lined terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['Had a fantastic breakfast at Belle Alliance today. Service and food were excellent. The owner, Rodi, came out to greet and say hello. I had the Spicy Baked Beans and it was delicious! Very large portion.\n\nHighly recommend coming to Belle Alliance for breakfast or brunch.', 'Good place, nice interiors, friendly staff. The food is good, maybe not just for my taste (little too many spices for my taste). The food is presented beautifully. It was quickly cooked. I didn’t quite enjoy the bread though, I prefer the softer one. The place slightly on the pricey side.', 'One of the best cafes we encountered in our Berlin trip. The staff were very nice, the place was really cute and the food was absolutely delicious. 100% recommended!!!']

Name: Cocoro
Summary: Ramen noodle soups & beef-topped rice bowls, plus matcha drinks & sake, at a snug neighborhood stop.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Cute clean place. The lady that served us was extremely friendly, smiley and with an amazing vibe. The food was fresh and good, amazing non alcoholic cocktails.', 'The portion size was a bit too small for me. After the main course, I was still somewhat hungry. The main dish was mostly rice and a bit underwhelming. The matcha ice cream was great tho.', 'Since my partner tried out this restaurant during one of her lunch breaks in 2016, we have been coming here regularly - and it’s been one of, if not THE, favorite place of mine. The owners are so kind, sweet and authentic; and the food is amazing, too!']

Name: Cancún Kreuzberg
Summary: Restaurant serving a variety of Mexican dishes as well as offering cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Reviews: ['It started off amazing. We ordered some cocktails which were super tasty. There is a great selection of them. The food portions are very large and our starter tasted great. The issue was one our mains came there was clearly flies in both of our salads. When I informed a waitress working there she said I was wrong and it was not a fly. This put a large downer on the mood. I checked again with a waiter who acknowledged and apologised immediately and replaced for fresh.', 'It was an amazing experience! Very friendly staff, they still prepared a meal for me when the kitchen was about to close and even recommended an excellent dessert! I can assure you will have a great time here :)', 'The food was very nice and very well decorated. The quantity was good as well (I ordered mixata)\nA bit pricy but I guess it is worthy for the location, specially in summer. Recommended at least once']

Name: Dolden Mädel Ratsherrn Braugasthaus Berlin
Summary: Stylish pub pouring a wide choice of draft & bottled beers, with sandwiches & burgers plus a garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["The garden atmosphere here is excellent, and the menu offers a nice variety of food. We tried the goulash and beef stroganoff, which were okay. Service was a bit slow, but we'd return to try other dishes and enjoy the garden setting.", "Fish and chips .... needed seasonings. The only thing I could taste was oil.  Also pickled cucumbers and sour cream on the side, really doesn't pair together. Tartar sause and pickles, even anything else, than sour cream. My friends dish was a burger and he ate it like a stew because it was swimming in sauce. It was better than mine, tho. Lovely staff and place, but for the price of the food, they have some work to do.", 'I highly recommend a degustation set of beer, a “true love” set of meal and tiramisu IPA - everything was absolutely delicious!']

Name: Veggie & Vega - Restaurant Berlin
Summary: Straightforward eatery with a casual vibe specializing in vegetarian & vegan South Indian cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Incredibly delicious vegan dishes! Waiter was friendly, service was surprisingly quick given the many clients and single waiter. They play fun music to make for a good vibe. So happy I chose to try this cuisine, definitely inspired to try southern indian again! 10/10 would recommend to anybody with a love for elaborate tastes.', 'I feel mean giving this a three - the staff were lovely and attentive, the atmosphere was nice once you found it tucked behind the shop, the price is great and my food (bindi masala) was good. However, the samosa pastry was too thick and a little undercooked, and salad seemed a weird side to serve with all the curries. The bindi masala was very salty, so although nice left me feeling very dehydrated. My friend who got the palak paneer was very disappointed, said it tasted strange and the paneer was quite like halloumi rather than paneer. But the staff were very keen to please, and the menu was huge - almost too much choice!', 'really cute! it‘s tucked away inside a store and you order at the cash register, food came fast and the portion was pretty good for the prize, but it could’ve been hotter for my taste']

Name: Lichtburg
Summary: Polished eatery with red walls & banquette seating, plus a shaded terrace, serving German cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['We had lunch here, and had perhaps hoped for a bit better quality food - and was somewhat disappointed. Everything tasted okay, but nothing really exciting. The pizzas are only available after 14.00 and we arrived around noon. They didn’t have any children’s menu but could make smaller portions of some of the dishes.', 'Love this place, beautiful food, friendly service. There was an issue with wifi for payment and as an apology they gave us free espressos.  Little gestures are important', 'My partner and I visited this restaurant during a weekend we spent in Berlin in June.
Looking forward to trying a schnitzel, we came to this place.
The menu incorporates some international dishes with some Italian ones, including also the schnitzel we wanted to have.
As the picture will show, the schnitzel we had was very tasty, but mostly, we appreciated the attentive and kind service - our waiter made us feel very welcome.
We recommend trying this restaurant due to the quality of the food and the service offered to customers.']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 2:00 AM, 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 7:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 7:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: Open 24 hours, Sunday: Open 24 hours
Reviews:
['This McDonald’s is easily accessible from the platforms at the station, making it a great place for a quick bite or to sit and relax before your next destination. I visited one afternoon when it was very busy, and I had to wait several minutes before one of the kiosks became available. However, when I visited in the morning, it was much quieter, and the food was prepared quickly.

Unfortunately, there are no toilet facilities, which is why I’m deducting two stars. It’s important to wash your hands before a meal, especially if you enjoy finger foods like fries or nuggets. The lack of any toilet facility is disappointing.', 'It’s just weird that there is literally NO GAS in their cola every time I visit, no matter cola regular or light or zero🥴 if you order one, you’re basically drinking sugar water that is warm, they also don’t bother to put ice cubes in them anymore.
Also, if you take out, always check the bags at the counter to make sure nothing is missing, they seem to forget things sometimes.', "The food is always slow, I see many times when I have been here. The employees will be just talking and food will be lying there on the stand. I asked and showed them. They said they have to follow the order and something. They didn't even care for one cappuccino once I ordered it's been 7 mins to get one."]

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Sunday: 5:30 – 6:00 AM
Reviews:
['The indian manager  lady is so rude , i ordered food and pickup through uber eats.
I waited at store for more than 30 minutes after the given pickup time .
I asked how much time she always said two minutes .
Then the some guys come after me they got their order before.
When i asked her she was so rude .
If we are paying and getting this behavior from manager.

No more subway gesundbrunen', 'I ordered sub from the sub application where it shows the store is open on Sunday for 24 hours ans I place an order they confirmed my order and shows ready also . I tried to call them the number was out of reach i thought they have given wrong number .I went there to pickup but there is no direction for the pickup from the Gesundbrunnen Center as it’s Sunday the Center is closed . I waited there for 30 min searching for the entrance but at end I gave up and went back.', "Yesterday I paid a visit to this branch, but I regret to say that I am very disappointed. The personnel were very rude and unfriendly. The food was not edible. I don't recommend this Branch. Check out Templofer Hafen branch, you won't regret the experience."]

Name: Curry Baude Gesundbrunnen
Summary: Intimate counter-service specializing in currywurst, fries & other comfort fare.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ["I can't comment on food as that was my first time having currywurst but they have the most compositable prices I've seen in Berlin.  The couple owners were so nice.", 'This is a good place to taste traditional Berliner curry sausages. The food itself is not really special but the shop owner is quite nice and ambitious with his business!', 'Visitors in the market for currywurst are often directed to big names like Curry 36 or Konnopke’s Imbiss. But locals prefer Curry Baude, little more than a window tacked on the side of the Gesundbrunnen U-Bahn station. The sausage attains the perfect equilibrium of crispy yet juicy, the ketchup-to-curry ratio is near-perfect, and the pommes are perfectly portioned to balance out the meat. Sure, the service may be especially gruff, even by German standards, but that’s part of the charm. [$]']

Name: Restaurant Bella Italia
Summary: Casual restaurant serving Italian pasta, pizza & grill dishes, with a special children's menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Amazing food.\nRisotto was brilliant and so was the pizza. I really recommend the salmon with pasta it was so good!', 'Decent prices, tasty dishes. We took spaghetti and pizza. Very nice service, although tardy: there were not too many people and we had to wait 10min for a beer, for 6 people we were brought 2 cards from the menu. Strange rules. Overall we left satisfied.', 'The worst experience ever. We have ordered 4 dishes and none of them was good. Vitello Tonato was covered with mayonnaise instead of special sauce. Antipasti were fried in oil vegetables and mozzarella. No salt, no spice, no taste, only oil. Pizza was worst than from supermarket- because it seems it was heated, not backed (150 degrees in the oven instead of 250-300). And the chicken breast was tasteless, like it was boiled and then covered with tomato sauce.']

Name: Smack Burger
Summary: Offbeat restaurant serving burgers, grilled cheese sandwiches & poutine, plus desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["Yesterday, I ordered from Smack Burger at Badstraße 66, Berlin, BE 13357 via Uber Eats. I got their Single Smash Burger and Homemade Fries. It took the delivery guy a long time to find me, and communication was challenging. When I finally got my food, it was really cold.

The fries portion was shockingly small and tasted cold and disgusting. The Smash Burger was better than the fries but still nothing more than an average street burger. Honestly, I'm surprised that over 5,000 people have given them more than 4.5 stars on Uber Eats.", 'Best burger in Berlin. I have visited them multiple times, the taste is consistent as well.
Dine in area is small. Perfect for takeaways.', "First of all, I can say it was the best hamburger I've ever had in my life. We ordered the patty melt. The bread, the meat and the cheese ratio was perfect. It is definitely one of the dishes I will eat next time I come to Berlin. I am very happy to taste such a burger, I really recommend it! 🍔 💖"]

Name: W.n.9 - Oyster bar and kitchen
Summary: Cozy neighborhood hangout with a terrace, serving aperitifs & sophisticated seafood plates.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Wow, really good seafood which is so rare to come across in Berlin. Everything was great and loved the orange wine, splendid', 'I recently visited this exceptional oyster bar that truly exceeded my expectations. I had the oysters that were incredibly fresh, bursting with flavor, and the mussels were a standout—plump, perfectly cooked, and absolutely delicious. The warm, welcoming staff added to the delightful experience, making the atmosphere as inviting as the food was delectable. Love this place, it is a gem for those who want to have romantic dinner and into seafood of course!!', 'Great cozy find in my neighborhood! The employees are really kind and attentive, the homemade food is exquisite, wine and oysters of great quality at a very friendly price. Definitely a new favorite in the area, will be back!']

Name: Taverna Olympia
Summary: Mediterranean standards like meze & gyros in a simple, rustic space with black-&-white photos.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:30 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Excellent food and superb service. Very convenient prices', 'What a restaurant…Rustic decoration, with delicious and very well prepared food!

I visited this space with a group of 5 people and we ended up ordering several dishes, ending up becoming a tasting which ended with a delicious dessert.

I also highlight the friendliness of those who served us, and the versatility of having two menus: One in German and the other in English.

The Final Price: 110€.', 'Nice local restaurant with friendly greek atmosphere. The food was good but they messed the order, that’s why it’s 4 of 5']

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
["I've been to maybe 10 Subways in different countries by now and this one had one of the best choices I've seen. The bread was pretty fresh too. Overall good.
On the other hand, my bread was torn before being used and it would have been better if the employees had changed it, but they didn't which made eating it a bit difficult. But nothing major.
Most of the staff spoke English too, so that's a plus.", 'Better than American Subway by far! There are so many options for the sandwich toppings including potatoes, chicken nuggets, and fancy sauces. The options also seemed nice and fresh. However, I wish they sold regular Doritos, but that’s not a major deal. As always the food was prepared quickly and it was easy to communicate as a non-German speaker.', 'Very delicate bread and filings.
Excellent service.
Music is not too loud.
The only thing missing is the toilet.']

Name: Cafe Hermann Eicke
Summary: Trendy breakfasts, bagels, sandwiches & espresso in a hip, minimalist space with an industrial feel.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Reviews:
["The café is really cozy, and it's in a nice spot with super friendly staff. They're pros at what they do, and the prices are fair. I have to say, the cakes and coffee are absolutely delicious.

The service is warm and welcoming, and the whole vibe is great. But, you know, inside could be a bit tidier and calmer. That's the only thing I'd say could be better. Overall, though, it's a cool spot, especially with that awesome outdoor area in the summer.", 'Today it was my second time here, i ordered Americano(seems like middle size), i paid 4,40€… only for very ordinary black coffee.
because i took paper to-go cup.

Because of the environment. of course environment is important. but this is just an excuse.
they aim to eco-friendly, but not a customer friendly. disappointed.', 'A perfect and quaint experience at Herman Eicke!

I went for a solo brunch at Hermann Eicke on my last day in Berlin.

The interiors were clean and there were many spaces to sit.
I noticed a few guests were working from their laptops; so I could sense the vibe here was a nice place to chill but also work if you needed to.

Service was fast and professional! I opted for the Avocadotoast and added a poached egg. It was brilliant! Fresh, tasty and vibrant. It exceeded my expectations!

I also got an orange immune booster to just perk me up! It was tasty too!

Price is just right, you get quality food for what you pay for! Plenty of options on such a simple menu.

Thank you!']

Name: Domino's Pizza Berlin Brunnenviertel
Summary: Delivery/carryout chain offering a wide range of pizzas & a variety of other dishes & sides.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['I ordered Dominoes Delivery tonight and was extremely disappointed by the pizza that arrived. I asked for pineapple,corn and chicken in a make your own pizza and they did not put any pineapple. Unfortunately the pizza is also burnt :(
Additionally I also ordered make your own and put pepperoni on the pizza and the whole pizza was burnt and I wasn’t even able to eat it.

Please be aware if you order dominoes to go as this was extremely disappointing for me.', 'Frankly, the service is what takes off a star. 20 minutes waiting for a pizza. Not busy, just nobody at the counter. Otherwise, the pizza is great. The flavors are great and the taste never leaves me feeling like anything was lacking EXCEPT: MORE MEAT PLEASE. I feel like they do skimp a bit on the protein. Not good. Hence, 3 stars.', 'This is my third time but today The gnuner garden pizza was horrible and dry , no cheese..sorry to say but really disappointed !! Would like to have a replacement. You can clearly see in the picture thie pizza slices are hard and dry, such a waste of money and time.']

Name: Café & Bistro freysinn
Summary: Salads, soups & pasta dishes, plus vegetarian picks, in a charming space with sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Delicious food, you can go every day and you will find a wide range of options. Vegan and not vegan but healthy.', "The food was nice, great value for price but the service was terrible. We didn't feel welcome at all as we are clearly tourists. The woman who took our order didn't even try to speak slowly in order we could understand the german menu, even though we do understand german, and was very impatient for us to make our choice. When we asked for something to drink, she just pointed at the fridge without any explanation. It was good because we were looking for something in this area, but wouldn't come back for it.", 'Nice cozy local place with a great selection of business lunches for ~ 8 Euro.']

Name: Nguyen Kitchen
Summary: Sushi, noodle dishes & other Asian fare in a contemporary, family-run venue with outdoor seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['This restaurant serves delicious Vietnamese food. The atmosphere is pleasant and cozy. The staff is friendly and attentive. Moreover, the washroom facilities are impressively designed, reflecting a high-class approach to both style and cleanliness, adding to the overall quality of your time at the restaurant.', 'Great Vietnamese place. Quite cheap by European standards (10€/lunch), large portions, very good.\n\nOn pics are udon and avocado-something from the lunch menu and those were delicious. I eat quite a lot and a lunch portion was enough for me.', "Food is sure more fast-food (overbacked, etc.), but quite good, but service is very bad. Once the waiter was too lazy to wipe the table after rain for me. Today I asked the waiter twice to place an order, but they simply ignored me. The atmosphere is so-so, with a lot of people, from Wedding, and Gesundbrunnen, if you know what I mean. I won't come here again."]

Name: Max und Moritz
Summary: Relaxed, old-timey bar & restaurant, established in 1902, with a local German menu & a ballroom.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['Had a really great time at Max and Moritz, despite it being incredibly busy and us needing to wait for food for about an hour.
We had a table outside and enjoyed a good weather.

The staff was really friendly and when the food finally arrived it didnt disappoint. It wasnt the best Ive tried (especially the soup, thought it wasnt the best and could be bigger for the main dish) but we really liked the experience. Schnitzel and bread were awesome.', 'Food was really delicious and the staff was super nice. The enviroment is very relaxed. Try the Flammkuchen its amazing.', 'Wonderful restaurant serving up generous portions of hearty German food! Lovely staff, nice atmosphere and delicious food! Highly recommend the gulash and the Strudel.']

Name: 3 Sisters
Summary: Cafe-restaurant with a high ceiling, arched windows & German cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['What a great meal I had here! We were welcomed very friendly and were directed to the terrace in the garden. Such a beautiful place to eat. The meal itself was of very high quality and more than enough. A big compliment to the entire team, I will definitely recommend this place to others!', 'Unique location, great service, tasty food and an interesting mix of the menu - traditional dishes are mixed with some dishes which have a modern twist and vegan options - finally a menu which satisfies many different tastes at once! Definitely not my last time dining there', 'Amazing and calming place ❤️ the food is great and full of taste']

Name: Maroush
Summary: Meats, halloumi & falafel, served on a plate or in pita bread, at a humble stop with a few benches.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews: ["One of the best Lebanese foods I've had. Amazing food, with great hummus and pita. Does not have a lot of seating but I managed to get a place to sit every time I visit. I would for sure go back again when I crave for some delicious Lebanese food.", 'Great food. One of the best Labenese fast food in town. Need to work on seating arrangement and hygene. But I guess this what you get in such low budget options.', "Absolutely the best shawarma I've ever had! The vegetables were incredibly fresh, the meat was perfectly cooked, and the staff were super friendly. Plus, it's really affordable at just €4.50 for a delicious shawarma. This is a must-visit spot if you're in Berlin!"]

Name: Tadim
Summary: Simple venue with outdoor tables, making Turkish dishes like döner kebabs, Iskender kebabs & pide.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Read it on a blog, apparently it was the number one Döner Spot and i swear to god. The chicken was inedible. The only redeeming quality were the warm fries and i was hungry. Disgusting', 'Really good döner in Berlin! Sizes are gigantic and it tastes like kiss of Allah!', "We'd heard this was one of the best places for doner in Berlin. The bread was good but neither the meat nor the falafel was anything special. The two men working behind the counter almost seemed as though they'd rather we hadn't come in. Maybe it was an off night but from this experience I'd say you don't need to go out of your way to eat here."]

Name: Angry Chicken
Summary: Korean spicy fried chicken, plus burgers, noodles & bibimbap rice, in a compact, low-key space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['It is one of the best places to try the Korean spiciest chicken recipes.

Dishes served with different levels of hotness🔥🔥🌶🌶.

Enjoyed the spicy and hot dishes in berlin after a long tym. Value for money. Definitely recommendable!👌', "I was extremely happy with this food. From a very long time I wanted to eat proper Korean chicken and finally I found it. You can choose chickens in different tastes and they all taste cool. Hotdog was top of the top for me! It really was my taste. Everything also looked nice. The only thing which I would change is the quality of a chicken, I had a feeling that it's a cheap sort of chicken and it would be 10 times nicer if it would be a better one.", 'the chicken was okay, the sauce was a bit bland, not good as before. Hamburger was horrible, the patties were black burned ☹️']

Name: Sabore
Summary: Breakfast plates, meze & grills, plus vegan options, in rustic-chic surrounds or at sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Really nice food and really nice servers! We also had the most delicious rioja with our meal. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner. Good for vegetarians too. Cozy, casual but makes for a special meal with friends or a date night.', 'Sabore by Chef Mario, near Kotti, you can experience the passion for Napolitan cuisine expressed in every dish, from their pizzas, to their pastas, antipasti and desserts

We were impressed us by the quality, presentation and taste of the pizzas, some of which have been honoured with national and international awards

We tried 3 of their pizzas, including the award-winning Pizza Liguori - The Legend (19€), Pizza Burrata & Mortadella (19€), and Pizza Diavolo “Sabore” (17€) that came literally in flames!', 'Without a doubt, the best pizza in town! Amazing doe and the highest quality produce for toppings, including the most important ingredient: love (for pizza). Mario is a true Italian "patrone" and Maria provides amazing service. 5 stars!']

Name: Oranienberger
Summary: Late-night bar serving coffee, tea & cocktails in an intimate space with a bohemian vibe.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['So, we came here on a pub crawl. It was empty when we arrived, completely empty on a Saturday night. Yeah, yeah. *claps*\nAnd then, you should leave this review, that would be hilarious.\nAnd then, to top it off, they had NO BEER. In capitals. That’s better.', 'Such a great bar, lovely staff and such a great atmosphere. Highly recommend!', 'Amazing bar, great service Incredible vibes and the staff were very accommodating']

Name: Orania.Restaurant & Orania.Bar
Summary: High-end, international food & cocktails are served in this refined space with live music.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 6:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 6:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 6:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Friday: 6:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 6:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 6:30 AM – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
['I‘ve actually sympathized with going to the Orania Restaurant for at least a couple of years. I guess the trigger was one of the very first articles I‘ve read about the „Peking/Kreuzberg Duck Menu“ and the (intrinsic) stopper probably was the restaurant being a „hotel restaurant“. I‘ve to admit, I gave the place a first check by visiting the Bar for some drinks after a stroll with a friend on Oranienstreet the other day. And guess what, our Bar experience was amazing!
So the Orania Restaurant became my very first choice for this year’s birthday dinner, to finally go for the „mysterious“ Kreuzberg Duck (X-Bergs answer to the Peking Duck)! Not sure if there’s a word cut here and therefore giving the executive summary first: w/o question… one of the top 5 culinary experiences in Berlin for me over the past 21years I‘d the pleasure of living & enjoying many-many wonderful & inspirational culinary events here.
No way of mentioning even some of them here w/o dissing/missing others. As well I‘d the opportunity to run some wonderful & mystic places as part of an awesome team myself.
Ok. Let’s cut the marketing blabla. Listen folks, as a trained chef, a foodie & service lover by DNA as well as someone who fully gets, reads & understands the challenges of the moment, this experience was simply „Extraordinary“!
The four course Kreuzberg Duck menu has been one of the top notch culinary & value4money experiences in Berlin EVER! On top of that the food was accompanied by an out of ordinary level of service. I‘d guess, that over the 4 courses we‘d had a minimum of 10 different service & chef people at the table. Might sound stressful, but believe me, it was a pure pleasure to get to know every single one of them, especially because of their so much away from average commitment & positive energy which came with each & everyone!
Folks, hands on my heart, I paid the full bill and this feedback is 100% personal, not paid at all and simply based on my beliefs to „give back“!
Before ending, my wife’s favorite part of a menu is the dessert (-> yeahhh, she’s a true sweetheart 😍) and even here, these crazy folks not only send their „TV style Pattissière“ to our table, but she also dropped some freaking amazing, no chi-chi & simply really tasty desserts.
Ok. I get it. It’s seems far too much for an unpaid review, but hej, how much crap, average, overrated and simply „not ever come back shit“ have you been going through!?
So I thought, I‘d might want to allow myself to get really carried away for once 😉!
Again, very personal, very much of a Monday evening and very-very slightly infused by birthday emotions.
Simply fueled by a very special experience, which I believe needs to be shared! N-joy folks!', "Returning to Orania for my second visit was an absolute delight. Nestled within a charming hotel, this restaurant offers a unique dining experience where the open kitchen concept takes center stage. Being able to watch the culinary team at work adds an intimate touch to the meal, bridging the gap between chef and diner.

The food, without a doubt, was exceptional. Each dish was a sophisticated blend of flavors, clearly showcasing the kitchen's dedication to quality and creativity. What stood out just as much was the professionalism and attentiveness of the staff. Their attention to detail ensured a flawless dining experience from start to finish.

I left Orania feeling thoroughly impressed once again. For anyone looking for an exquisite dining experience in Berlin, I wholeheartedly recommend Orania. It's not just a meal; it's an experience that speaks to the senses and lingers in memory.", 'Everything is almost OK. In my opinion, the last course, which is fried rice, could be better, why? Because the first course and second course is full of flavors, the fried rice is missing some salt or sauce, maybe. And i would like to have a "real rice," not some crispy rice.🤷‍♀️']

Name: Butterbrot
Summary: A menu of breakfasts, big salads & pastas, plus some Middle Eastern dishes, in a relaxed eatery.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews: ['My husband and I found this cozy little breakfast spot during our stay in Berlin. We had a wonderful experience because the man and woman who run it are SO sweet and accommodating. The food was delicious and it was such a quiet, cute place to enjoy breakfast in the neighborhood. HIGHLY recommend the fresh squeezed orange juice! 🧡', 'Small and cute cafe with really nice breakfast options and tasty coffee too. Very tasty mix with some Turkish flair, which is always great in Berlin. The service was very nice, kind. Good experience!', 'Divine breakfast place! Loved unusual dishes and combinations of savory and sweet snacks. Absolutely stunning portions for 2 people to share. Very good americano. The waitress was very sweet and helpful.']

Name: Cevicheria
Summary: Ceviche & grilled seafood, plus pisco sours, in a pared-back dining room or at outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Great ceviche! Very high quality ingredients and the taste. Lovely staff and atmosphere. Highly recommended!', 'Cevicheria in Berlin is a standout dining destination for anyone craving authentic Peruvian cuisine in a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. This charming restaurant brings the rich flavors of Peru to the heart of Berlin, offering a delightful culinary experience that is both flavorful and memorable.

The menu at Cevicheria showcases a variety of traditional Peruvian dishes, with a particular focus on ceviche, which is prepared with the freshest ingredients and expertly balanced flavors. Each dish is a testament to the skill and passion that goes into creating Peruvian cuisine. The ceviche, in particular, is a highlight, featuring perfectly marinated fish with a zesty, tangy kick that captures the essence of Peru’s culinary heritage.

In addition to the exceptional food, Cevicheria boasts a fantastic selection of drinks. From refreshing pisco cocktails to expertly crafted mocktails, the beverage menu complements the food perfectly and adds to the overall dining experience.

What truly elevates the visit to Cevicheria is the service. The staff are not only attentive and friendly but also genuinely passionate about the food they serve. A special mention goes to "Valery," a great waiter from Peru who adds a personal touch to the experience. Valery’s warmth, knowledge, and enthusiasm make every meal at Cevicheria feel special. His recommendations and genuine care enhance the dining experience, making guests feel right at home.

Overall, Cevicheria is a must-visit for anyone in Berlin looking to indulge in delicious Peruvian cuisine. With its great food, excellent drinks, and outstanding service, it promises a dining experience that is both enjoyable and authentic.', 'A friend of mine brought me here and introduced me to a lovely owner. We had a great evening here. Amazing food, amazing atmosphere. We are different plates. All prepared with love.
There is  good selection of wine and cocktails 🍸']

Name: Com A Sushi & Asia Grill
Summary: Sushi platters, Thai curries, Vietnamese classics & Asian grills in a chic, modern space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Their seafood bowl lunch deal during the week is fantastic - fresh, tasty, and great value for money. The service is also attentive and friendly. Their sushi menu is good too. Highly recommend if you’re in the area.', 'Lovely spot for dinner! I had a “Buddha bowl” and a set of avocado maki 😋 The food arrived very fast, and it was delicious!', 'Very nice atmosphere. Food was delicious and a lot of it. The “Homemade drinks” were delicious too! Staff is friendly too :)']

Name: ORA Restaurant & Wine Bar
Summary: Seasonal European plates paired with an extensive wine list in a converted 19th-century apothecary.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Food is created as a perfect set of well balanced menu - just go for the full option and you won’t regret it! Wonderful German Chardonnay. Lovely service. But the just after the food (which is obviously super good and the most important) just make sure you pay attention to the interior… with booking a spot inside, to feel the vibe :) great place!', 'We had dinner at Ora as a group of 25 people (team dinner) and this we had a set menu for the evening. The kindness of the service and atmosphere of the restaurant were great, I really liked this old apothecary vibe. Although the food was good and extremely fresh (there was even a living worm 🐛in the green salad…), it took quite long between each dishes so dinner felt quite tiring due to the wait.\nOverall would recommend for the vibe.', "Great find, excellent way to try local cuisine.   Portions aren't massive but the quality excellent.  The staff are helpful and there is a good selection of quality wines.  Best to book a table.  Very popular"]

Name: leo e pepe
Summary: Refined, traditional restaurant plating Italian dishes such as stone-oven pizza & pasta.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Great food , even greater people. 5/5 would absolutely recommend to everyone. Will definitely come back if in Berlin again.', 'I have tried several restaurants, but the bestest dish I ever loved in entire Berlin was mousse al cioccolato. Its a mouth watering dessert which has dark chocolate and coffee taste and as you put in in your mouth, it melts like butter. Delicious is also a very small word I would say. Do try it once if you visit this restaurant.', 'My best Italian restaurant in Berlin. Tasty food and excellent service. All waiters are great very polite and professional. Pizza is fantastic but I love the most Gnocchi e Pepe ❤️👌']

Name: Zollhaus Pankow
Summary: Hip eatery, bar & beer garden serving Neapolitan pizza & Mediterranean fare in a restored brewery.
