Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Great food at a nice venue. Pizzas are very good with a decent selection of other Italian antipasti and mains. The ribs were a bit too sweet for our liking but nonetheless well prepared. Lovely ambiance, service was friendly and attentive.', "This place has such great pizzas!!! They have a great selection of pizzas and have great pizzas for kids and a sandpit for the children to be entertained in. However, I didn't like how slow the service was; they forgot about our pizza order so we ended up waiting for them for about 2 hours. I hope they fix that problem soon. 7/10", 'Fantastic pizza and wines.
The base is light and fluffy, nice selection on the menu.
The outdoor spaces look great, although we sat inside as it was a little cold the evening we visited.

Look forward to going again!

Outdoor space is also great. Lovely big beer garden style with pizza and bar menu. 😋']

Name: Burger King
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Pretty small Burger King. If the store is packed you will have a hard time finding a seat. I was satisfied with my order. No items were missing and they accept coupons aswell. I had to wait 5 minutes before receiving my order. Male Toilet was not dirty. All in all I visited much worse Burger King stores', "I recently purchased two menus and two extra burgers from Burger King, but unfortunately, upon arriving home and inspecting the order, I found that they had once again made errors. This isn't the first time I've experienced such issues with their service.\n\nFirstly, instead of receiving the Chicken Clubhouse Burger as ordered, I was given a chicken nugget burger, which I personally dislike. Furthermore, none of the menus included the fries that were supposed to accompany them. Additionally, they provided random dips, none of which were the ones I had ordered.   I'm too tired to go back there, but I'll certainly never eat from there again.", 'Sold me undercooked burger. No apologies. No compensation.']

Name: Sao Mai
Summary: Stylish restaurant with outdoor tables serving Vietnamese classics, such as pho & spring rolls.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 12:30 – 10:30 PM
Reviews:
["I must say, it's an absolute gem! The food was incredibly delicious, with every dish bursting with flavor. What really stood out was the value for money. For such high-quality food, the prices are exceptionally reasonable, making it one of the best price-performance ratios I've experienced in Berlin. The portions were generous, and the service was attentive and friendly. I'll definitely be back! 😊", "Located at Nollendorfplatz, a bustling district in Berlin, especially at night, you'll find a fantastic Vietnamese restaurant called Sao Mai.

I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry Mango for less than €10, which is affordable compared to other restaurants. The portion is generous, the chicken is cooked perfectly and crispy, and the vegetables are fresh. Overall, the food is excellent.

The service is decent, and the most important aspect is the cozy and awesome atmosphere. Highly recommended if you want to try Vietnamese food in this area.", 'The food is good for the price paid.  Don’t expect global standard 5* and you won’t be disappointed. Ordered tofu and vegetables with rice and it cost around €7. Nice enough flavours and large portion for the price paid. The service was pleasant and the food was served quickly. One point less because when sitting inside, the place had a ‘wet dog’ smell and a day later, I cannot get the smell out of my jacket despite using plenty of Febreeze - next time will sit in the tent outside.']

Name: Restaurant Boccacelli am Winterfeldtplatz Berlin
Summary: Large pizzas, homemade pasta & classic Italian mains in a snug room with a wall of wine bottles.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 2:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['We ate there today and I got a season dish - was extremely delicious! Fish was very juicy and the lime sauce was just amazing! I tried fish in many good restaurants, but not always they manage to cook a fish well. We will definitely come back! The pizza of my partner was also tasty 😊', 'Great pasta, cozy Italian atmosphere, and friendly service. A perfect spot for a tasty, relaxed meal!', "Service was good,  the staff does their job, and are attempted.  The atmosphere is relax and beautiful. The pasta dishes were good, I could trust them to cook parta for me again. The steak tho, it was missing salt. I don't. Like adding salt after, because it's not the same. It was still good, but could be so much better"]

Name: Vegup — powered by plants
Summary: Down-home restaurant offering plant-based Asian cuisine & smoothies in a casual dining area.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['A rich variety of delicious vegetarian meals.
The price is very affordable. The service was quick despite the busy hour.

The sweet potato glass noodles are great as are the rice bowl and the seasonal dishes.
Moreover, I can recommend the homemade drinks.

There portions are filling but not satisfying.

Design and interior are lovely and there is space to eat outside.

Service was exceptionally friendly and helpful. (^_^)', 'Absolutely delicious meal at Vegup. The flavours in all of the dishes were incredible. I had the udon curry and it was very good. Friendly staff, clean and modern restaurant with relaxed atmosphere. Lots of nice options for food and drink', 'Great Asian food - Vietnamese, Korean and more. Interesting deep tastes, good prices and service.']

Name: Tor Eins
Summary: Breakfast, brunch & afternoon snacks at a chic, colourful cafe with a terrace overlooking the park.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Great spot for a quick coffee stop to bathe in the sun and enjoy the park. Service is a bit slow but overall the atmosphere is really nice and lively. Recommend since their terrace is quite spacious and the cafes windows open up to the outside.', 'Unbelievably bad service and we understand now the 3.8 rating on google. one of the best locations in the park but they destroy it with the worst service ever. not only did we wait for over 20 min to get a bottle of water and wrong and missing lemonades, no the best was when the manager did not accept our feedback but started to argue with us! I would suggest to the owner to change staff and attitude if they want to survive or even maximize this wonderful potential.', 'Great place well situated in the middle of Friedrichshain. Great staff !! Arianna and Ornella are great workers with good customer-care that deserve a lot more than being interrupted during my food-questioning… sadly this broke my interaction with the food seriousness of the restaurant and had to call them multiple times. Other than that I can only recommend their pizzas. Fast service and great quality. A bit on the expensive side in Berlin in that location. There’s also the possibility to have vegetarian alternatives. Communication should be at best, woman based service that need to be able to communicate without interference (being called back after 10secs by other staff members) would be the only point to get better! I’ll definitely come back !']

Name: Restaurant Facil
Summary: Acclaimed fine-dining spot with large glass windows and minimalist decor, serving a seasonal menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 2:00 PM, 7:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 2:00 PM, 7:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 2:00 PM, 7:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 2:00 PM, 7:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 2:00 PM, 7:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["The Food, the service and the location are simply awesome. We spontaneously went to Facil for birthday celebration and had the new menu. We absolutely loved it. Highly recommended  :) It's absolutely delicious :)", 'Without question one of the most amazing dining experiences I have had. Ambiance, cuisine and service were all exceptional. I most appreciated the harmony of the individual dishes, which were further enhanced by the well curated wine pairing. Deserving of every star!', 'An excellent dining experience. Lunch menu was very reasonably priced (€88 for three courses), considering the high quality of the food. After entering the hotel, take the lift on the left to the 5th floor and enter a very airy space. Service was formal and friendly. Cured mackerel was pleasant, but flank steak main and grapefruit pudding were truly excellent. Highly recommend both dishes']

Name: Dalmacija Grill
Summary: Homestyle Croatian meat & seafood grills in a wood-paneled dining area or at sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Outstanding food and service. The dishes that were recommended to us turned out to be amazing dishes! It’s our first time to try Croatian food and an absolute must try in this restaurant!', 'Truly a pleasant surprise.\nJoseph was an amazing host. Very friendly and very helpful.\nThe food was excellent. Delicious and well seasoned.', 'I struggle eating this place. It is what it is and you get what you expect. Classic Croatian meat platters, skewers and steaks. It comes with real 80s charm. The decoration, the furniture as well as the drapes. But sometimes this is exactly what I‘m craving for. And among Croatian places across Berlin this is probably my favorite. The owner is super nice and funny, the portions are generous and prices are ok. And the atmosphere is what it is. Either you love it or you hate it. When I crave for Croatian in Berlin I also want this atmosphere. Exactly this atmosphere.']

Name: QIU - Bar & Restaurant
Summary: Cocktails & modern German dishes in a chic, contemporary spot in a hotel, with views.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ["Qiu Bar and Restaurant at Potsdamer Strasse is a great spot! The atmosphere is cool, the service is friendly, and the food is tasty. I enjoyed trying their menu of delicious dishes. If you're in the area, definitely check it out for a great dining experience!", 'Lovely place with good service and nice food. The waiter was attentive and took good care of us, even gave us some extra bread. The cheese platter was lovely with selected cheeses and what appeared to be home made bread and rhubarb-cherry jam. We enjoyed some more dishes along with selected beer, cocktails and wine. A nice evening!', '5 stars are for the cocktails! (We did not eat) They were perfect! Perfectly mixed, served, decorated. There were 4 of us to go to the movies around the corner, 2 for Oppenheimer, 2 for Barbie. I was in the Barbie fraction, so the 2 of us were able to drink before and after the movie while the Oppenheimer fraction was already or still watching. A real treat. The bar was not very full, rather empty and the cocktails rather expensive. TOTALLY WORTH IT! Nice crisps were served. Wasabi nuts and other snacks were served. Because of the rain, the bar-keeper offered an umbrella. The service was very good.']

Name: Pizza Hut
Summary: Popular delivery, carry-out & dine-in chain known for pizza, wings & pasta, plus sides & desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Amazing pizzas soft bread and hot n crusty! We were delighted by the service of Ms. Josephine so sweet friendly, offered great suggestions. Overall lovely experience always.', "I just order from there and I think it was the most disgusting pizza I ever ate in my life. We know that this style it's more greasy than a normal pizza. But this was pure fat 🤢. You can eat there if you want to have heart attack", 'I went there today with my family. We have ordered 1 large pan pizza with 5 toppings, 1 small pan pizza with 5 toppings, 1 small Pepsi, 1 small Pepsi zero and 1 large Lipton icetea. The food was good as usual. When I asked for the bill I was a bit in hurry because of my parking space. So I didn’t check the bill properly. The bill was 65.40€ and I gave 72.00€ and paid with my credit card. At home I resolved that she charged me to much for the food. It should be 45.50€ total. This is the last time I go to this place. It’s ridiculous that this place scams their customers.']

Name: GOLVET
Summary: Smart, cosmopolitan venture spotlighting refined cuisine with a focus on regional ingredients.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Food was done very well. Ingredients spoke for themselves. Then pacing and portions were just right for us to enjoy every dish. Service was friendly and warm. Highly recommend this place to people traveling to Berlin', 'For a Michelin restaurant, a bit funky place with dark interior, colorful lighting and a beautiful view over Berlin. The menu was a parade of small artistic dishes with an asian touch. Friendly and informal service. Food being presented well and the sommelier Andrea who gave us a-beyond-what-you-can-expect tour in German wines. As wine geeks we really appreciated that they paired wines beyond the conventional regions and names. We had an amazing evening. Compliments to the kitchen and service people from two happy Danes', 'I had a very positive surprise, first of all it was the view, 180 free view of Berlin, summer and sunset. Food was ver very good, from the beginning to the end.']

Name: Domino's Pizza Berlin Schöneberg-nord
Summary: Delivery/carryout chain offering a wide range of pizzas & a variety of other dishes & sides.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews:
['do not order food there! it can barely be called food anyways. i took one bite of my pizza and just couldnt justify eating on ... i see the money paid as an investment in my health, by not eating what was delivered. if you know and value a fresh good pizza you just cant have it from dominos. very low quality ingredients. the pizza felt plastic-like and my body rejected it immediately. it would have made for a perfect movie-prop though. dominos isnt even a last resort for ‚food‘ its non existant if you ask me.', "It all started in Ireland a few years ago... with this HUNGERRRRR for Domino's Pizza, it was exquisite!
Then.... I moved to Germany. So, I had to continue my tradition of 'exquisitenes'. BUT... to my surprise I had to face a lot of UPs and DOWNs regarding Domino's.
Firstly, the closest Domino's to Essen was the one in Velbert (17 km away) and the stretch...YES, it was reaaaally worth it. Just like before, same delicious garlic sauce (from which I bought separately 40 of them just to have at home :D)...the good old pizza!
Next time I went there, to my surprise...the shop was closed (forever!); no note, nothing. Nada. Zilch. Zero.
So,...I sighed and waited patiently the next ocassion to put my hands on a Domino's Pizza.
JACKPOT!!! In a few months a Domino's Franchise was opened...guess where...in Essen. Yahoo!
I was a bit puzzled when I got there. Different menus, different sauce size (and different look), different prices, different Pizza boxes and also the thing I was most afraid of: different recipe. It left me with a bad taste, both ways. But hey, it could have been a bad day for the guys so I ordered again from there; BIIIG mistake; I should have listened to my guts.
Long time, no eat. I / or Domino's Pizza in Germany got a new chance. In Hamburg. We thought...why not build our own usual pizzas so as to compare it with the ones before. If the pizza in Essen was eatable but not preferable anymore I can only say that in Hamburg we each ordered a big pizza, from which we each ate one slice and...the rest of it someone on the street seemed to be grateful for.
Next: Düsseldorf. First time, last time!
Toulouse (France) seemed to me that maybe will be different than the recipe in Germany. It was the same...'difference'.
It made no difference anymore.
I was already fed up with Domino's.

But here I am...ordering Domino's again. I was thinking: man, since I will anyway be here (Berlin) for a short while, why not just try it 'cause afterwards I will anyway not order anymore.
So, I was kind of 'afraid' but I was expecting it this time. No alarms and no surprises!..

I was like: oh my GOOOOSH, this is good. I ate a big pizza and when I finished it I wanted another one :D.
Today, I was like: I either do the most stupid spending of all times or I get myself not one, not 2, but 3 slices of heaven. I was again afraid because I was thinking that that pizza was good by mistake.

And I ordered (the heaven part)! As you can see in the image, the pizzas were already with me but the delivery has not even started in the live preview. They were hot, gorgeously looking ... pizzas!
You know that feeling when there is something soooo goooood that you cannot stop eating but you know you have to stop, otherwise you will be like a bug with the belly button up... yeah... I had to stop or I would have faced the acidity week :D

Anyway, long story short: I do not like to leave comment and reviews BUT in this case... BRAAAAVOOOOO Domino's Pizza Berlin Schöneberg-Nord, Potsdamer Straße 70, 10785 Berlin, YOU have restored my faith in Domino's Pizza AGAIN!

We will see next week what Stuttgart will have on the table for me ;)

Domino's Pizza: consume responsibly!", 'Ordered 2 pizzas and 2 sides online to go. Accidentally overlooked that one pizza had an ingredient that I did not want, called in, and they were super accommodating and fixed it for me. Pizzas were good and the staff was very friendly!']

Name: Vox Restaurant & Bar
Summary: Elegant restaurant & bar in the Grand Hyatt featuring a variety of Asian dishes & sushi.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:30 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:30 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 6:30 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:30 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 6:30 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: 6:30 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Vox Restaurant Berlin offers a unique dining experience in Berlin with delicious, high-quality dishes. Enjoy fresh ingredients, great flavors, and excellent service in a welcoming atmosphere✨
I enjoyed a fantastic 5-course menu featuring dishes like salmon, lobster soup, cod fish, beef sirloin with potato spaghetti, and desserts 🍨', 'We had dinner at the Vox the first night we stayed at the Grand Hyatt. We decided to go for sushi as we had not had sushi for quite a while.
We can only say that it was tremendously well prepared and tasted like a dream. The fish quality outstanding.

After having such a great experience we went back the next evening and went for the a la carte. Again we were not disappointed at all. Our food was delicious with very interesting flavors and very well balanced.

We also have to mention the exceptional service given by Felix and Nikolai. They are hosts by heart and made every evening memorable.', 'Excellent Vox Tasting Menu with an amazing friendly service. It’s a 4-course menu, including wine pairing for 89€. The price is more than fair with interesting wines and great meat quality.
10€ a bottle of water is however outrageous.']

Name: Ki-Nova
Summary: Warm, trendy eatery offering creative takes on casual meals featuring health-conscious ingredients.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM
Reviews:
["The place looks nice but that is pretty much all good I can say about this place. Burger wasn't tasty at all and looked a bit sad alone one the plate and I guess the patty wasn't even freshly made. The Flammkuchen was just some piece from the freezer quickly heated in the oven. There were some thick carots in the curry dish and they were not proberly cooked and still raw in the middle. The salmon dish was alright. Would not come here again as it wasn't the cheapest place. I expected a lot more.", "On a Thursday lunchtime it was empty but was nice inside. We ordered 5 tacos (between 5 people). There was a long wait for the food, so long in fact that two of our group  that were booked into a timed museum slot had to get it to go and pay €5 each for reusable boxes (shame we are tourists and leaving today). The food was very tasty and we'll presented (when it did come). 3 tacos pp.

To improve it I would have liked the option to add a spicy sause or for a spicy sause on the table (and for it to come a bit quicker).

If there were more than a few people here at a couple of tables, I wonder just how long the wait would be!", 'Nice vibe, maybe music too loud, waiters are kind. A bit pricy compared to other places in Berlin, however we are in a very touristic place.

The bathroom is not inside the restaurant.

I took a Duck Burger, I didn’t like the fact that there were also the duck skin in it. Overall it was really tasty.

I went on a Saturday, at 14:30, lot of tables were reserved. Probably it’s better to book in advance.']

Name: Weilands am Potsdamer Platz
Summary: New Levantine dishes served in a contemporary restaurant that has views of Piano Lake.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 3:30 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Very tasty food options with friendly staff. The menu had good variety for everyone and presentation was excellent. It was on the slightly expensive side but definitely worth it.', "Food was really good!  It's like an upscale take out.  Everyone was really nice and the food delishes.  Healthy clean food and very tasty.", 'We stumbled upon this restaurant by accident and thoroughly enjoyed our experience here! The staff was all very friendly, and the food was also really good. I tried a cucumber drink out of curiosity for the first time, and it was surprisingly tasty and refreshing.\n\nThe only downside was that the toilet was quite far away; we had to use a restroom on the other side of the corridor.']

Name: Miss Phuong Restaurant
Summary: Traditional Vietnamese dishes such as pho noodle soup presented in a quaint dining room.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Absolutely amazing
The food was delicious
The atmosphere was calming
The presentation was beautiful
The service was quick and kind', 'We were there alone. Therefore, we received our order super quickly. And it tasted well. Nicely setup with the interior.  There are also a couple of easy benches outside with rain protection, so I could imagine also eating there more often.', 'This was our first time eating Vietnamese food and wow wow wow it was delicious! The service was incredible, definitely the nicest and most patient people we’ve meet so far in Berlin. She read the menu to us in English helping find the perfect meal and she really did pick perfectly. Highly recommend for people who like Vietnamese food and especially for people looking to try it for the first time we had an amazing experience !']

Name: Yokozuna Sushi
Summary: Nigiri & maki, plus rice bowls & lunch sets, at a relaxed, modern Japanese eatery.
Reviews:
['The place is clean and quiet , the menu has a variety of choice ; price and quality are very good .

My friend and I ordered bento for lunch which we found very balanced and filling.

We especially loved the dressing used for the salad .

おいしい !!', "We've had salmon/avocado maki as well as salmon special.

Salmon special was super dry and the other one was not that good compared to other sushi restaurants. (ex : Kan Koa)

There were too much rice as well.

The sushis look really sad in comparison to other places. Customer experience was disappointing.", "I had my birthday lunch in this place. It looks so unassuming from the outside but the food is topnotch! They use all the right ingredients on their sushi. The rice is perfectly made and the fish is fresh. They also serve Asahi beer which made the lunch extra special for me. It's a no nonsense straightforward high quality sushi place that I'm sure to come back to."]

Name: Gumus Bistro
Summary: Low-key counter-serve operation with sidewalk seats prepping hamburgers & doner kebabs.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['We stumbled on this cute little establishment tonight after being turned away from two other restaurants because we didn’t have a reservation. And all I can say is THANK GOODNESS!! This was the best surprise we could’ve asked for! The service was excellent and the food was as well! My husband and I both got a döner while our kids got the burgers. We sat outside and enjoyed our meal while also enjoying the sunset. The prices are also very reasonable. If you are looking for some delicious food in the area, Do not hesitate! This place is amazing!', "Look, you're in Berlin, there are endless food options, but if you are close by and in the mood for something fast and fresh this will exceed your dreams.

The donor is prepared with care and creativity, with each slice of tender meat accompanied with an appropriate vegetable, creamy   sauce and pickled item. Get it spicy if you're feeling dangerous!

They offer a nice beer selection. The table next to us recommended washing dinner down with a beer chased with peppermint schnapps.

The service is wonderful. They treat you like you're a regular even if you're here from another country.", 'I moved to Berlin 5 years ago and my first apartment was next to this place. Since that time, I was loyal to this place - they have the best Döner I’ve ever tried.
Small tip: ask them for extra halloumi']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['cheeseburger is 50 cent more expensive now
and ice cream machine doenst work', 'The employees here are usually very nice and helpful. However, today I felt I was treated rudely. I ordered a "triple cheese Burger Menu" ('Menu' means: burger + fries + drink). The employee told me the amount and walked away to do something. I saw that the price was too low, so I said, "excuse me, it was a triple cheese burger MENU". I said it politely and just emphasized that it was a menu, because it was obvious she had charged me just for the burger. She got very upset and kept saying "you didn't say menu before, you didn't ask for a menu" and was having trouble changing the order. She then called over a colleague and complained to her about me, saying "he ordered just the burger, but NOW he wants a menu" and this was done in a negative tone. The colleagued helped changed the order and the person I had given the order to originally said in a rude attitude, "Alles?" (Is that everything?), again obviously angry at me because she thought that before I didn't ask for a "menu", even though I did.

My point is, even if I had forgotten to ask for a "menu" and then changed my mind, she should not have treated a customer like this. She should have stayed professional and just changed the order. Obviously, she did not hear me when I asked for the "menu" originally, but again, that is not a reason to be rude to customers.

*Note: the conversation between the two of us was in German.', 'Ice cream machine doesn’t work(']

Name: Trattoria Peretti
Summary: Pizza, salads & homemade pasta in a relaxed venue with al fresco tables in a covered passageway.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ["It's a place with very nice feel, good service and tasty food. Service was pretty quick and portions were quite sizable. Both pizza and pasta were great, so we went for dessert... aaand it wasn't as great. But overall experience was excellent.", 'Very good service, short waiting time. The food was very good. Tomato soup was delicious, Parma pizza very good and quite large, with lots of rucola on top. Panna cotta was heaven in my mouth. Everything cost less than 30€. It was lovely to sit outside. There was a nice fountain nearby.', "I've been there yesterday with 10 other people. The service was surprisingly good. The waiters were super kind, helpful and attentive. We neither couldn't complain about the food. It was served quickly, at the same time, looked good and tasted good as well. I'd definitely come back. Tiny improvement suggestion would be the bread that was served in the beginning :) more crispy and fluffy would be awesome!"]

Name: Lunch Time
Summary: Compact Italian counter-serve place offering pizza, pasta & salads in informal surrounds.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Nice place for breakfast. Everythig was very fast. Pizza, egg breakfast, coffee were very tasty. Friendly staff. Recommended.', 'Fine little cafe with many different things to eat.
I tried a pizza 🍕 slice and it was huge :)
Flavor was okay but a bit bland. Could not eat everything.

A bit nosy with a boom box blasting radio over the place.

It was clean', 'A short walk from Museum Island, this Pizza/Pasta place was a nice lunch break for the hungry traveler. The veggie pizza, lentil soup, and house salad all hit the spot. Even our picky eater devoured his food.']

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Food was as ok. But the menu on the door said 5.99. We order 2 menus and paid 15.38 EUR. Feel like I was scammed.', 'My son really wanted a Subway sandwich, figured it is near the end of winter holidays so I took him into Berlin since there are none near our place and wanted a change of view. Decided to go here, as I wanted to avoid the Alexa crowds. Service was great, friendly staff, clean tables and over all it was clean. Unfortunately they no longer serve a Turkey sub, so my son went with a spicy chicken, I got the classic tuna sub. One thing, the street access door is locked, you need to enter at the side. Not sure why this is the case.', "I had luck finding this place open at 9 am in this very cold Sunday morning. Staff isn't the kindest this early in the morning but at least I could spend my next hour warm and cozy until anything else opens."]

Name: BURGER KING Deutschland GmbH
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 AM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 AM
Reviews:
["These are the worst burgers I've ever had. First of all, they were very cold, and secondly, they had incomprehensible sauces. I don't like spicy food, and this burger was just that. It was very strange. And the room is very cold, I froze while waiting for my order for 15 minutes and I was already not hungry.
It was also unclear where my burger was and where my boyfriend's was. And the mobile Internet doesn't work here.
I hope I won't come back here again and when I'm hungry, I'll wait until I get to a better place.
I don't recommend it, unfortunately.", 'Slowest burger king in the world. The workers are pacing around slowly, back and forth, taking burgers and putting them back.
Touching their faces, noses and other stuff without gloves and without washing or using disinfectant.', 'This has got to be the worst Burger King I’ve ever set foot in. Trust me, I’m not easily disappointed, but they managed to pull it off. ‘Fast’ food? More like lost in translation. The quality was iffy at best, and waiting nearly 45 minutes to get the wrong order? That’s mental! I could’ve planted the potatoes, harvested them, and cooked them myself by the time they finally served me. If you have other options, do yourself a favor and skip this place ']

Name: Skykitchen
Summary: Innovative global dishes & sweeping city views from a sleek 12th-floor space with edgy decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['We had the perfect sky view of the golden hour while having the dessert. Their serving was perfectly just in time until sundown. Excellent service, knowledgeable and attentive team, and the courses were just amazing. I appreciate that they were willing to customise the courses to adjust to my crustacean-molluscan allergy. It truly was an experience to remember and the greatest place to celebrate my boyfriend’s birthday. ❤️

Thank you, Team Skykitchen 🌸', 'Amazing degustation menu from beginning until the end with a perfect service and a wonderful view.', 'Decor and ambience reminds me of Alice in wonderland and or Peter Pan “fairy tale like.” The seating arrangement for 2 person if you like a view is against the lining of the window facing outwards (like in a cafe) as oppose to traditional two person  table top in the middle of the room. The kitchen was behind us with glass over so it was “open kitchen” concept and I love to observe the team as they were super focused.

The staff does extremely well speaking in German and English. They were very personable and provided their favorite wines and were knowledgeable of their menu. Definitely Michelin worthy service. Each dish was presented with an attentive explanation.

The menu i believe is fusion cuisine featuring molecular gastronomy. The “onsen egg.” was the star of the evening and also their chocolate at the end for dessert. I want to point out the wine menu is very unique and noteworthy due to the fact it features mainly wines from Germany and eastwards. We selected the Slovenian bottle that is only carried at this restaurant and it paired beautifully with the dishes. Highly recommend this bottle if you get a chance to try it.']

Name: BALKAN GRILL
Summary: Easygoing restaurant with outdoor seats offering grilled lamb & other Balkan specialties.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Nice to find a balkan grill in Berlin but the place it is a bit more like a fast food place than a place for a lunch or dinner with friends. Definitely worth of a visit for a quick lunch :)', 'One of the best Balkan restaurant in Berlin! Excellent food with excellent service. Food was very well cooked and served quite quickly. Would definitely recommend this place ❤️', 'Tasty food, friendly service, fair prices.']

Name: Karabach
Summary: Azeri barbecue restaurant with elegant traditional décor & a sizzling open kitchen.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Tasty food with good atmosphere. Need to spend much time to find a parking in the area 😀', 'A place with nice atmosphere and feeling. Oriental music. The service is super friendly, nice and fast; they can also help you in meal recommendations or descriptions. A bit pricey, but still affordable. The food is great - all fresh and delicious. Highly recommended.', 'If you’re a foodie like me, you’ll love this place! The menu has a fantastic selection of dishes, and we loved everything we tried. We only had good comments about the food. I can’t wait to come back again! Also after getting acquainted with Azerbaijani cuisine and culture here, we decided to travel to Azerbaijan sometime.']

Name: Caligari
Summary: A changing menu of creative antipasti, pasta & Italian mains in a cool, rustic-chic setting.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['We waited around 20-30min to get seated despite having made a reservation. It also took them a very long time to bring us two bottles of wine.

The food itself was also a bit disappointing, many of our dishes were oversalted and masked the taste of everything.
This is sad cause it ruined the great taste of their homemade pasta.
I had to rub off all the sauce to at least appreciate something.
The dish with seafood just tasted like sea…

The place itself looked very cute and cozy, also the dishes were very pretty.', "A modern little kiez restaurant serving up some delicious Italian food from a changing menu.

The place is compact and lively with the front dining section facing a large open window and the inside having a rustic open brick wall. The open bar and kitchen adds the warmth of the place.

Service is always friendly and polite but can get a bit frantic when they're very full, but they'll take care of you nonetheless.

The menu consists of a few well made, rustic, entrées, mains and desserts. The tartare was an absolute win! Every dish was made with care and left nothing to be desired. The portion sizes are perfect for you to enjoy a 3 course meal.

The wine list is short but curated. They have an interesting collection of Italian wines are that uncommon but worth trying in Berlin.

All in all, it's a pleasure to have these establishments be a part of every kiez. It's a great place to bring your friends or even a date!", '😍everything was amazing! The service did it all very effortlessly and calm which made a beautiful atmosphere. The timing of the food was perfectly on point and it was all soo delicious! We had a table with 12 ppl and not one glass was ever empty we had a blast! Thank you soo much!!!']

Name: La Côte
Summary: Cozy option serving southern European cuisine, such as meat & fish entrees, plus sharing plates.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Great restaurant really.good food. We loved visiting. There were just a few minor details which good use some improvement. Our table water was warm and the restaurant appeared to be a bit understaffed.  We had to wait over twenty minutes after finishing a course. So maybe with more personnel it would have been perfect\nThe wines were great though.  We loved our evening anyways', 'The food is delicious but has a lot going on. The plates are small so my husband and I ordered a few different things and they all could have been a tad simpler. If you don’t want to order a big meal, at least order some drinks because the bar tenders are wizards! The drinks are wonderful!! It’s a small place so you’ll probably need a reservation, but sitting at the bar is also great because you can watch those wizards work.', 'The stuffing in the panipuri and all the textures were a pleasant surprise.  :) the chocolate mouse was such a good rich chocolate flavour. :) panna cotta subtle and mild and pleasant. Good service too.  Particularly the young woman.   :) I wish I asked her name. :)']

Name: La Stella Nera
Summary: Hip, eco-conscious venture known for wood-fired vegan pizzas & calzones, plus desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['This place was nice! I tried the margarita pizza and the pepperoni pizza. The vegan cheese and salami were good and the crust on both was excellent, but I found the pizzas could have used a few more toppings. My friend let me try some of his polenta fries with garlic dipping sauce and those were super yummy, I’d definitely order those next time.

I was confused about why where there were so many options without cheese and only a few with cheese… I would have liked to have tried the mushroom pizza with cheese.

The atmosphere was cool and the service was fine.', "Excellent pizza with nice fluffy dough. It was hardly noticeable that the cheese was vegan. We had the heavy weather calzone and the asparagus pizza and both were great.
We didn't have to wait long despite the place being rather full and the staff were very friendly.", 'Gorgeous pizza from a wood oven. We had a diavola and carciofina piccante. Unlike other vegan pizza places you get the chance to get some additional proteins on your pizza due to tofu and seitan toppings. We loved that and definitely coming back. We didn’t have a reservation but for two people it wasn’t a big deal to get a table with a bit of waiting time.']

Name: LoveBurger
Summary: Snug eatery serving vegan burgers & bowls made with area-sourced ingredients, plus smoothies & beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 9:30 PM
Reviews:
['We had two orders of the Deutscher Burger Beyond that come with potato wedges & loved them. The Deutscher is everything I look for in a vegan burger & I could easily have eaten a double serving of the fries. I’d give LoveBurger a contender status for having one of the best burgers in Berlin… That said, the one thing that keeps this review from being a 5 star rating is the fact that €36.80 for two burgers & fries is kind of outrageous. Being from the USA, I’m accustomed to the inflation impact & consumer gouging that happens in the vegan community, but this raised my eyebrows. We will eat here again because the food is bangin’, but we’ll likely order less or not arrive hungry.', 'Just perfect!!!

I had the “special” burger…. A lovely vegan burger with sweet potato Fries as sidedish

Not only the food was fresh and really delicious. The owner is also such a nice and friendly person!!! Love the vibe here!

I Will definately come back when i visit Berlin again!', 'This place is just amazing with bursts of flavours.. everything on the menu is so unique and just too good. They have seasonal burgers with different versions and those should not be missed at all. I highly recommend this place!!']

Name: Zur Haxe
Summary: Waiting staff in dirndls & lederhosen serve meaty dishes like pork knuckle at this Bavarian stop.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["Bavarian themed restaurant, serving up a host of traditional German/Bavarian meals, from schnitzel, sauerkraut, dumplings, and their speciality slow cooked (roasted and boiled) pork knuckle and lamb shank dishes.
The restaurant is beautifully decorated in traditional Bavarian decor, and the staff is kitted out in traditional outfits, which adds to the experience - one waiter, who is a funny friendly guy, even went so far as to grow an impressive beard (see pics)
Even more impressive is the food, which is rustik and homely. I had the goulash soup as a starter, which was hearty with a full depth of flavour, with a generous portion of thick cut veg and chunks of beef, and a generous portion. I then had the slow roast pork knuckle, with potato dumplings and sauerkraut, with a kind of gravy sauce. The pork fell off the bone, and was tender and moist, coated with a beautifully crisp and fatty crackling, which was all made to work with the sauce and sauerkraut to cut through the richness of the fat.
The portion sizes were HUGE, and definitely something you could share with 2 people, if you don't feel like you could face a whole portion on your own, which I had to force myself to do.
I had a look at the schnitzel another table had next to me, and vowed to go back just to try that when next in Berlin, it looked so good!
As well as the amazing food, the staff were super warm, friendly, and accommodating. I turned up without a booking, and they happily squeezed me in between bookings without making me feel a nuisance.
I had a lovely pint of Warsteiner with the meal, and all in all it came to only €30.50 (£25) which, in the UK could easily be double that amount. Considering the portions are enough for 2, then I'd say that's great value for money.
I can't recommend this place more!", 'Homely Bavarian restaurant with lovely warm atmosphere. The food is great, the service is always very good.', 'A nice and traditional German restaurant with spacious and cozy environment. The foods are very clean and delicious. I specially like schnitzel a lot. The desserts here are very delicious and not too sweet. Vanilla ice cream is perfect taste. I recommend to visit this place. The staff are nice and friendly.']

Name: EINSTEIN Unter den Linden
Summary: Stylish cafe-restaurant with historic feel, framed photos, dark wood, plus booth & sidewalk seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ["We visited the restaurant for brunch on a warm Sunday. The staff were very friendly and helped us practice our German, and the food was fantastic - really fresh and we were both very full when we left! The cakes looked lovely but we didn't have room to try them unfortunately - we will have to go back!", 'So sad the Villa where the cafe was located closed last year. It was beloved by Berliners and had went there in 2022 on my first trip to the city. This location is great too. Just a walk away from the Brandenburg gate. The food was good. I had the classic Wien Schnitzel and we had some wine. The portion was huge! It was two slabs of porkchop. We also had some wine and I had the classic Sacher Torte.', "The staff were very nice. The food was unfortunately mid for the price. We ordered the schnitzel, which was pretty ok tho the potatoes on the side were bland as potatoes can be, and I got a mushroom risotto. It was so salty, almost inedible, not sure if it was just a one time fluke or if it's usually like that but I couldn't even taste anything but salt. It's a nice looking restaurant but there are better places to eat."]

Name: Lorenz Adlon Esszimmer
Summary: Elegant restaurant with creative cuisine, as well as views of the Brandenburg Gate.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 7:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["The quality of ingredients was good, but there seems to be a lack of empathy towards the guests' experience, particularly in terms of orchestration of flavours and textures between courses.

The location is impeccable, offering a direct view of the Brandenburg Gate. I guess that a significant portion of the price I paid was for the view rather than the food itself, though.

Overall, despite the high quality of the food, considering the price and the reputation, I was anticipating a more harmonious dining experience that delights the palate with a cohesive story through its dishes.", 'Incredible meal on New Year’s Eve. All the staff very knowledgeable about the (many!) beautiful unusual wines served with each course. It was all fabulous.', "Fancy dining experience with great views of the Brandenburg Gate. The food and service are fantastic, It's a bit pricey but worth it for a special night... How do I explain this better? -The food will cost you more than your flight to Berlin ;)"]

Name: Ishin Mittelstraße
Summary: Japanese restaurant with wood flooring serving sushi, fresh fish & seasonal vegetable-based fare.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 7:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 7:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 7:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 7:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 7:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 7:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['My favourite place for sushi. Love the freshness and the texture of the sushi here. The price is incredible good for the quality. Don’t expect chill and relaxing ambience because the place is just for the food. :)', "One of my top sushi places in Berlin. Best quality for a good price. It's always packed, so it can get quite loud, but other than that I highly recommend it.", 'We went here for a quick lunch and it didn’t disappoint us! I’ve read positive reviews so I had to check it when we were in Berlin. I’ve got rice bowl with tuna belly and uni nigiri, they were both fresh and really good. The service was fast even though the place was packed. Good value for money, I definitely recommend!']

Name: Käfer
Summary: Fine-dining space on the rooftop of the parliament building, with city views & a modern German menu.
Reviews: ["Everything was totally top notch. Service was excellent and the roof top views cannot be beat. Food was beautiful and we'll presented but could have used a little more assertive flavors. Definitely make a reservation for a delightful lunch.", "It's not cheap, but it was well worth it. The food was fantastic! Remember to book in advance, arrive early, and bring your passport! You can also explore the Reichstag building roof afterwards.", 'A bit pricey, but worth it for access to the Bundestag (with a skip the line perk!) and the view of Berlin. The apéro meal had a preset menu, with a choice of dessert. I chose the pistachio cake which was good. The presentation of the dish was cute and chic, and surprisingly filling for being the cheapest thing on the menu. The apéro also came with a Prosecco drink. I was sat right next to the window with a view of Berlin and the TV tower in the distance. After having just done my audio tour of the dome, this was a great, calm spot to relax in the afternoon.']

Name: India Club Berlin
Summary: Stylish restaurant with a sophisticated ambiance serving traditional North Indian cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing food with the right amount of flavours in every bite. We were on a dinner date and really had the best Indian food experience in India Club. All the servers were really friendly and the Manager also gave us a complimentary salad. A must try restaurant in Berlin!!', 'Best place to enjoy Indian cuisine in Berlin!
Comes with a high price tag but trust me each penny spent here is well worth it.
Ambiance, service , cutlery everything was very nice! Can definitely recommend going here to celebrate a special occasion!', 'This is the most authentic and amazing Indian food I have tasted in Germany! Everything was delicious and the service was great. I had such high expectations and it seems to have cross its boundaries.
The drinks we ordered were supreme the mixologist had a great taste and mixing ideas.
Will visit again and recommend you too to visit.

#bowdowntothechef 💯']

Name: Il Punto
Summary: Pasta & modern Italian cuisine, plus regional wines, at an elegant dining room with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Beautiful place, great selection of craft beers and most of all really cool personnel! Thank you for an unforgettable stay!!!', 'We had a lovely dinner at il Punto. The food and drinks were delicious and the service was wonderful. The waiter had wonderful recommendations for wine to pair with each course.', 'I recently had the pleasure of dining at Il Punto, and it was an unforgettable experience. The highlight of my meal was the fish dorada, which was perfectly cooked—delicate, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The accompanying polenta was creamy and rich, pairing excellently with the fish and adding a comforting balance to the dish. The ambiance at Il Punto is warm and inviting, with attentive service that made me feel right at home. If you’re looking for authentic Italian cuisine that delivers both in taste and atmosphere, Il Punto is the place to go. Highly recommended!']

Name: Viale dei Tigli
Summary: Long-standing, relaxed eatery with sidewalk tables serving up typical Italian dishes & aperitifs.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Not to be recommended. Everything is overcooked.
Look at the picture of what used to be carrots, beans and potatoes. I did eat the dorade dish, which was also overcooked.
According to the menu it would be on a bed on spinach, but it ended up on top of some rocket.

Just go elsewhere.', 'Everything was delicious! Very quick service with a very friendly and energetic staff.', 'I had the absolute worst experience at Viale dei Tigli. From the moment we walked in, the staff were incredibly unprofessional and downright rude. It felt like they were only interested in taking our money without providing any form of service. Our waiter seemed annoyed and indifferent to our requests, and the food arrived late and cold.

But the worst part is that it is clearly a tourist trap. They do everything to cheat with the bill. We found extra charges and dishes we never ordered. When we pointed this out, the waiter became defensive and tried to explain it away with poor excuses. In the end, we had to fight to get the bill corrected, which ruined the entire experience.

I strongly advise against anyone visiting Viale dei Tigli. If you don’t want to feel cheated and poorly treated, find somewhere else to eat.']

Name: DIE EINS - Restaurant & Catering
Summary: Burgers, pasta & salads in a sleek dining room or at riverfront tables with views of the Reichstag.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ['I really do not know what to say, the service was terrible but funny, the cuisine was Italian but with too much persil and the prices were... Well you will have to try.', 'Good food for a fair price and good beer and a very nice server. The view over the Reichstag is a bonus.', 'Nice place at the river. Did not eat, but had some drinks. Slow service at the tables.']

Name: Gaffel Haus Berlin - Das kölsche Konsulat in der Hauptstadt
Summary: Schnitzel, currywurst & beer in a large brewery with wood-paneled interiors & a terrace.
Address: Direkt neben dem Maritim proArte Hotel, Dorotheenstraße 65, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Great place to try local dishes, with a great environment a very nice and attentive service. They have the menu in English and many options to choose from, all of them delicious. Meatballs and sausages are top, but of course you have to combine it with some local beers. The amounts were fairly good and price-wise it was well worth it overall. Highly recommended for tourist.', 'A Cologne pub in Berlin that will amaze even the most loyal Berliner-Plörre beer fan. The Cologne atmosphere is downright infectious, even if the Kölsch served brings back memories of headaches. The waiter is brisk and funny, and the Halve Hahn brings a smile. An entertaining evening with plenty of Kölsch, which traditionally causes a slight headache. Highly recommended for friends of koelsche hospitality customs.', 'Nice atmosphere and kind servers. The food and beer were amazing.\nRecommend the restaurant.']

Name: Kindl Stuben
Summary: Classic dishes like schnitzel & spätzle cheese noodles at a trendy gastrobar with live concerts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['I brought my dad here who was visiting from the UK and wanted to try some typical german food! We were the only ones in the place but felt really comfortable and welcome, and the food was fresh and delicious. I would highly recommend! I’ll definitely be back soon :)', 'Went here for dinner and absolutely loved it. Cozy space, nice service, and great food. We had schnitzel and Spätzle, both were deliscious and very generous portions. Will definitely go back!', 'Very strongly enjoyed the spinach and cheese dumplings with mushroom sauce. Very reasonably priced.']

Name: OS'Kitchen
Summary: Middle Eastern cuisine with a modern spin, plus vegetarian options, in a contemporary setting.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['The best oriental food in neukölln and maybe berlin. We got a mixed plate for two but three ate and got full. Loved the spicy potatoes made traditionally lebanese recipe. Also drank a fresh Arian and a fresh orange 🍊 juice. Would definitely recommend', "A week ago my girl friend and I ordered food from OS Kitchen: a Köfte plate (€11) and a vegetarian plate (€10). Both came with a very nice small salad (we were impressed how fresh it was!) with a yoghurt dressing, lots of hummus (with 10-15 whole chick peas on top), spicy potatoes, as well as fresh pita bread. The Köfte sausages were plenty and grilled to perfection. The veggie plate came with lots of Halloumi as well as grilled vegetables. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and highly recommend this place since it's reopening end of May, 2024. The owner is also a really nice guy and he knows how to cook! We plan to eat there quite often in the future...", "This place has a great interior and friendly staff, just the meal wasn't worth it. Feels like I was being served something that wasn't even fresh anymore."]

Name: Babbo bar
Summary: Robust Italian pastas & seafood, plus a long wine list, in a cozy setting with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["The food is certainly not bad, but it's a place you'd normally avoid as a local. Primary reason is that it's quite overpriced for local standards, and you'd have better options for Italian dinner more reasonably priced around the corner. So, it's a place usually crowded with tourists on dates. ;) Also the guy running the place is a bit weird imo, but probably depends on what you like. What left a flavour is that you're asked to pay cash and they refuse to issue a bill. Don't want to know where that cash flow ends up...", 'In short: carefully made fresh pasta with amazing sauce. Extensive wine list that goes from Puglia to the Trentino. Seven or eight tables, unpretentious given the high quality of the food. Amazing Octopus Tagliateli. Ideal place for a date or for a get together with a small group of friends. Don’t leave without trying the Tiramisu!', 'Unfortunately I’m disappointed and don‘t quite get what others who recommend and love this place have experienced here, because sadly I can‘t see why others love this place so much.
More on this in the following but if you want a short explanation for my 2 stars:
we paid around 180€ for 3 persons, 2 of us (me included) had to eat at home afterwards because our portions were tiny (we all had first course, main course and dessert) and for an authentic italian restaurant it was sadly on of the badder experiences I have encountered in my culinary years.

But now for the long version. I chose this restaurant because my dad was in town, we love italian food so after reading the extraordinary good reviews and seeing the nice website with a nice menu selection, I wanted to give it a try.
(I worked years in restaurants and I am a big foodie, especially for my italian food, so I love to try new stuff, because why not, it‘s berlin right?)

The place:
We get there and it is just a brightly lit room with a big window so you can see the whole restaurant. Because the first impression was sadly uninviting (compared to other romantic italian places in berlin) I even had to check if that is the right restaurant because the place looked nothing like the photos, but we were right.
The atmosphere and ambiance was just… cold. You walk straight into the dining area with tables scrambled together, bright lights, no candles, no nice tablecloths, just straight up cheap tables and chairs. The chairs are unfortunately also so uncomfortable, that we wanted to go right after eating. For every restaurant, but especially italian, I want to be comfortable. I want to feel at home. I want the feeling I am in Italy right now and I can sit and sit forever and just have nice hour long conversations over a bottle or two of red wine. But all I got from there was just a reaction to stand up and go. I‘m sorry to be so direct but I have no other way to describe it.
The most sad part about it: one reason I chose the restaurant was by the way they decorated and printed their menu. (It sounds dumb but after years of trying new restaurants you know when they put in the work for a nice menu, they will do with everything else as well).
So I was flabbergasted when the waiter just lay the menu cards down, which were just flipchart boards with a old laminated printed out sheet of paper.

The food:
Well the food. As stated above we ended up paying 180€ for 3 persons, which isn’t THAT much for berlin, but everytime I pay that much I get a really overall nice experience from the places. So, as you can imagine, this place was nowhere near that.
My girlfriend and I had roman artichokes as starters, my dad had porchetta with radicchio. The artichokes were ok, but they just tasted… bland (i guess?!), my dad described as: „They lack the kick“. The porchetta was fine.
For main we had: octopus, ravioli with cod and tagliolini with calamaretti.
And now it got disappointing for that price: my dad had the octopus main and he got 2 half arms. Like maybe 100g, if even. It tasted good, a little bit too long cooked on one side, so octopus gets rubbery. But like the size was just a joke. I‘m sorry to be so blunt. This dish was 28€(!). I had the ravioli and also here taste was ok, but they lacked a bit of everything and for about 26€ it was just to small (had like 7 ravioli) and too little kick to it. My gf had the tagliolini, which was surprisingly a huge portion, compared to ours. I just don‘t get their measurements of plating?
Well the taste was also good but lacked something and were a bit to bitter. I mean that‘s a dish for normally around 16-18€ and it was also like 26€.

So all in all I want to say that the food was not bad or uneatable. But we paid 180€ which is just not right for what you get. A ok-quality food with lack of passion behind the taste and an unromantic atmosphere where you don’t want to stay hours.
So my rating is 2 stars for that the food was ok and the chef was nice, but I‘m sorry. Didn‘t get the vibe and sadly not something to visit again.']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["deception.  In the children's menu, the advertised burger with beef patty has fresh tomatoes, pickled cucumbers... and what they gave... inside is ketchup instead of tomatoes, a small piece of pickled cucumber... and fried onion.. They probably throw in leftovers from other food because  Asian cuisine nearby.  It's impossible to eat.  And, as far as I understand, the cola is diluted.  I'm not sure but it seemed so", 'Bad employee: scam and very bad service

Today I ordered a takeaway menu around 5pm:

* 1€ was missing when she gave me the change

* the Coca-Cola was missing from the bag (I had to come back)

* she gave me the Coke but delivered it to the counter and wouldn't put it in the bag, so I had to ask for the drink holder.

*She gave me the drink holder, but she put it on the counter. So I had to do the work and put the Coke on the holder and in the bag.

* After giving me the bag, I asked her to confirm if she had given me mayonnaise, she said "yes", but when I got home, it was ketchup instead.

I can believe you're making a mistake, but 5 mistakes means it was intentional...', "I only went there because it's cheap and I could sit down for a few minutes. The latter being the most important. I had two cheeseburgers that had been made too long ago. Dry as carton. McDonald's cheeseburgers are normally at least edible."]

Name: Imren Grill
Summary: Late-opening pit stop for Turkish shawarma wraps, pide flatbreads & lentil soup.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM
Reviews: ['Who is on the hunt for a yummy, well-priced mercimek soup will find it here. The restaurant itself is very authentic, even the seating area reminds me of eating in Türkiye.', "[on a mission to find Berlin's best döner kebap]\n\nQuite an authentic atmosphere that took me back to Istanbul. The döner, however, was nothing exceptional. The meat was a bit dry, and the bread was average. Good for trying once and the people were lovely!", 'Best Döner in town, great choice of foods, the free Turkish tea. Everything is on point, the staff is always friendly. I visit frequently and recommend 100% my personal top']

Name: Döner 44
Summary: Kebabs & wraps filled with meat, halloumi or falafels, at a long-standing, no-frills snack bar.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['The best kebab in Berlin!! Big portion, a lot of meat inside, not too much sauce. Very recommend!', 'Incredibly tasty Döner. Even I, als a Chinese, am also lured by the taste. It only costs 3,5€', 'Still a good kebab, but now smaller than it used to be. Maybe it depends on who prepares the food, but disappointing.']

Name: Restaurant Kalaja Berlin
Summary: Lively operation with a sidewalk terrace serving up grilled meats & Turkish specialities.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Great place. My first choice whenever I’ve got a craving for Balkan food. Fresh puffy Börek. Good goulash and bread. Nice price and served right away. They’ve upgraded the restaurant now and moved to the building next to the original restaurant. Now the place is bigger, brighter and more modern. Waiters now wear ‘Kalaja’ polo shirts, and there are lots working now, as I write this. Quick friendly service.', 'We came together for borek, a cup of tea and cake. The tea was terrible. It was late, but they could have already said that there is no tea and we would have said okay thanks. Instead they brought tea that tastes nothing like tea. It was terrible. It looked and tasted terrible. After that, the other waiter started saying but my colleague told you there was no tea when you ordered, but that wasn’t true at all. They didn’t tell us that at all. They started trying to convince us to take the tea that was so light it tastes like hot water and no tea. Then they brought back tea that looked horrible and so dirty. Then we asked for sugar two times and they didn’t give it to us. It was terrible service throughout that it was honestly so frustrating we told them to have the tea and the money. They brought the money after, but it didn’t even matter because we came and were looking forward to just a cup of tea instead of trying to cheat. It was a terrible experience.', 'Very nice place. The food was fulfilling and reasonably priced. Highly recommend']

Name: Pêle-Mêle
Summary: Breakfast, daily lunch menus & homemade cakes at a snug vegan cafe with a few sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews:
['One of the few vegan brunch buffets in Berlin and it is super tasty! It has various savory warm, lukewarm and cold foods and some desserts, all of which are vegan and delicious! Definitely recommend to make a reservation and visit the restaurant!', 'This is a fully vegan café with several cakes, brunch items and a few daily-changing meals, which are (except for the bread) all made in house. They have a couple of gluten-free options as well.

The cakes were okay and actually tasted better than they looked. Coffee, however, was not what it was supposed to be… The warm meal was absolutely not to my taste, and I couldn’t even finish it.

After all, the prices here are on the expensive side, too.

What I appreciated is that staff was friendly and honest when trying to help us choose what to order.

The café is quiet and seems suitable for working or studying. The interior features old furniture, including tables with mismatched chairs. The vintage and random interior represents the Berlin-style flair of this neighborhood.', 'We had vegan brunch and I ❤️ it. Very good food and vibes. I will definitely come again soon!']

Name: Vapiano
Summary: Laid-back restaurant featuring made-to-order fresh pasta dishes, along with pizza & salad.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:30 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:30 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["My recent experience at this restaurant was extremely disappointing. The food was absolutely terrible. We ordered the chicken Alfredo, and to our shock, it came with a mere six tiny pieces of chicken buried in a sea of bland, flavorless pasta. For a dish that costs 20€, I expected something far more substantial and satisfying. Instead, it felt like we were paying a premium price for a plate of plain pasta with barely any effort put into it. The quality of the food did not even come close to justifying the exorbitant price. I won't be returning and would advise others to avoid this place unless they want to leave hungry and disappointed. Unfortunately no fewer than one star is possible!", 'Reasonable price and superb atmosphere!  It is the first time I went to a branch of Vapiano. Everything was nicely organised. The taste of the food was also pretty good. The presentation was mouthwatering. I enjoyed their entire system. It was a great experience. If you like pasta/pizza it is a worthy place.', 'As good as it can be. Food was good, portions have big size.\nThe staff was very friendly and helpful.']

Name: Midtown Grill
Summary: Modern, airy steakhouse restaurant with lounge music & banquettes, also serving seafood & cocktails.
Reviews:
['This Chain Steak House
Is supposed to be the
Equivalent of my Fave
Steak House by Ruth….
Well it is definitely NOT.
I got an advertisement via
Instagram for a RIBS and
Beer 4th of July Cookout
BBQ featuring all the RIBS
You can eat along with
Other Grilled favorites.
LIes they told.
Not one of the several
Items served came from
A Hot Grill.
Nor  did the Only Rib
Option which happen
To be some Strange
BBQ sauced Cold
Korean??? Babyback Ribs.
The Sauce was not Korean
nor American and was not
Grilled with the meat because
This meat was never grilled.
The only HOT ITEM was ONE
Of the two French fry Choices.
The wait staff was more interested
In the SINGLE GIRL in the RED DRESS
than they were about serving
Anything HOT.
This was a BAIT and SWITCH.
And HIGHLY disappointing.
The guacamole was from a can.
The melted cheese wasn’t even
Whiz, it was some canned concoction
As well as the salsa which is so easy
to prepare . And why am I even
Eating NACHOS at a RIB BBQ?
Because there were literally NO
RIBS featured. Especially the ones
OFF the  Grill Sticky and
Smoked Tender and Tasty.
The waiter and I mean that
Literally WAIT_er. I had to call
Him over SEVERAL times because
I had WAITED with no attention,
Warned us about the amount
Of Food and said order one burger
It might be too much! Then he
Brings this BURNT turd on an
Oversized bun with sauce I said
Not to be added. I looked and
Laughed and handed the two
Two bite burnt turd burger with
Sauce I did not order to my
Dining partner. Who immediately
Took the bread away and ate the
Tiny Turd burgers. As they over
cooked and under seasoned.
If this was supposed to be a
‘Tease’ for me to come back
and try your full menu you
FAILED miserably.
My Death By Chocolate
was supposed to be a dark
Chocolate ice cream and
a layered chocolate mousse.
Well the ice cream melted and
the plastic cover took 1/3 of
The Mousse away because it
wasn’t delivered by the WAIT_er
On Time.
And then came the FINAL
BLOW. The knockout Punch.
Pride Month is Over and the
Restaurant returned to ‘Straight’
Wine……….Literally.
Which was actually the BEST
Part of the Entire Meal. A Riesling
FRESH yet Full Bodied Giving
Scents of Spring and early Summer.
So sensual we finished a Bottle.
Lecker. Unlike the Meal.', "An exquisite restaurant where you can come for a special evening with your friends and family. It truly deserves every star with its rich menu, service and taste. I was also lucky enough to have the gluten-free bread option (which tasted delicious). We really wanted cheesecake for dessert, but it wasn't available anymore. We tried chocolate mouse instead, and it was also very successful. The wines were delicious, I would like more Argentinian wine. Rib eye was delicious. Thank you Midtown Grill Berlin!", 'I visited this restaurant based on its high Google review score and ordered a ribeye and a cola for 55€, which I found overpriced. Despite the restaurant being empty, the waiter rudely asked me to move from a comfortable 4-person table to a cramped 2-person table with a sunshade pole obstructing the middle, making it very inconvenient. Although the food was good, the waiter’s unprofessional behavior and poor service were unacceptable. If you don’t mind the cost, the food is decent, but for a better atmosphere, I recommend looking elsewhere.']

Name: essenza Potsdamer Platz 1
Summary: Italian classics, from antipasti to dessert, plus wine, in a stylish, modern locale.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Good food, a wonderful experience and the best service I have had in a long time. Thank you for a wonderful meal', 'Food was decent, but seating was very uncomfortable. The restaurant is very loud and there’s not much space in between tables. The tuna was great, and the pasta dishes were also very good. The staff were generally quite impatient with customers and unhelpful. It is one of those places with superb food, so the staff really don’t care about the quality of their service, which is a shame…', 'Great meal! The lamb was superb and a great change pace. Group of 15 service was perfect and treated the team very professional. The risotto was delicious and the Steak was cooked to perfection. Everyone had cleared their plate.']

Name: Schiller Deli
Summary: Espresso, sandwiches & baked sweet treats in a relaxed venue with big windows & outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 7:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Very good coffee shop for a quick breakfast. They also have a modest / small / and overall expensive selection of homemade sandwiches', 'Really cozy little cafe that serves sweet and savory pastries and sandwiches, as well as some takeout items like salads and soups. The service staff were super efficient as well.', 'This is the cutest Deli in this part of the city.

Food prices are also highly reasonable. Tastes incredible, and they have a wide selection to choose from. Cold salads, sandwiches, focaccia, cakes, cookies, you name it.

Service is quick. Place is cute (but small) so it might be harder to find a spot to dine-in during peak lunch hours.

Overall: recommended.']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['We ordered happy meal because we wanted the minion toy. We thought we could get 3 different ones but apparently there is only 1 kind of toy for the month..

When we opened the bag, there were no toys so we went to the counter and asked for it.

While eating we realized that the apple slices were also missing from the order and we did not feel like asking for them again so we just left.', "McDonald's impresses with diverse vegan and vegetarian options, and the table service is notably quick and efficient.
