Unfortunately, the cold fries and less than clean tables detract from an otherwise positive experience, highlighting areas for improvement.", 'Very poor experience. The order was totally messed up. We ordered three happy meals for the kids but there were no toys. They also forgot to serve fries with the meals. No napkins provided either.']

Name: Pizza Hut
Summary: Popular delivery, carry-out & dine-in chain known for pizza, wings & pasta, plus sides & desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['My experience at Pizza Hut was quite average. The service was adequate, but nothing remarkable. The pizza itself was decent, but nothing outstanding in terms of flavor or quality. The crust was okay, but lacked that desirable crispiness. The toppings were standard, without any unique or memorable combinations. The atmosphere in the restaurant was typical for a fast-food chain, with a casual and bustling vibe. The cashier did try to sell me more than required. Overall, it was an average dining experience, suitable for a quick and convenient meal, but not something I would rave about or go out of my way to visit again.', 'Not a bad selection of pizzas but they are very high in grease', 'Just a place to eat.  Nice looking pizzas but far too greasy. We had pepperoni and salami. The staff were friendly. We got our order in good time. The food court was far too busy.']

Name: Shikgoo
Summary: Snug, offbeat restaurant specializing in bulgogi, bibimbap & other traditional Korean dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["The cutest Korean place I've ever been to! It is nice and cozy, with a little bridge inside the restaurant and a charming koi fish pond surrounded by plants. Upstairs, you sit on the floor and need to take your shoes off, making it a truly authentic experience. The food is delicious, and the service is both special and entertaining. The atmosphere is perfect for hanging out and chatting with friends.", "Incredible little gem!
I live around the corner and had never thought of walking in. It is a whole world of its own inside!
Not to mention how delicious the udon was...
Probably the best I've ever had (not an expert, though).
Keep in mind that spicy is spicy :) (but delicious and I would order it spicy next time too!)
I'll definitely be back", "It was super quite when we visited on a Sunday night had the entire room to ourselves. You can tell they dedicated some time on the interior. The food tastes pretty good as well as the rice and side dishes. Price wise it's few euros more expensive than other Korean restaurants around the area."]

Name: COZYMAZU
Summary: Compact, stylish venue for Taiwanese noodle dishes & street food, plus a range of teas.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Such a marvelous restaurant. It is a bit off the track but if you like (or want to try) real authentic Taiwanese cuisine go there!\nGreat Service awesome Tea selection (and presentation). Awesome Brunch on weekends.', 'The special breakfast menu on the weekends is a treat. The taste is rich but balanced. The sides a varied and tasty as well. The whole package together with the atmosphere make for a cozy and fulfilling dining experience and guarantee a good start into your weekend.', 'It is a very nice small but comfortable restaurant specializing with Taiwan food. They have different menus for weekend brunch and normal dinner. I have not tried their normal dinner menu yet, but I really enjoyed the brunch there. The porridge with meat and the pickled fruit were so nice. I would not recommend a spontaneous visiting, it is better to have a reservation beforehead.']

Name: Osteria da Pino
Summary: Pizza, pasta & other Italian classics served in a venue with dark-wood chairs & exposed brick walls.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['A Family-owned authentic Italian restaurant with amazing service. You don’t have to wait too long for your meal and they have really good house wines. Overall i had a good experience here and i would be definitely visiting again.', "Very nice place with friendly atmosphere. Everything was tasty, but I'd like to highlight the grilled squid as it was very tender. A dinner for two with drinks and desserts was around 70€", 'Lovely little Italian place hidden in Sprengelkiez. I discovered a dish I did not know existed in Italian cuisine, shrimps in spicy chilli garlic olive oil sauce (real nice spiciness level). They have of course the usual pastas, pizzas, lasagna, etc. There is a bar which also serves good coffee. The atmosphere is nice and cozy. A good place for groups friends and/or family to share dinner time.']

Name: Falafel Dream 2010
Summary: Casual retro food truck with indoor & outdoor seating offering wraps & bowls, with vegan options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!
We tried halloumi and chicken wraps (with garlic sauce out of this world!!!). We loved it! Super tasty, freshly made and awesome interaction with the Boss! Highly recommended!
Gonna be back soon!', 'The crispy chicken wraps are amazing and halal. Have it as a bowl with plenty salad and potatoes is amazing as well. The remoulade sauce and spicy sauce combination is the best to go with the crispy chicken.

The owner is very friendly and gives a really great atmosphere while preparing the food.', 'The food here was pretty good but they should take a little more care when they put it all together. The falafel was a bit dry and cold as were the potatoes. It could have been much better.']

Name: Sushi & Asian Tveita
Summary: Intimate eatery providing Vietnamese dishes, beer, wine, cocktails & espresso drinks.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Awesome Vietnamese restaurant with loads of fresh fish options, indoor and outdoor seating, and Vietnamese drip coffee!\n\nI enjoyed the salmon bowl which came with salad that packed a crunch and complimented the salmon nicely.', "Sorry haven't taken the photos of meals, but I have to say the shrimps in curry are frozen ones... It ruined the whole curry 🫠 sommerrollen are good", "Great food, big portions. At first the menu doesn't seem very veggie/vegan friendly, but you can substitute the chicken or duck in any plate for their vegan versions!"]

Name: Sotto
Summary: Creative vegan & veggie pizzas, wine & desserts served in a snug, casual eatery.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['I have been here a couple of times already and always good. Last time I finally tried something else then pizza. I had some truffle gnocchi with legumes. Really delicious. As a starter we shared asparagus carpaccio which was lovely too. If you don’t have a reservation this place is usually a hit of a struggle but totally worth it. Unfortunately not fully vegan but mostly!', 'Lovely place with creative vegan pizzas. I had the vegan capriossa and the vegan diavola. The Diavola was the better one, the smoky carrots and spicy chilli oil made it a good vegan rendition of the original which is usually with spicy salami, I think. I’m not too sure about the almond cream, it’s kinda nice and creamy but not really the best cheese replacement I think. Minus one star because the crust was too burnt because the restaurant was way too packed. Probably come on a less busy day to get the most out of the kitchen. Service staff were lovely.', 'The first time I tried a vegetarian pizza with ingredients I never thought would taste good, I was blown away by how delicious it was. อร่อยแสงออกปาก \\\\(*o*)//']

Name: Kentucky Fried Chicken
Summary: Restaurant chain known for its buckets of fried chicken, plus combo meals & sides.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Definitely not the best KFC out there, but it’s sometimes the only option in this area as there isn’t almost anything else that stays open late', 'Nice not long wait', 'Chicken has no favor what happen to the special recipe of kfc. Chicken was not great at all and not finger licking good at all.']

Name: Rebel Room
Summary: Generous burgers are dished up in this down-to-earth takeaway with a leafy terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Rebel Room is my go-to burger place in Berlin. I love the urban vibe at the crossroads of the Seestraße. The locally sourced buns and amazing meat make their burgers stand out, and the curly fries are a must-try. They offer a variety of delicious sauces that add a unique flavor, and they also have great vegan options.', 'Great spot in Wedding with vegan/veggie options available, friendly staff and good prices. Totally recommended:)', 'Easily one of the best burgers in Berlin, lots of choices, including vegan (and vegan cheese that is actually good!)
We had the Half Smash (A Smash patty and a "normal" 150gm patty in the same burger, I had mine with vegan cheese due to dietary issues) and a standard Hamburger, and both were fantastic. A little greasy and messy in the best way, Fresh salads, great balance with the sauces, soft bun, and perfectly grilled patties.
The sides were also great, super tasty "Hand cut" style pommes, with fantastic thick crisp onion rings.
Venue is basic with some decent outside seating with shade, simple tables and bench seats.
Overall I highly recommend this place and we will definitely be making it a regular on our Burger list!']

Name: Blume an der Hasenheide
Summary: Cozy stop for German-Mediterranean light bites, plus coffee, cake & lots of vegan choices.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:30 PM
Reviews: ["Nice and quiet place with lovely food and team. Don't miss it! Plenty of gluten free options.", 'what a place ! cozy and delicious food !! reasonable prices, and best thing is the staff, smiling and so friendly, ! it was my last breakfast in Berlin and I am glad I went there with my friends. !!! will come back again next time !! Thank you 💚🤍', 'Been there for their Sunday brunch buffet and back again for lunch. Everything is delicious and the attention is always great. Peaceful and cozy environment to work or read. The Spinat Käse Spätzle was amazing.']

Name: Berlin Tantuni
Summary: Busy, counter-serve place preparing tantuni & other familiar Turkish bites in a relaxed, cozy space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['3 Years ago my GF and I were searching for a place to eat at night and stumbled upon this Restaurant. We ordered Halloumi-Taschen and Kebap and it was literally the most delicous food we ever expierenced. 3 Years later and I still compare every place where you can buy Kebap with this place. So I traced this place back on G-Maps just so I can review it.
Great Place; literally a must-visit if you travel to Berlin.', 'The best tantuni in Berlin! Simple yet delicious, good quality meat, fast and friendly service. Their lahmacun is also quite good, nothing like tasteless weird Turkische Pizza. Absolutely recommended 👌', 'Yogurtlu Tantuni for 12.5.
Tastes not bad, but i would add more meat and dial it back on the yogurt side.

Keen to give it another try for other menu option.']

Name: Cookies Cream
Summary: Innovative plant-based dishes like seaweed caviar at a renowned venue accessed via an alleyway.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Ordered the 7 courses. Overall an incredible vegetarian culinary experience. Each dish was creative/novel, a unique menu filled with combinations that surprised me.

A interesting juxtaposition between the casual atmosphere and the Michelin starred fine dining experience. Eccentric decor. Service was impeccable.

7 courses was 140 euros. Was able to get 15% off by booking online a couple days ahead of time.', "Visiting this restaurant is an adventure in itself. The location is truly unique and getting there is an experience in its own right. The restaurant is situated in a remote area, and the journey to reach it takes you through a scenic route that sets the perfect mood for a culinary journey. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by Martha, who provided us with exceptionally friendly and professional service throughout the evening. Her attention to detail and warm smile immediately made us feel at home. Every dish served was a true culinary masterpiece. It's evident that great care and thought goes into both the presentation and flavor of the dishes. The creations on our plates were not only visually appealing but also a delight for the taste buds. While the restaurant offers carefully selected paired drinks with each course, I found this personal touch not essential. The dishes themselves were so exquisite that the non-alcoholic beverages, while tasty on their own, didn't add significant value to the experience. The flavors of the dishes stood well on their own without this additional pairing. Overall, it was an evening to remember, and I look forward to experiencing this culinary adventure again soon. This restaurant is definitely worth revisiting! Sofie - Belgium", 'I had a wonderful time. The staff was really friendly and helpful, each dish was more beautiful than the other - as well as delicious - and the wine selection is on point. Plan to take your time and enjoy the experience!']

Name: Borchardt
Summary: Genteel, historic restaurant with a terrace preparing local staples & desserts, plus wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["A restaurant where you can enjoy German cuisine.
The atmosphere in the back garden was nice and open, but it felt a bit cramped due to the number of tables.
The waiter was very friendly, and I didn't experience any of the negative impressions mentioned in other reviews.
The food was tasty, but not exceptionally delicious considering the price.", 'A classic - the schnitzel was so great. Will definitely be back when in Berlin. We also tried the steak tartar and it was excellent!', 'The best place to try the Wiener Schnitzel. The portions were massive, you can share 1 for 2 people. I liked the veal, potato salad and the cranberry sauce. Passion martini was also good. The restaurant has a nice ambiance but tables are too close to each other and it can get loud sometimes.']

Name: Augustiner am Gendarmenmarkt
Summary: Bavarian-style beer hall, with a dark wood-paneled ceiling & walls, serving South German cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews:
['you’re looking to experience authentic German cuisine and have a great time, head to this Bavarian Brauhaus. Centrally located, this charming restaurant offers a warm and inviting atmosphere. The menu boasts a variety of traditional German dishes, all prepared with care and flavor. Whether you’re a tourist or a local, this restaurant promises a memorable dining experience with its delicious food and welcoming ambiance. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Sometimes it’s better to reserve a table.', "We stumbled across this place by

accident and stopped for a beer to rehydrate ourselves! It's a popular place and is really nice with lots of outdoor street seating, but there can be a bad drain smell on one side we noticed.  The Berlin currywurst was just sausage and chips which we don't recommend over some of the other foods on the menu.

There's not a great choice of food choice for vegetarians though.

Wine spritzer is really nice and the Augustiner hell beer is really good too", "I was hoping for more out of this one! I ordered a Brezel to start, which sadly never came, and our food came out before our drinks (which we ordered first). All of the dishes were good but I was a little bummed by the service and atmosphere, which was a little slammed with tourists, so I get it. I'd say come here for a great beer (which is their specialty) and a decent traditional German meal on the side. But there are better schnitzels and sausages in the area if you're looking for something cozier or tasty. The service was friendly though and we were overall happy we tried it out."]

Name: Bocca di Bacco
Summary: Italian restaurant with floor-to-ceiling windows in a 19th-century building with modern interiors.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Next to the Westin grand hotel. Nice lunch set menu. The service is friendly and attend to detail. The food is well prepared with freshness bread with different selection. Melon cold soup to open the taste buds. The cod fish is grilled and then baked with the right seasoning to reach the right tenderness. The service makes the overall experience nicely presented. With the espresso as the finale, The smile of the waitress also beautifully endorsed the Italian style of service. Well done!! 😉', 'The vibe of the restaurant is really nice, perfect for date night or a romantic dinner. The food, I find it quite average compare to the price. The ingredients are very fresh and top quality but the taste is quite generic, salty and nothing special. My spaghetti dish, the noodles are a little too firm to be al dente. In general, this place offers excellent service and good quality food but I just have a higher expectation when it comes to the taste especially for a restaurant like this.', "Overall nice food but for a high end restaurant the service was let down by the following. One waitress dropped the knife on me. At the same time she spilled a bit of food on my expensive top.
Rather than hurrying to give me a bit of cloth to clean up, she was tidying up the rest of the table and picking up the cutlery from the floor instead as if nothing had happened. There was no sense of urgency or genuine apology. After waiting for a few minutes, I spoke to the manager to ask for some cloth to clean up with. Five minutes later, she finally came back with a wet cloth.

A different waiter told me that we could order half portions of pasta dishes. And so we ordered TAGLIOLINI NERI CON CRUDO DI TONNO, BURRATA E PISTACCHI. When the bill came, the price was definitely much more than the 50% of the menu price. I asked the waiter whether it was half the price and he said yes. I ended up paying anyway. I checked the bill later and it turned out to be much more than the 50% of the price. It's a bit misleading.

Don't believe when the waiter tells you that pasta portions can be served in half portions because in reality you end up with half the amount and instead pay about 70%.

We had the starters which were octopus and the tuna tagliolini. They were well made and tasty.

The main which was the monk fish was quite underwhelming and rather boring after a few bites. (The waiter recommended this dish)

So my overall experience is a mixture of good and bad."]

Name: Brasserie Am Gendarmenmarkt
Summary: Elegant restaurant with wood paneling, murals & brass lamps, serving modern European dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["We had a lovely time here. Everything was really perfect from start to finish. Especially the super attentive service and then obviously the food.
The Bouillabaisse is incredible. The depth of flavor while having a big selection of seafood in it was amazing. But also the tartar and the creme brulee were superb.

I'll definitely come back for a nice occasion as this restaurant definitely hits the mark :)", 'We really loved our dinner there tonight, as the food and atmosphere were really good. Our server was very nice but not really attentive after serving us our main course. She completely disappeared and never checked bag on us for over half an hour.

My wife had the seafood bouillabaise, which was delicious, and I went more traditional with the blood sausage, which I thought was spectacular! We loved our meal tonight, but the service was very cold and and fell flat as the meal went on.', "The Brasserie am Gendarmenmarkt in Berlin offers a delightful culinary experience, seamlessly blending traditional flavors with modern flair. The pumpkin soup, a standout starter, impresses with its creamy texture and a harmonious blend of spices, providing a comforting yet sophisticated taste. The beef  stew, the highlight of the meal, is a masterful display of culinary artistry. Tender, succulent pieces of veal are simmered to perfection, enveloped in a rich, flavorful sauce that complements the meat's natural flavors. Accompanied by a fresh, crisp side salad, the meal achieves a satisfying balance. The brasserie's ambiance, characterized by elegance and a warm, welcoming atmosphere, enhances the dining experience, making it a must-visit destination for both locals and tourists seeking authentic, high-quality German cuisine in Berlin."]

Name: Restaurant Maximilians Berlin
Summary: Bavarian-style bar & restaurant with traditional dark wood paneling, copper piping & outdoor seats.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['A+++ for this restaurant. I was really impressed overall with the food, the service and the amazing atmosphere. The uniforms they wear are so cool and their vibes even cooler. Service was outstanding, we never waited for anything, the staff always came and checked to make sure everything was to our liking and our waitress was hilarious! I cannot recommend this place enough if you’re in Berlin! The portion sizes were large and filling. We had the meatloaf, bratwurst and schnitzel and they were all incredible. Easily 5 stars! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️', 'An amazing traditional restaurant in the heart of the city. The food, hygiene, service, and staff friendliness were all top-notch. It is a bit expensive, but the quality is worth it. I will definitely be back whenever I have guests.', 'The food and service were excellent during my first visit. My friend recommended the Ganze Haxe, and it did not disappoint. The beer was also great. The goose cheese salad is good with bread but the smell is too strong. We made a reservation and got a nice spot. However, when we ordered two colas, only one was brought to the table, so we had to remind the waitress. The waiter promptly brought the second one, and we thought everything was fine. But after we got home, we noticed in the bill that we had been charged for three colas instead of two. It was partly our fault for not checking the drink portion of the bill more carefully.']

Name: Nante-Eck
Summary: Classic Berlin food in a plush, old-world brasserie setting with frosted glass, plus a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['Our first stop in Berlin! Wonderful restaurant serving up traditional German and Berlin dishes. We walked up at lunch time and got sat immediately on the sidewalk seating. Great service and atmosphere, and the portions are quite large!', 'Good wholesome well flavoured filling food. Sadly let down by poor service. Yes I am from the uk, but also when you sit outside you don’t expect someone sat inside to come smoke stood near your table. Sort these bits out to go with the food and great place to eat with great location', "Sure, it's Unten den Linden but 28 for a Schnitzel seems a bit steep. Anyway, we went for a Wurstlparade and a Giant Currywurst. Told the waiter to bring also a Berliner meatball (on the menu as a possible addition to anything) and he brought the whole dish. Anyway, we were hungry. Overall, not great, not terrible."]

Name: Izumi Restaurant-Sushi Bar & Lieferservice
Summary: Compact dining room with Japanese hanging lamps, banquette seating & freshly prepared sushi dishes.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews:
["Very friendly and helpful stuff. Delicious and fresh sushi. Waiter Alex is a very nice and kind person. He helped me to select the sushi and generally just made my day. I am so happy that people, who are working here truly love their job and people. Alex is very professional. I can feel that he really loves his job. I am always feeling better, when I visit such kind of places, where people cook and work with love. Izumi Restaurant is a really good place to visit. It's a restaurant, where I would like to come back again and again.
I think that the true success of the restaurant depends not just on food, but also on the emotions and atmosphere, that people create. I am really glad that this restaurant really cares about the people's experience and does not let the people stay alone with hard choices. They are always ready to help, give good advice and help to make a good choice. Waiters here can find a good approach to every client. Thank you for a great experience 👍
Food itself was very good 👍 High level sushi quality, a little bit warm rice 🍚. Everything how it should be.
🍣 Authentic and delicious sushi 🍣🍣
Definitely recommend to everyone
Green tea 🍵 🍨 ice-cream with lichy 10/10
Definitely RECOMMEND to everyone !", 'Mediocre sushi place. Food is literally just OK. Not worth taking a detour for
Place was empty despite euro finals weekend and served by a single waitress.', 'This was an exiting experience. Very very fresh sushi. Very tasty. Thanks for the chief cook. Good service. We will definitely come back to try again!!!']

Name: Treffpunkt Berlin
Summary: Currywurst, meatballs & pork knuckle, plus German beers, in a wood-paneled pub with classic decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Had a Schnitzel, mushroom cream sauce and fried thin potatoes.\nAbsolutely huge portions, excellent.Great flavours, excellent service from Waiter bar man,had menus in different languages.He was lovely, funny.\nSome of the other food coming out were just so huge in portions, particularly the pork hock/leg!', 'Great German restaurant. They even played German music in the background. The curry wurst is very good. The curry isn’t  overpowering and the potatoes herbs are spot on. The pork knuckle (ham hock) was also very good. It looks intimidating but the meat is super tender and moist. We also got a beer and mirinda soda. All in all this seems like an authentic German bar. Wait staff is also friendly. The place is a little warm due to the air conditioner being off. Total for all these items was 45 euros or $50.', 'We loved this place. We ended up going multiple times while we stayed in Berlin because the food, beer, staff, atmosphere and prices were all great! We know where we’re going next time we’re in the city!']

Name: Restaurant Austernbank
Summary: Upscale seafood plates presented in a grand, sophisticated dining space with a chic bar.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Was ok, I guess...
I'd say everything was average.
Wine was good, but then again, it was a  200 Euro wine.", 'Had an amazing dinner. The waiter organized a table for me even if there weren’t any more left. I had the 500g shrimps with Aioli - which were amazing, very fresh and nice sauce😋. And Creme Brulle was very good too.
Would definitely come back for the shrimps.', 'This is not a fine dining restaurant.
I mean the restaurant’s interior is fine, but the dining…meh.

Cheap ingredients, frozen seafood. the quality and presentation leave much to be desired…. The cherry on the cake - they tried to deceive us and added dishes to the bill that we did not order. We paid almost 150 euros for a crooked version of caesar salad, tasteless mozzarella and a shelf with half-dead salmon, topped with an untreated roughly cut onion and a cheap caviar from supermarket.

But, that’s the only place around which is serving you food after 10pm.']

Name: Charlotte & Fritz
Summary: Upscale fine-dining venue with chandeliers, serving acclaimed French-inspired meat & seafood dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 10:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["There are different high-class restaurants. This one have their own old German atmosphere and a very tasty fresh dishes. The portions aren't so big, that you can't breathe, but also aren't too small, that you are going away hungry. I think three courses are enough. Also, there is a choice of an old and good alcohol, such as armaniak, Obstler, good vibes and others.", 'Wow ! What can I say ! simply stunning ... the whole experience was fabulous. My finance booked a surprise evening for my family/friends and I for my 50th Birthday week-end ! The restaurant did an outstanding job and we all loved it from start to finish. All the staff were outstanding  - their customer service skills were beyond excellent ! I have to give a shout out to the head waiter who has served at the hotel where the restaurant is for 30 years.

The food was absolutely divine and the restaurant setting was stunning. We were a group of 12 , and the entire restaurant team handled us so well.

Thank you so much for making my birthday week-end in Berlin so memorable.', 'We have dined at the Charlotte&Fritz on New Year’s eve. Not only was the food delicious and the wine great, but also the ambience and the service of the personnel could not be any better. The restaurant is   equipped with stylish furniture, and nice   decorations which we were lucky to enjoy because we visited on the 31/12.
The wine made an excellent combination with the aesthetic meals.
If you are fond of gourmet food and nice stylish restaurants-Charlotte&Fritz is for you:)']

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['I was here this evening today & the employee was so friendly. Nice & clean place..and the sandwich was top notch.', 'Order the 2 for 1 on Wolt. One of the sandwiches was completely wrong. Both sandwiches were stuffed with so little that actually you could fit it all in just one sandwich. There was so little chicken and other ingredients that it’s just like you’re eating bread. Never buying again! STAY AWAY', 'Best subway I have had. So good, friendly staff and very clean place']

Name: RESTAURANT ELLA
Summary: Sophisticated hotel restaurant serving refined, contemporary European cuisine & complimentary wines.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews:
['Excellent service and kitchen. Very good value for money business lunch: 14,50 EUR for two courses incl a large bottle of water, bread and butter. For 3 euros more you get a dessert as well. Modern German/French kitchen. Great für business meetings or when you want to dine close to main station. Service was fast and helpful. Good choice of wines as well.', 'After paying 70€ for unsalted, overcooked pasta and a rather starter-sized portion of "catch of the day"-fish, I headed for the burger place at the train station.
As a consultant, I'm used to mediocre hotel restaurant. But price/quality ratio at Ella marks a low.

To be fair: ambient is nice, service friendly.', "Very nice atmosphere, but temporary service staff and long waiting times. The food was prepared rather mediocre and carelessly arranged. The duck for the main course of the 4-course menu, which cost 66 euros, was far too dry, and the potato canneloni filled with red cabbage didn't go well with it. The wine selection was very modest, both quantitatively and qualitatively. The cuisine is below average for a hotel of this category."]

Name: Biertempel 2
Summary: Schnitzel, plus German fish dishes & grills, in a simple, old-school interior or a beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["Dinner was very tasty. Portions in perfect size. Prices reasonable. 9-13 euro for dish. Personel nice. I was very hungry so I was happy that I didn't have to wait long time for dish - it was very quick. It's good place to feel old fashioned German style. But also the decoration of place was little bit funny. Plus is that they have nice beer garden.", 'Great food and service. Lovely outdoor seating (indoor seating available).', 'Tasty food, true German cuisine, huge portions at good and reasonable prices.']

Name: The Luftbrücke restaurant
Summary: Asian & Western snacks share the menu in an offbeat setup with mismatched vintage furniture.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['One of the greatest places, the atmosphere is amazing. They offer only a few dishes but they taste really good. The service is very kind. If you are in Berlin you should absolutely visit this place.', 'Good spot with a mixed menu of classics and more exotic dishes\nSolid food quality in a very relaxed setup overlooking the street.', 'Wonderful cozy friendly place with reasonable prices and good comfort food.  The Shnitzel with fries was great.']

Name: Gon 80 Vietnamese Cuisine Restaurant
Summary: Low-key option serving typical Vietnamese fare including noodles, spring rolls, meat dishes & pho.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['my favorite restaurant in Berlin, always tasty food and nice service. There are vegan options, which are really good. Thank you for everything ☺️', 'Their dishes were delicious and fresh! Originally we ordered 1 appetizer, 1 main dish, 1 dessert and two drinks and after finishing those dishes we just had to order more because it was great! The staff were friendly and accommodating. A must try!', 'Undoubtedly the best Pho we had in Germany, so felt really lucky to find this place on our last day during the drive home. Definitely coming back here on our first day when we are in Berlin again ❤️ Thank you']

Name: MARS | Küche & Bar
Summary: Light-filled hangout serving locally sourced cuisine for lunch, weekend brunch & evening snacks.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Reviews: ['Once you get over the fact that this is (inside/annexed/next to) a Crematorium AND a Cemetery, it is one of the most delicious brunches I’ve had in Berlin! The coffee (Americano) was exceptional, balanced. The vegetarian (Green breakfast) has a clear oriental influence and everything was delicious. The savory waffle plate was also a perfect balance of flavors. The interior is surprising; open and cozy. Still thinking about this place and unique vibe. The food was outstanding', 'Loved the atmosphere! Super friendly staff and food tastes great. Not your typical brunch menu as it combines different flavors but so nice on a summer day.', 'The atmosphere is really cool but the stuff was slow and the food is mediocre. Iced latte tasted like milk. Had to order an extra espresso shot to taste some coffee.']

Name: ernst
Summary: Innovative tasting menus using local produce in an intimate 8-seat restaurant with an open kitchen.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["I'm really sad that Ernst is closing. We visited for the 2nd time since the renovation for their beef menu in January. It was equally stunning as their other seasons. The staff were a bit more chatty as well, which I appreciated because it adds quite a lot to the experience. I dare to say that it is the only actual serious restaurant in Berlin and I'm sad to see it go. Hope to visit one last time before closing.", "My expectations were extremely high. There is a lot of noise around this restaurant across Germany,  Europe and beyond. I was a bit skeptical to be honest, but wow, did they deliver. 5 stars in every aspect. Only downside might be the wine menu but it's always difficult for younger restaurants and you can't compare them with the legacy ones. And the pairing was still very nice. The 30 (or more?) courses were fantastic and I loved every single one of them. There is a clear red line through the menu, the quality of the products is outstanding, the atmosphere is very homey and the staff including the chefs give you a feeling of being welcome in their kitchen and are happy to answer any questions. It's crazy that they do double seating and deliver on such a high level twice every night. Courses in June contained a lot of fish, fresh veritable and fruits and two courses of lamb. Great balance, great creativity, not too creative (right on the edge), very high skills from all over the world. Go there, have a blast, you won't regret it. Worth every cent. Dylan even spend 10 minutes with me at the end sharing his travel suggestions for Vancouver.", 'What an amazing experience. This 8 seat restaurant takes Japanese omakase and combines it with seasonal ingredients from the greater berlin area.\nThis leads to an 30-40 course menu (depending on the season) you will spend multiple hours eating little bites and chatting with the chefs. We had an absolut blast here.']

Name: Pamfilya Restaurant
Summary: Rustic-chic establishment with a long menu of Turkish specialties, including doner kebabs & grills.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['First class Turkish doner restaurant serving many other typical dishes. Excellent.', 'Best döner kebab in Berlin. Amazing beef flavour and bread made in-house.', 'Best kebab veal meat quality I have tasted so far in Germany.

Bread was a bit to mushi on one point.   Sloppy toasting.
I suggest to take extra meat with your döner order.

And with 5.50 a bit on the steep side.

The ayran was fresh and tasty.

Overall really really good.   Almost perfect.  Actually 4.5 stars.']

Name: Engels
Summary: Hip cafe offering vegetarian & vegan breakfast options, as well as beer cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ['Breakfast here is amazing. Fresh, home-made, simple and tasty. Coffee spot on. And you can pay by card, which in Germany is still novelty', 'Very nice place to enjoy a good coffee. The vibes are very chill for book reading.', 'I only had Chai Latte because they would not make any coffee at 6:30pm and unfortunately it the taste was too weak and too milky and sugary. Not worth the price unfortunately(4euros). So cannot recommend it, sorry;(']

Name: Isla coffee Berlin
Summary: Clean, modern space for coffee, brunch & toasted sandwiches, with vegan options & a leafy terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews: ['Great atmosphere with super friendly, professional staff. A lovely outdoor area to relax and food to die for. The food was such high quality, fresh and interesting - not the usual brunch style fare. The herb and onion Kastenknödel was delicious with home made tomato chutney (again not like anything I had made or eaten); a super tasty mushroom on toast dish; delicious cakes like lemon drizzle & almond, cinnamon and yoghurt cake. Sadly I was only visiting Berlin - if not it would be my regular cafe!!', "Lovely place, but I have to give a special shout out to Sierra. Because..  wow. She is just incredible. You walk in and you're greeted by that cute friendly face and it makes your whole day. I had a hot chocolate here, made by her, and it was one of the very best hot chocolates I've ever had in my whole life.", 'Everything is really nice, girls are so cute and they offered a very good service🤩\nThe brunch and the coffee are amazing,  it’s the most delicious brunch that I ever had in Berlin 💕\nMUST TRY']

Name: MUTED HORN
Summary: Bottled lagers, ales & ciders, plus 22 on tap, in a minimalist tavern with bare brick walls.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Great place for craft beer aficionados. Good selection of European beers, few NAmericas. Brutalist atmosphere, nice people around. Good prices.', 'Best craft beer option in Berlin, impressive selection of beers in bottles / cans. Tap options also interesting. Nice staff', "Amazing beer place that will satisfy people with all kind of beer preferences. If I lived in Berlin or at least stayed there for longer time, this would definitely be my go-to beer place.
I liked the option of tasting trays that consists of 4 small glasses of specific beers that you put together from the current offer of tapped beers. Some beers for tasting tray are slightly more expensive, but the tasting tray is still the best option if you want to try more beers, or if you can't decide. I tried two tasting sets - one with sour beers, another one with stouts. Both were put together with recommendations from the guy at the tap, and I liked the final results a lot.
Tapped water to your beer is for free, which I find amazing, and staff speaks English.
No food offered, mostly just some beer snacks, so count with the fact that you won't have your dinner here."]

Name: MAMA KALO
Summary: French & German bistro fare like tarte flambée & spaetzle in a quaint space with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['We were looking for a place to eat and found this gem :) the staff are so so friendly and kind, the food was also delicious. I like the idea of combining French and German cuisine, the galette with mushrooms was top😍 they have a cute terrace too. I recommend it!', 'I know that most places serve avocado on toast. Yes it’s common and yes it’s a staple brunch dish. This on the other hand was truly delicious 😋. It was spectacular in all aspects. Not only was the dish marvellous 🤩, but the service was on another level. I was there on the 1st of May with a friend. The waitress was the kindest and most helpful I’ve encountered in Berlin. I will be back to try the other dishes. This place is a real gem 💎.', 'We loved this place! Located on a nice spot near Tempelhof park.\nVery tasty with great combinations of flavour. Vegan options and nice atmosphere. We had a potato soup as a starter and for main we shared a Flammkuchen with pears and sweet toasted nuts and a Vegan Galette. Drinks and dessert were great too! Highly recommend :)\nHope we visit you again soon!!']

Name: La Pecora Nera
Summary: Classic pasta dishes, grills & Italian wines in a compact venue with quirky decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 5:30 – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['I came across this little gem today, and every bite was perfection—Bourno the Sicilian wino perfecto. I read some reviews where people mentioned that the portions are small for the price, but I disagree. I think the balance between portion size and quality is just right for a restaurant of this caliber.

I had two courses: the Romanian salad and the Gnocchi. Along with a bottle of sparkling water and a glass of wine, the total was 42 Euros. Very reasonable, in my opinion. The service was relaxed and informal, a refreshing change from the usual pretentiousness found in high-quality restaurants.

Ps nobody can pay rent or salary by serving tap water ;)', 'Overall, I liked the experience.
The food is tasty, full of flavors. But the portion sizes are too small and too pricey unfortunately (compared to same quality italian restaurants in the neighborhood). Tomato pasta cost about 15€. Wine is also quite expensive for what it is...
Staff is kind.', "Even if prices feels fancy, it's totally worth it. You can really tell how good of a quality the food is and how fresh the products are. The ( I guess ) homemade bread was a killer, we love how creative they are with their salads and the gnocchi tasted like a dream. Just wishing they had more veggie options coming soon on the menu ! Would highly recommend anyways"]

Name: Pazzi X Pizza
Summary: Classic pizzas & seasonal specials in a buzzy space lined with distressed wood & exposed bricks.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['We ordered 2m worth of Pizza for 4 people and it was more than enough, reasonably priced too, great service and most of all tasted amazing', 'Happy to recommend this restaurant for great pizza & pasta... fresh ingredients, brilliant flavours & great pizza bases make for genuinely good pizza. Service was excellent...', 'Below average pizza if you are used to eating good quality Italian pizza. The price also doesn’t justify the quality. Service was fine, regular Berlin service. They accepted card.']

Name: Urban Spree
Summary: Trackside industrial complex hosting art galleries, dance clubs, food stands & a beer garden.
Reviews:
['Really cool spot to buy art, books and more. The lady that helped me was super sweet and explained a thing or two. Will visit again for sure. DO READ WHEN THE SHOP IS OPEN. The garden, shop and gallery have different visiting hours', 'Cute Biergarten, in a little green place on RAW Gelände.
There are many tables and places to seat, on a Saturday morning/lunchtime it was almost empty.
The place is nice to seat but the drinks are not worth the price. All soft drinks are around 4€, and from the alcohol stack that they have, the 9€-11€ cocktails can’t be that good.
Nevertheless, nice place for a sunny day.', 'Super creative and free spirit, nice museums and temporary art exhibitions, nice clubs and bars. Live graffiti and special events (eg Vans Shop Riot 2024)']

Name: Cassiopeia
Summary: Nightclub with a subculture edge & live music program in a former industrial hall with a courtyard.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews:
['This is my favorite place to go out to dance. I love the vibe of this club I love the dirty dancing party. I always have an amazing time when I go here.
The biergarten is also so nice in the summer, I love to go and to chill with my friends.
The employees are always really sweet.
I recommend it 100%', "The place is great. It's big open air club, surrounded by trees. It has skate park and climbing area which is pretty big. Prices for drinks are not much different from prices in other clubs. It's family and dog friendly.
Staff is also nice. Club has live music events.", 'I went there for a Friday night party. It was one of the worst spend money in my life (12€  entrance fee and 10€ for a beer). The average age of people is 40+ and the music is horrible.']

Name: Trattoria Libau
Summary: Unassuming operation with an old-school vibe doling out pizzas, pasta & tiramisu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Good place for a quick Italian food. The pizza was very well done, and the pasta as well. Nothing out of the ordinary, but super good. Recommended.', 'Great pizza ( had pugliese), tasty tiramisu.
Friendly service too.
Loved it.
The bruschetta bread was a bit too hard, but tasted good', 'Wonderful pizza, excellent service']

Name: Scheers Schnitzel
Summary: Hearty servings of schnitzel, chips & beer in a casual, industrial-look space with wall scribblings.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["Went looking for a traditional German schnitzel.  Was a small sit down restaurant but a fast food atmosphere.  Food was served on paper plates which wasn't a problem.  Not a lot of seating, but the schnitzel did not disappoint.  Options other than pork.  Fantastic!", 'Frankly the best Schnitzel I’ve ever had. I came to Berlin looking for the best Schnitzel restaurants and this one popped; with good reason. It is simple, self-order (offered in a manifold of different languages) with a great chill out atmosphere that suits this type of dish. The cooks will proudly show you how they batter the schnitzel and even how they make their famous potato salad (which is absolutely amazing). They offer Schnitzels ranging from Weiner meat to Turkey and everything in between. Same goes for the sides, what else do you need? If you are in Berlin and fancy a Schnitzel this is your place.', "Another nice restaurant with good food for a nice price. Funny concept, order via QR and pick up your drinks and food yourself. So, not a lot of 'service', but the staff is friendly.\n\nBig schnitzel in various ways, we loved it. Fries were a bit to salt, but that's forgiven. Very tasty fresh coleslaw en fresh made schnitzel."]

Name: Mutzenbacher
Summary: Warm, comfy operation dishing up wiener schnitzel & other hearty Austrian specialties.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Always a good place for some Austrian specialties like Schnitzel, Knödel, Leberkäs or Kaiserschmarren. The team is very quick and friendly. We really enjoyed our dinner.', 'The place has a great variety of Austrian dishes. I had the Schnitzel, which was fine, but nothing special. Annoyingly, the side wasn’t included in this 20+ euro dish and cost another 4+ euros. I also had the Germ Knödel for dessert, which was very small but still cost €9.5. Overall, I found the price to be way too high for the quality of the food. The waiter who served us however was very friendly and attentive, so that was great.', 'The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and the food is good. The spinach dumplings "Spinatknödel" are amazing as well as the desserts. Staff is friendly and always around.']

Name: East Side Bäckerei
Summary: Straightforward cafe dishing up informal breakfast & lunch fare, plus coffee & baked goods.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews:
["The cappuccino had quite bitter taste. The nougat-croissant was good.
They have a good variety of pasteries.
The room is spacious, and it's cozy, not loud

They accept card payment (not amex)", "Very good place in Berlin Mitte, a nice variety of pastry and sandwiches.
Very good quality for drinks as coffee, tea, shakes, etc.

Would you like to discover the area of Berlin where this cafe is?

I'm a tour guide in Berlin!

Click on the link in my BIO!

Book your Walking Tour!", 'Never have I been more disappointed than this morning when I took a bite into East Side Bakery’s vegan chocolate muffin. 2.5 euros for the crumbliest, driest, and most pitiful muffin in the world. Never will I return.']

Name: Michelberger Restaurant
Summary: Airy venue for breakfast pastries, brunch & seasonally inspired dinner set menus, with a terrace.
Reviews:
['We came here twice - once for a light breakfast and once for dinner. First the good: there dinner service is delicious, but book ahead. Coffee in day and cocktails in the evening are also very good.

That said,tThe food in their cafe needs improvement. The quiche was delicious but still cold after it was heated. The poached egg was hard boiled. These are both things I would usually send back at a restaurant.

I’ll still give them 4 stars, but mostly for the dinner service.', 'Tasteful Patio where you can sit outside. Relaxed atmosphere where you can have a good evening. We went for dinner. Sharing meal concept. You have the option to go for menu (52€ pp) or a la carte.

We liked:
- the vibe and atmosphere
- friendly service
- some tasty food options
- good drinks

We did not like:
- small portions, you will not the same amount of appetizers as the number of menues
- some appetizers are rather bland
- 52€ menu cost for not even getting full', "I had a mixed experience at this café. The Basque cheesecake was fantastic, with the perfect level of creaminess and delicious flavor. However, the Chai latte left much to be desired. It had strange foam on top, and the latte itself was watery and lacked flavor, making it one of the worst Chai lattes I've had.

The service was a bit confusing. Despite wanting to order at the front desk, we were repeatedly told to find a seat and wait for staff to come to us. After waiting for at least 15 minutes without anyone attending to us, we had to approach the front desk again, only to still have trouble placing our order. Unfortunately, by the time the staff finally came to us, the cake my friend wanted was sold out.

On the positive side, the café itself is cozy, and the space is nice. Overall, while the food and ambiance were enjoyable, the service and Chai latte were disappointing."]

Name: Haubentaucher
Summary: Cocktails, burgers & DJs around a large open-air pool in a revamped, mural-covered factory space.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM, 12:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews:
['This is my favorite pool place in Berlin!
There’s usually a DJ and the music is great.
The bar never gets too full. Or at least on my visits. So getting drinks is quick.

Since they changed to Maaya, the food is now better.
The only thing is it gets really crowded than it used too.  There were way too many people at some points. To a point others couldn’t even find space to sit on their towels because there were no more free chairs or sunbirds.

My advise is go there early. Be there before they even open the gates. Even weekdays are busy.

Otherwise this place is really fun to visit!
I hope they will work on making it better. 🎉', 'Great place to chill and have fun. There is free entry, you can watch some sports on huge tv or for few € access the pool. The whole place looks like holiday resort and would not think this is in Berlin!
Love it here and cannot wait to come back again. ☺️', "I am here at MAAYA and the truth is that it is a downgrade, on the website it says that for 20€ on a weekday you can have a lounge beach chair and it comes with two drink tokens included (fair) at the door they tell me that for 20€ now it is only the lounge. if this is inspired by the diaspora as they say, how is it that now for the same price in return they give you less. Maybe the website is not up to date. Again if this is for the diaspora why keep old prices by removing benefits 👎🏽 , they have also removed all the floats. Downgrade, bring back Haubentacher who wasn't my favourite either but the prices were fairer. They have made a cosmetic change nothing more"]

Name: Seoul Kitchen
Summary: Trendy, industrial-style restaurant offering Korean dishes & sushi, plus a take-out option.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['Best food I’ve ever eaten (chicken BBQ and bibimbap). Great service. Tables are a bit small and it can get a little warm in there but food is 10/10. I want to come to Berlin again to experience their food again.', "Loved this place! Nice minimalistic atmosphere, friendly personnel and the food 👌So good! We had Bibimbap with beef, Japchae with chicken and Edamame. I'd recommend booking in advance, especially during the weekend", 'The bulgogi beef was absolutely delicious and tasted authentic, also a huge portion! Almost enough for two to share if having an appetizer as well. It came with rice and kimchi. Also had the appetizer of kimchi stew and it was amazing. Quite spicy so be aware. I sat outside so no idea what the place looks like inside.']

Name: Crack Bellmer
Summary: Trendy, rustic-chic nightclub with edgy art & a terrace, offering dancing to DJs till late.
Opening Hours: None
Reviews: ['Fun, more intimate than some of the other spaces in Berlin. Good music, good sound, good people.', "Dance bar with impressive sound system and interior. For the entrance you are asked for donation, so it's mostly up to you. DJs usually play melodic tech-house, so rather don't expect anything harder.", 'We really enjoyed coming here! They were very nice to us as as tourists, which was better than some of the other places in the area. The DJ was down tempo. They did have a credit card machine.']

Name: Pirates Berlin
Summary: Down-home riverside restaurant with a terrace preparing local & global dishes, plus cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['It Is a great place for dinner!!! You can eat good food enjoying the river with soft disco music. The service Is very efficient Sandro the guy who served us was kind and quick with the order and the food arrived in few minutes. We Will come back soon.', "Popped in for a beer. Great location on the river. Friendly staff. Great views. Didn't eat but menu looked decent. Recommended. 🍻", 'Taste of the food is not special. Just ordinary. But the service and atmosphere was very good. The price is okay, affordable enough.']

Name: Han West - Home of Dumplings
Summary: Compact restaurant offering Asian dumplings, including meat, veggie & vegan options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Small street food kitchen near the Tempelhofer Feld. The dumplings are well made. We had some with minced meat and chili, which reminded us of Sichuan. My Taiwanese friend said that they were quite authentic, the dough was a bit too thick. We also had buns with grilled pork belly, which reminded us more of Hong Kong or Taiwan. The pork belly was very crispy and aromatically marinated, the meat juicy and soft. You can use the tables of the Brauhaus Nelich next door, their beer goes really well with it. Only card payment.', 'I had a pork belly bao and a beer from the brewery next door. It was quite filling and really delicious with a good sized chunk of meat with crackling. Hole in the wall place with seating along the wall outside. Service was friendly and swift and the food good value for money. Highly recommended!', 'Very, very tasty! The peanut sauce is awesome, go for the combo box with the fries and try the Taiwanese pork bun, its so good!']

Name: Kentucky Fried Chicken
Summary: Restaurant chain known for its buckets of fried chicken, plus combo meals & sides.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Had the hardest orignal chicken in my whole life.
Literally taste like overdue cookie with pepper flavor that has been lying in Sahara Desert for a year.

Don’t know if this is a mistake or it just should taste like this but well.', "It was finger lickin' but not good... The fries where.... The other food was okay at best. No sauces included.
When ordering you see pictures of real Pepsi but when at the counter sugarless Pepsi is the closest you get to the original.
The order terminals try to upsell wherever they can. At least the staff is nice but could be trained a bit better.", 'They asked us to check in using an app called luca, which doesn't work.
And then we asked to cancel the order, which they denied.
The rude lady which took our order said "then just go"
They asked us to delete all the photos that we took inside when i said im going to review on google maps.

Worst customer service ever. Doesn't even worth 1 star. Pretty bad']

Name: Trattoria Fidelia I
Summary: Italian specialties are served in this warmly furnished restaurant with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['A Dismal Dining Experience

My recent visit to Trattoria Fidella was nothing short of a disaster. To start, the pasta was a complete letdown—pre-cooked, yet somehow both raw and overcooked in different bites. This level of inconsistency is unacceptable for any establishment, let alone an Italian restaurant.

The pizza was another major disappointment. It was excessively greasy, to the point where it was almost inedible. Even the bread, a basic staple, was old and tough, indicating a lack of attention to freshness and quality.

The service was equally appalling. Our male server was incredibly rude and disrespectful, displaying an unwarranted level of anger throughout our meal. Such behavior is unprofessional and made an already poor dining experience even worse.

Overall, the restaurant failed on all fronts—food quality, freshness, and customer service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a pleasant dining experience.', 'One of the best lunch time destinations in Berlin, outstanding food and right beside the train line. No dining is like it and it’s slightly off the tourist trap so it’s also affordable', "We read all the great reviews and therefore came to this place with high expectations. Sadly, we left believing we were totally misled.

The pizza was tasteless, with poor quality, and definitely not authentic. Actually, one of the worst we've ever had.

The place seems to be popular among teenagers and young students, which might explain the reviews..."]

Name: Ergün's Fischbude
Summary: Simple, laid-back tavern for Turkish & Mediterranean dishes with a focus on fish & seafood.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:30 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 3:30 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 3:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 3:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 3:30 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 3:30 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 3:30 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['We were waiting over 1 hour and 15 minutes for our order. Two tables got their food and were already finished when we were still waiting. Waiters just told some rumours that apparently the grill is not working properly. But comes the others got their grilled fish?

If you pay, please ask to break down the costs. There are no receipts and cash only (you know why ;) )', "Nice and hearty Turkish restaurant in Berlin. One of the really few ones offering fresh fish. I also recommend to try their salad!
I had a few dinners there and I suggest to book in advance, especially on weekends as it can get quite crowded.
Overall it's a very nice fish place, with a real Turkish vibe!", 'Very authentic fish tavern!

The place is a long time family business. It’s more a tavern than a restaurant though.

The food (seafood) is very good. Taste fresh and homemade. We took a salad for 2, kalamaris, red fish and fries. That was enough for 2 persons. We paid 22€ each with drinks.

The place is full of pictures from visitors, famous people and old memories. It’s actually very nice. Don’t expect something fancy, this place is nice and genuine but it is not a 4 stars restaurant.

Is worth it doe the food quality.']

Name: Milchhäuschen
Summary: Coffee, ice cream sundaes & German classics in a 1970s retro place with a terrace on a lake.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ["Very beautiful 😍 location on the historical Berlin lake ' Weißensee '. With warm food, salads, Softdrinks, cake and ice cream 🍨.\nThe Terrace is open from eastern to october. Inside it's open also in winter.\nYou order food upstairs, inside on the desk. The service people bring it to the table and later you pay it upstairs.", 'A nice and cozy place in a beautiful location. The food was delicious.', 'Staring at the bottom of my radler (beer-lemonade) I must say the atmosphere is very local, very much Pankow district, and it is enjoyable. I have eaten here in the past and it is tasty, without pomp or pretense, much how I personally like things to be.']

Name: Parkstern
Summary: Creative Mediterranean-inspired meat, fish & vegetarian dishes with Rhine Valley wines on a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['The good reviews that you see here are from the old owner: the kitchen and the service back then were phenomenal (most of the pictures older than 1 year). Unfortunately, a new team took over, - allegedly Italians! But last time I checked, Italians did not speak Arabic ;) - and service and kitchen are far worse. It would have been honest from the new owners to at least change name.
I am yet to try to go there
for just a drink , which should still be ok.', 'Food is not like in the pictures. We ordered schnitzel and instead got chicken. Food quality was very bad overall. The waiter said that credit cards didn't work despite having the terminal right there, and when we tried to pay in cash, he asked for 6 euros more than what whas written on the screen. When we refused, he insisted, and also refused to give back my change, taking 1 euro "tip". Avoid at all costs', 'Good service and nice, clean interiors. We decided to go here for a quick and simple bite and a beer.
Huge advantage for tourists is a possibility to pay with credit card, where in most places in East Berlin you can only pay with cash.']

Name: Restaurant Herr Rossi
Summary: Traditional Italian specialties presented in a mellow setting with a warm, intimate vibe.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Despite not having a reservation, my friends and I impulsively decided to go on a Friday night, but we were thankfully accommodated with seats! The staff were very kind and attentive. The atmosphere was serene, and it seemed like a popular spot for the couples. The food was very tasty, especially the fish which we particularly enjoyed. The accompanying vegetables were also great. Highly recommended restaurant!', 'Here Rossi holds a special place in my heart. It’s my go to, my local, great food amazing staff, it’s a perfect restaurant. The wine list is curated locally and hand selected so pretty much every single bottle you could order is delicious. The staff is top notch! Truly a wonderful restaurant….You should stop reading this review and go to Herr Rossi', "Evolution or consistency? The restaurant conundrum. You get famous and busy, and people keep coming. This place chose consistency. They've been here since Bowie, and not much has changed. The food is still professionally prepared, but Italian in principle, rather than origin. I doubt anyone leaves here disappointed. The prices are fair and the place has the vibe of the place spies go to blend in and trade secrets."]

Name: KAFFE
Summary: Cozy setting with armchairs & outdoor tables, offering coffee, snack plates & sweets.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews: ['Simple but tasty food with great coffee shop atmosphere and friendly staff. This place is cosy and relaxing. Definitely recommend!', 'Had a great salad here. Decaf latte, good service!! 1h time limit on working with a computer, which should be a thing everywhere', 'A cozy breakfast spot, the staff is lovely and I definitely recommend the freshly made orange juice ❤️.']

Name: Chandni
Summary: Homestyle Indian meals served in a warm, high-ceilinged space with outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['this place not only is cheap and delicious, is also quite big and really clean. we ordered vegetarian options ( they also have some vegan options) and honestly they were so good. he drinks are also completely accessible. if you are around and craving some Indian food, I really recommend this place.', 'We had a lovely dinner at Chandni Restaurant recently and were very pleased with the overall experience. We ordered the Mix Pakoras, Dosa, and a Veg Thali. The staff was very accommodating—they happily accepted our request to make a plain dosa with the masala served separately and to swap the rice on the thali for Bhatura.

All the dishes were delicious, with authentic flavors and well-balanced spices. The portion sizes were generous, especially considering the price, which we really appreciated.

The only suggestion I have is to improve the Sambhar that came with the dosa, as I found it a bit bland. Otherwise, everything was great, and we would definitely recommend Chandni Restaurant to anyone looking for authentic Indian cuisine.', 'It’s located in a very nice neighborhood, the service was fast and nice. Only downside was the grill plate, the meat selection wasn’t the best. The other dish we got was pretty good.']

Name: Restaurant Merhaba
Summary: Turkish meze & baked dishes, plus meat grills with rice, in a cozy eatery with exposed brick walls.
Address: Haus der Demokratie, Greifswalder Straße 4, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Hidden gem in Berlin 💯
A very cozy and warm place with very very nice and friendly people 🤍
Also the food is out of this world 🫠🤍', '- Very delicious food.
- The stuffed eggplant, was exquisite!
- very cosy and enjoyable atmosphere.
- great service.
- clean.
- We were served by a very polite and friendly lady. She made sure we had everything at best.
- definitely going back there.', 'Very cozy and friendly. Tasty food!']

Name: Joseph-Roth-Diele
Summary: Classic schnitzel, dumplings & potato salad in an ornate, wood-lined venue with piano music.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Very good service and nice vibe, but the food is not that great. I had a Herring Sandwich and it was quite average. My wife had a schnitzel and it was too dry. Beer and cheesecake were great though.', "We had a brilliant dinner at the restaurant. The service from the waiters and bar staff was outstanding, the traditional German food was delicious and the restaurant's location and atmosphere is fantastic. Highly recommended and we will definitely visit again next time we are in Berlin!", 'You have to book to be sure of a table. it must be the "lonely planet write-up" effect. The decor is fascinating and the staff are very accommodating but sadly the food was OK but not up to the vibe that was promised. When we couldn\'t get a table the first night, we chanced on a place a little further down the road that had amazing food - Oh Panama!!!']

Name: Kin Dee
Summary: Modern takes on classic Thai curries & noodle dishes, plus tropical cocktails, in a stylish space.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['A pleasant surprised for us to walk-in & able to find a nice table next to window (my favorite type of seating). It’s a three-courses meal. We enjoyed this boutique style of dining and specialty dishes. This style really elevated the Thai cuisine to the next level  — not only it was delicious but also skillful decorated & coordinated. The staff was knowledgeable & explaining the concept of chef & owners ideas.
The food was very delicious with some nice twists & gave it an upscale feel. Super friendly staff
& helpful with details of dishes. For us, it’s definitely worth a try & recommend for others to try out new ways / innovative of food. Happy dining !
Life is good 😊', 'A Micheline starred restaurant serving a set menu of thai food. The food was delicious and the staff was very attentive. A wholesome experience very much recommended!', 'I was really looking forward to experiencing this restaurant and while I feel like they are trying it we can’t ignore that it does have a Michelin star and I don’t feel that it’s currently at the level it needs to be.

The staff training and attention to detail is simply not there.

The food, while I enjoyed it, was very much overpriced and there are in my opinion better Thai options in Berlin right now in a lower price range.

I do however very much appreciate their ethos, and that they source local, sustainable and ethical ingredients.

I will try it again in a year or so when they have hopefully worked out their teething problems.']

Name: OH, PANAMA
Summary: Wine pairings & creative takes on regional dishes at a stylish venue with courtyard seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['The overall note would be between 3 and 4  because after having tried many Michelin-list restaurants "Oh Panama" doesnt feel like a 5 in terms of the variety and "explosion" of tastes, and the interior. The 4 courses dinner was nice but too pricey vs the relative simplicity of the meals on my opinion. The service was nice even though the staff was changing 4 times during the service which was a bit confusing. The atmosphere is nice but not more than this, it didn\'t feel as an exceptional design effort as it could be the case in some other places with a similar price for example. The food itself was good actually, but not at the level where I\'d expect it to be for a similar price. It\'s German cuisine and not knowing it that much, I\'d say it didn\'t leave any special memory compared to similar experiences with French or Japanese ones for a similar price.\nGenerally speaking, I\'d say it\'s a very nice place but too expensive (overpriced) versus it\'s taste experience.', 'We had a three course menu that was absolutely delicious. Clean and fresh flavors that were well balanced in a relaxed atmosphere added to the relaxed vibe. This is a place that does not compromise quality of food and executes it with the perfect balance.', 'Excellent food and great patio vibe. Also the wine pairing was top notch. Highly recommend!']

Name: Ristorante Centro Sud
Summary: Mellow fixture with outdoor seating offering Italian staples such as pizza & pasta.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Tonight, me and my family went to this restaurant to enjoy some food, or we thought we would.
Among other dishes, we ordered a pizza. At first the owner served what is best described as a pizza totally destroyed. It was in several pieces and we weren’t able to take a slice of pizza without it going into many small pieces.
