It looked mostly like it had maybe been dropped from the oven to the floor, and that the owner tried to see if we would notice. We told the owner this, without saying anything, he took the pizza and went away. About 10 minutes after, he serves a half cooked pizza. It was wet, and it clearly hadn’t had enough time in the oven. The crust was not baked and the cheese wasn’t melted.
We ate a little, and a family member tasted it. We all agreed that it wasn’t cooked properly.
I went to talk to the owner and let him know that i didn’t think that it would be fair to make us pay for the pizza that they had ruined twice.
The owner wasn’t responsive to this, and said that there wasn’t anything wrong with the pizza, and that he could cook it again, making this his third attempt in making a pizza, which i wasn’t interested in. I continued to try to make the owner understand that it wasn’t okay to make us pay for a pizza that he had ruined twice.
The owner got very mad ans started raising his voice and said that he out of kindness hadn’t charged us a fee, that he usually uses.
This fee is made up by the owner himself and something that he forgets to tell his customers about. It is a fee of 1.50 euro pr. guest, in which he among other things charges for:
- That there is olive oil and balsamic on the table
- That there is extra parmesan (which there wasn’t on the table)
- Bread (that we also didn’t get)
- Napkins
- And the fact that he played music in the restaurant
- Included was also, that he has a garden
At last he then deletes the pizza, and instead adds the fee of 1.5 euro pr person (9 euro in total) which in the end is the same amount as the pizza on the bill.
All in all it was a very, very bad experience, the food was bad, the service was also bad. The owner was hostile. I can most certainly not recommend anyone going to this restaurant.', "Family run restaurant, with very delicious dishes and a nice ambiance. You really need to sit on the very green terrace in the backyard, perfect for summer days. Prices are higher than the average for the area but it's worth it for special occasions.", 'Very nice and quiet place, great food and nice staff!']

Name: Parker Bowles
Summary: Pop-up kitchens for pizza, burgers, tacos & pan-Asian bites in a gray-toned, industrial-chic space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['been there a lot of times already and honestly at this point it’s like an addiction. the food there is amazing, i’ve had a lot of different dishes there and my all time favorites are the Kahuna Bowl with extra Chicken, the Chicken Katsu Buns, the lunch Sashimi Moriawase, the Chicken Katsu, the Jack Daniels BBQ Deluxe Burger, the Gyu Don and the NewYork NewYork Pizza!! With the amount of options on the menu and the 5 different kitchens there is no other choice but to come multiple times to try some of everything and you sure won’t regret it. Plus the staff is really nice and welcoming! Also drinks wise I recommend one of their homemade lemonades to go along your lunch. There’s also a café included in the restaurant which sells amazing cookies and some really good apple crumble cake so definitely don’t miss out on that either! Will definitely come again🫶🫶', "Food is ok, coffee too. But after spending 17 euros on food and drinks they refuse to give you a glass of water even in +25 degrees.  Apparently that's the official policy, the waiters say. Unacceptable way to treat your customers in the service industry.", 'Awesome place for lunch. The smash burger is great. And the service outstanding!!']

Name: Taverna Hellas Wedding
Summary: Ancient Greece-themed venue with pillars & statues, for typical Greek grilled meats & baked dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["I stumbled upon this while looking for a good Greek restaurant.  so I drove to wedding from Berlin-Mitte.  The location is wonderfully kitschy as you would imagine.  I like that. Unfortunately, the food wasn't really special, just average.  The prices were pretty high, especially since the location is outside the ring.  Service was good.  In the end, the experience wasn't good enough to revisit.", 'Great food with vegetables and tasty rice in addition to meat. Plus they are super friendly and have lots of neighborhood history on the walls.', '10 out of 10 stars for this perfect nice clean restaurant. The food was delicious  even better that the one I tried in Greece.']

Name: Stranero
Summary: Hip contemporary pizzeria with classic, vegan & vegetarian options, also available for takeout.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Great place, it was open until later. You can order on their website using the QR code on the table. The orders are provided very fast. The food was amazing, great neopolitan pizzas. The server was really nice and so was the rest of the staff. They took some time out of their closing schedule and helped us find a brewery we wanted to visit. Great experience.

Ps. Please be advised that you can only pay in cash

At least this was the status on 12.01.2024', "I've found out about Stranero back in 2019 from an Italian colleague of mine. Since then, I have been sure many people say that Stranero holds a crown of all Berlin's pizza places.
The taste, the quality, the atmosphere, and the staff friendliness are only the beginning of the long list of pros of this place.
The pizza is fresh, oven-baked, and made with high-quality ingredients. Must visit!", 'Great pizza in Wedding.
Prices are okay.
Staff is nice.
Just wish I could pay with card like it s 2024 :)

Only thing is it s quite loud inside.
But still, nice place.']

Name: Schäfer - Café Bar Restaurant
Summary: Unassuming restaurant offering German & Mediterranean dishes for breakfast, lunch & dinner.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 1:00 AM
Reviews:
['We went there for burger sonntag today (burger with fries/country potato for 5.90 euro as of today). It was really good and of plenty amount. The veggie burger was made with very fresh produce and grilled tofu.

Before today we went there for lunch twice. Each time the food quality and quantity was more than what you expect for the amount you pay.

Not only that the restaurant owner and Staffs are really nice and friendly.

Deserves more than 5 stars. We found a local gem. Would come back again soon.', 'Very nice place to chill have eat some german kitchen !
the only thing i didnt like i got eiscafé in plastik glas ! it s no go for me . i m in Restaurant to eat and drink not with Plastik Glass !!!
The food of the taste was ok ! i ate Jägerschnitzel , it was reall salty for me but taste ok !
also it says on menu salt potatoes but it just came bolied potatoes! ( salz kartoffeln are like fried a bit in the pan normally!!', 'I was here for brunch on a Sunday. There was a decent selection of food for a very reasonable price - approx. 8 euro including coffee or tea. However, the quality and freshness of the food was very bad. It seemed that the food was lying around for quite a while - dry cheese and ham. The warm food smelled funny and not fresh at all. The bread was quite dry as well. One star for the friendly staff...']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 1:30 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 1:30 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['Even if the staff was nice, the Royal cheese Hamburger was dry and I’m talking not only about meet but the bun was crispy and it shouldn’t. On top of that we were told that they don’t sell some of burgers that are in the standard McDonald’s menus, for example filet-o-fish and even if the position that you want is in “their” menu you can’t be sure if it’s available. Do not recommend that restaurant. :(', 'It seems dangerous to go into 3 star mcdonalds, but in Berlin its average. Heighest rating mcdonald is 4 stars in Berlin so we werent that much afraid of this franchize. They dont take Mcdonalds points from phone app and also the sortiment is smaller then in bigger Mc restaurants I got it. For me it was average visit of any other Mcdonalds restaurant in Europe. Stuff was very friendly and free to help. Burgers were just a classic burgers, havent seen something strange.\nYeah we liked it', 'It’s disgusting there were roaches running around :(']

Name: Munch's Hus
Summary: Mellow setup for modern Norwegian cuisine focusing on fish, plus craft beer & European wines.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Excellence in food - especially quality - some improvement potential in service.

Munch's Hus is great and absolutely worth a visit from a food perspective. The fish plate starters were already all out of excellent quality and taste, same level continued thru main dishes. We tried both a fish and a duck dish as main, all well made. Food has a very recognisable Scandinavian touch, if you like such food, you will absolutely love it here.

Drinks menu also decent, some good wines on the menu and happy to see a few Norwegian craft beers as well.

On the service side there is potential to improve. It was a bit on the slow side as it took over an hour to get our main course. Also there were small things surprising such as no Norwegian menu available, they insisted on German although I spoke English with their waiter... Nothing major, but a bit funny! :)

So, despite not entirely happy with the service, I have to objectively give it a 4.5 which rounds to a 5 here. They got the feeling for the food and the Norwegian tradition, which is the most valuable asset for a restaurant. Will for sure return and try a few other dishes.", 'The restaurant is authentic and has a good variety of Norwegian dishes. Also the service was very attentive and quick. However, in my opinion my fish dish wasn’t that fresh; it had rather a strong taste and smell, also the texture had suffered a bit already. Considering the high prices of this place, more freshness was definitely expected.', "What can I say,the elk was outstanding the meat was tasty and almost melted in my mouth it was so tender 😋😋 notice the Chef talent there,is not easy to cook that kind of dish,the dessert a A+👍👍😋😋 Tilslørte bondepiker highly recommended and the atmosphere was awesome very kind and professional felt like home, I'll be back when I come back to Berlin.
Came back after a year and had two main dishes and now I love it even more 💖💖 😋😋😋👍😋buonissimo"]

Name: Ice cream parlor at Gleisdreieck
Summary: Fruit-flavored sorbets, plus classic & creative ice creams, in an old-fashioned shop.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM
Reviews: ["Nice little ice cream parlor, unfortunately a bit out of the way, but quiet and clean\nThe selection isn't big, but it's tasty.\nVery friendly service, would happily go again.", 'Delicious ice cream. Pistachio with pistachio glazur is a must try.', 'Great ice cream with varying exciting flavours like orange-basil, very friendly personnel - totally recommend!']

Name: Sofram
Summary: Kebabs & other familiar Turkish plates turned out in a casual setup with tables & banquettes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Very tasty chicken kebabs and meatballs. Beautiful looking bread but we’re on Keto! 😫 Lovely black tea to finish.', 'A very traditional place where you can find: healty products, smiling people and affordable prices. Not so often the picture on the menu represents what you will have, well, not in this case! I saw a nice picture of a Hallumi salat and what came to me was exactly the same. Check my pic and compare with the one on the menu. Waiters were very kind and always keep an eye on me if I need something. Kitchen is open (you can see the grill) and the offered me a nice tea at the end of the dinner. I will definitely come back here.', 'Must say the food is very delicious, service is nice and fast.
The only downside is that you can pay only with cash.
But overall very good experience.
Highly recommended.']

Name: Gaststätte Berliner Wappen
Summary: Down-to-earth tavern serving up big portions of schnitzel, steak & matjes herring, plus draft beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['As a foreigner who can’t speak German, I always feel so nervous to order food. But this place has good vibe, a lady offered me English menu. The food is delicious, taste like home made. With the cozy sunshine, I believe you will have a good time here!', 'Salt of the earth , true to its taste, all the dishes are amazing here. Particularly the peach with steak which I didn’t know was a killer combination . And the Salmon with Asparagus.With great Sparkling Wine options of-course. Kindly choose anything with pork.\n\nEven though I couldn’t speak much Deustch, everyone was trying to help and figure out me and my friends order.', 'Traveled here for the weekend with some friends - this is some of the best German food I’ve ever eaten. Fair prices and friendly owner.']

Name: Milch & Zucker
Summary: Breakfast bowls, coffee & cake plus salads & lunch dishes, in an industrial-chic space with art.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Tuesday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Wednesday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Thursday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Friday: 7:30 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Reviews: ['My friends and I came here two days in a row in our visit of Berlin. The food and coffee is just superb. It is great value for money and a very chilled out spot.\nThere are loads of options for food such as cakes and treats as well as cooked breakfast. I had the American breakfast which was amazing. I have attached a photo but it was just nuts to get eggs and bacon as well as a hefty portion of tasty pancakes. The staff were nice too so I do recommend this breakfast spot.', 'Very tasty and well priced! We paid less for a breakfast for two than at the hostel. And they accept credit card payment.', 'We were walking by Kreuzberg and found this place. We had the most delicious cheesecake here. I was surprised by how tasty it was. The coffee was also nice but it was definitely the cheesecake that stole my heart.']

Name: Misfit Bar Berlin
Summary: Beer, cocktails & snacks in a cool, vibrant rock bar featuring a shaded beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Great music, kind staff, nice place to have more than a few beers.

Tips: A place where “rock” attitude really rocks aka kindness, clean place, really nice music (I was amazed listening to Tool  ). Smoking inside is allowed-only cash.
Definitely should visit.', 'I went for the beer and stayed for the music... I went back again for the great atmosphere.', 'Nice quiet hideaway for Punk Rock drinkers. Very friendly staff, good selection']

Name: Pret A Manger Berlin Sony Center
Summary: Counter-serve chain for ready-made sandwiches plus breakfast, coffee, soups & salads.
Address: Sony Center,Neue Posdamer Stresse, Potsdamer Straße 2, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews: ['Great service and very nice atmosphere. The upstairs area is quiet, you can work and have a productive work session there.', 'Probably it has just opened so there is room for improvements. Sandwiches are only sold as cold as ice, so they seem quite tasteless. But expensive. Lot of space upstairs and comfortable seats but still not cosy. Freezing and quite deserted on Sunday afternoon, so at least ia calm hahaha', 'Eega is the best one to make a cof']

Name: Dunkin' Donuts
Summary: Long-running chain serving signature breakfast items & a variety of coffee drinks.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['First time the Boston cream disappoints... First I noticed the lighter yellow color which is maybe normal but the taste was not yummy as it used to, I did not feel at all the vanilla...', "Be aware not to get scammed there by the cashier!!

I bought one bottle of water and one Cola, the cashier charged me 7.5€ cash, didn't even type it in the system or give a receipt.. I told her that it's sounds strange and too expensive while she said thats the price..

I passed there another time when someone else was on shift, out of curiosity - purchased something again, the other cashier typed that into the system, the price became much lower!!

Be aware with some ppl that work there and take advantage on you.", 'Tremendously rude woman at the front desk. Literally texting and not bothering to look up from her phone. I tried to give benefit of the doubt maybe it is was a language barrier I asked in German if she spoke English and she said “yea a little” and kept in her phone:..']

Name: PapalaCup
Summary: Relaxed choice with a retro ambiance serving comfort brunch classics, plus sandwiches & schnitzels.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
['First time trying this place, very positive impressed! We liked everything: good quality food, cozy atmosphere, very prompt and friendly staff. Totally recommend it and would definitely come back!
Thank you! And keep up the good work!', 'Loved breakfast here. Great service as well as good food. I would definitely come back again.', 'Literally cannot fault this place. Service was above and beyond, breakfast was amazing, and the cheesecake truly rivalled a NYC NY cheesecake.

Pablo was also a treat❤️🐶']

Name: De Noantri
Summary: Italian mains & a wide pizza selection with vegetarian options, served in a contemporary space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 5:30 – 9:30 PM
Reviews: ['Pretty good. I had the eggplant parmigiana which was great and the fennel salad (ok). My partner had the carbonara which was good and a generous serve. Panacotta desert good. Friendly service, good place to watch the EURO football games.', "Pizza was so good! We sat on the terrace which was really nice, service was fast and very helpful. Definitely going again. Need reservations on the weekend it's very packed.", 'We are big fans of your restaurant for a couple of years now – when you were still at Görli we came almost weekly. You have really nice pizza and atmosphere. But please do not deliver panacotta like this. For example, there was a smaller container for the bread – why not use that one? We were quite disappointed with how our desert arrived here.']

Name: Il Sogno
Summary: Intimate Italian restaurant offering sidewalk seating, plus pasta, fish, burgers, wraps & noodles.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Reviews: ['At the first sight, I found the restaurant concept especially the menu a bit strange since they serve Italian, Mexican and Indian dishes on the same menu. However, once we tried this place, we loved the food and the friendly service of the people who work here. Everything on their menu is fresh and tasty. I’d highly recommend to give this place a try. Also very good prices.', 'The food is very fresh, tastes like your grandmother would make it and the prices are very good! Would highly recommend stopping by for a homey lunch 🍛 and or dessert!', 'An Italian bistrot run by indians:) Comfy place, a lot of choice of sweet and salty, and teas and juices and sandwiches(you‘ll find pesto in every option.. as said is not a „real“ italian..) still good,but in my opinion, a little overpriced for the area. Pastries are unfortunately not homemade. Veggie/vegan options made the difference.']

Name: Hindi
Summary: Spicy meat & veg curries, plus grills & rice dishes in a chic venue with exposed brick walls.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 11:30 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Server was super nice. You get a free chip thing and sauces which I love. Food was good although I’ve had better. I wish there was a bit more chicken in the chicken korma. Street is quiet and they have plenty of outdoor seating. Would definitely go back!', "This restaurant is amazing! Great prices for amazing food! When I came to them, it turned out that they serve lunch of the day and it's 7.50-7.90 for a full meal with soup. I was scared about the high prices in Berlin, but it's not true. I got a great, delicious soup, main meat dish, delicious, tender chicken, basmati rice and naan. After 8 hours without food, I was immensely happy. By the way, if I'm not mistaken, all the neighborhood restaurants offer a more expensive lunch. Thank you so much for that lunch!", 'Really good food at an amazing price.

Good quality Indian curry served in nice surroundings. The menu has lots of options for those wanting meat, fish or vegetables.

They sell cocktails, milkshakes and have beer on draught.

We had four main courses with rice,  naan bread and dessert... And a few beers. And we spent less than 100€. We all left feeling full.

There is plenty of parking across the street.']

Name: Masha's Bagels & Delicatessen
Summary: Down-to-earth counter-serve with sidewalk seats doling out NYC-style bagels & sandwiches.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 PM
Reviews:
["Lovely place with great bagels (tracing their history from the NYC, as I've found out) and service. The lads got a kitchen that's working up to 3 PM, but they went above and beyond to get a bagel to a hungry man (me) and got me a New York Classic (which was very nice). Apart from Classic, my top 1 choice would be reuben-style sandwich. Coffee is great too, water refills are available, overall - can recommend.", 'The bagels are quite stuffed and filling! I had the breakfast bagel with extra bacon and avocado — mine was delicious. My boyfriend had the chipotle Turkey bagel and although it was packed with Turkey (yay) it was incredibly (!) bland. Nothing chipotle about this chipotle bagel. We would name it plain Turkey bagel 😂', "Have been thinking for quite a while that there was a serious lack of bagel places in Berlin that were worth going to, and man does this place really fill that void.

The iced coffee was smooth and velvety and the Reuben Sandwich was bomb. Seriously I've been dreaming about the sandwich since I ate it. The bagels have great crunch/chew as well.

10/10 will be back"]

Name: BURGER KING Deutschland GmbH
Summary: Well-known fast-food chain serving grilled burgers, fries & shakes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Reviews:
['Thought I get quick bite,order,pay and eat.This is  where the problem started,they have only machines to order I very don’t like it.It takes more time than ordering face to face.Lucky me one of the staff took my order and typed in the machine.2nd point I didn’t like,they have only paper straws with your coke,disgusting feeling in your mouth and as longer you wait drinking the coke changes the taste.Food was good and staff very friendly', "French fries came with something burn. No icecubes available according to the lady in the counter. Other person got ice though... I don't understand. Fanta left a straight on the glass which I can't understand either... all looks and tastes weird", "It's -7 outside and inside it's close to zero Celsius too. There's no heating! Even the employee at the service desk was like yeah it's pretty cold.
We tried to enjoy a quick dinner but it's literally freezing.
And also not for the first time, it's like this for long but with the extreme cold it's just unbearable.
People are sitting in with winter jackets on.
It's even cold for Germans, just imagine haha."]

Name: MarienBurgerie
Summary: Easygoing, colorful counter-serve with full-sized & mini hamburgers, including vegetarian versions.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Best burger for good proce in berlin super fast service 3 min for 2 burgers and fries', 'Delicious burgers for either lunch or dinner. This place seems really popular with the local work crowd for lunch time. So it may be difficult to get a seat (only a few benches to sit at). So you may want to consider getting take away. The staff are really friendly and nice. And the burgers are huge! Got two or the house special burger, two drinks and some chips for just under €20.', 'A small delightful place for you #burger lovers. There are many flavors and this a a very popular place. I love their burgers and its hidden gem are its potato wedges. Its yummy and crispy. They also have tasty baby burgers for kids. You can also sit outside and eat and enjoy the prenzlauerberg view.  Try these when you are around. #berlin #tasty']

Name: Café Anna Blume
Summary: Cafe-restaurant, connected to florist, with marble-topped tables, homemade cakes & terrace seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Friday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 8:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Reviews: ['Was recommended to try this cafe & not disappointed. Had the Irish coffee & home made strawberry cake. Very reasonably priced but the best bit was the waitress who despite being busy didn’t stop smiling. Well worth a visit', '€14 for a soft-boiled egg on a slice of bread. Are you kidding me? The lentil soup is supposed to come with bread and butter, but they don’t bring the butter. I have to go and ask for it, and the waitress says, "But there’s no butter." I show her the menu, and she looks at it in surprise. To be fair, the food is good, but the service is incredibly slow (after 35 minutes of waiting to order the desserts, we decided to leave), and the prices are outrageous.', 'Service in Germany gets low stars because of the style. It’s not attentive but they are nice and the cake and coffee is great. Gorgeous outside seating']

Name: Bangkok Treffpunkt
Summary: Calm Thai eatery in a bright, cheerful space featuring traditional curries & stir-fries, plus wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Me and my husband always love visiting this restaurant. Perfect ambience, loved the food, and specially the service is awesome.

The owner (both husband and wife) are very friendly and treat you as a family. Very good atmosphere.

Tried many dishes, and loved everything.

From drinks, juices to starters to main course to dessert everything is perfect.

Recommend to try any coconut curry with Crispy chicken, it is amazing.', 'Very average food as well as sub pair ambience. Nice staff but I won’t go back. Better Thai (not sure this is even Thai) in town. The aquarium is… so bad taste to me.', '3.5 stars would be fair. A decent Thai eatery with a pleasant interior and nice staff. I wouldn’t recommend the hot and sour soup, as it was neither sour nor hot but rather sweet actually. The curry dishes are good here, although the spice level is extremely mild. I’ve had their spiciest dish and had to add half a container of chili sauce just to feel some heat. The prices are rather low but the portions are actually quite small.']

Name: No Fire No Glory
Summary: Buzzy cafe using freshly roasted beans & organic milk with wood-topped tables & hanging lamps.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing place in a really nice neighborhood!
Enjoyed our breakfast here a lot, definitely recommend pancakes and BBQ pulled beef Benedict. I think best in the neighborhood so far.
Coffee is very tasty as well. Finally a place that serves cold brew tonic 😍', 'Amazing cafe in Prenzlauer Berg Berlin. I stop in several times a week for breakfast and the most amazing cappuccinos. Gets very busy during the weekends and on public holidays, so reservations are recommended. The staff is very friendly. Please be mindful that food and drinks are made to order so you can’t be in a hurry to eat and run. This is such a great neighborhood cafe and truly worth a stop if in the area!', "It's a great place to relax in peace and quiet.
I wouldn't recommend the coffee, though.
When I order a cappuccino, I always want to get a smooth, rich foam, but the foam was grainy, shallow, and unskilled, and the iced coffee tasted like water, not cold.
And while I don't mind a few chipped plates,
I wish they would take better care of any broken coffee or drink cups that come in contact with my mouth."]

Name: Osteria Tressanti
Summary: Homemade pasta, carpaccio, tiramisu & Italian wines offered in a bright, contemporary space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['It was delicious! Had an amazing first course with polpo on a cream of chickpeas *yammy* and Parmigiana di Melanzane as main dish. If they serve the pasta with truffle, you have to take it. Unfortunately we did not keep track of the time and as we had a date in the planetarium, we had to leave before enjoying the main course. Just hmmmm ', 'lovely and authentic Italian place! Food was amazing, you have to get truffle pasta and tiramisu! Also they served gluten-free pasta, big big plus 🙏🏼
We had white wine and aperitifs, also very tasty. a lot of Italian guests which speaks for itself, true Italian place 😍
My friend had her birthday and she got a tiramisu as a gift, so kind!
Thanks for the great experience :)', 'A cute place, very nice relaxed atmosphere with a detailed wine list with many natural wine varieties.

Pictured is the vegetarian Truffle Carbonara, Puttanesca, and Tiramisu. Everything was delicious. A very good tiramisu as well, maybe the best I’ve tried in Berlin.

I recommend a reservation as the restaurant gets pretty busy at dinner time.']

Name: Korean Food Stories - Restaurant
Summary: Creative takes on homestyle Korean rice bowls & BBQ grills, in a compact, minimalist space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 4:00 PM, 6:30 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['As an Asian, I have never had a bulgogi like this. Also, they didn’t add sesame oil in the bowl, which is very basic ingredient of Korean bowl. It was purely spicy and sour. This maybe a fake Korean restaurant.', 'Quite honestly I never was a big fan of Korean food, but this little restaurant in my neighborhood totally changed my opinion :). Really fresh food, delicious taste and very reasonable prices. There are some tables inside and outside as well. Very clean, friendly staff, English speaking and quick food preparation. Recommended for a light healthy meal. Vegan options as well, take away, pay cash. Will go again!', 'Amazing place. Not only is the food tasty and filling, it also super healthy! You can tell it’s a family business for how they take care of their customers. I have been visiting them over the years and this place never disappoints. Thanks!']

Name: BRYK BAR
Summary: Creative cocktails & housemade gin at a sleek contemporary bar with a fireplace & a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Amazing cocktails! We were served by a very sweet and polite bartender.\nNone of us thought we would ever enjoy popcorn with dill, but to our surprise it was actually nice! Definitely going to come back.', 'Cocktails are very good but service incredibly bad. The girl serving us last Friday night were really unfriendly in all ways possible. She made us wait when we came in, what I can understand but the way she talked and treated us was really rude. When we ordered the bill, we were the only table inside and she started to clean up and do 1.000 other things making us wait until she decided to bring the bill. I suggest to spend your money in other places where at least they have friendly staff but not here.', "one of my favourite cocktail bars in pberg. Famous for their smoked gin and tonics, the rest of their mixologists' creations are also really fantastic. In winter there is a lit fireplace that makes the place super cosy for a date or a girls' night out."]

Name: ABC - Allans Breakfast Club & Wine Bar
Summary: Popular brunches with eggs, bagels & craft coffee, plus German wines, at a trendy modern cafe/bar.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 9:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Thursday: 9:30 AM – 3:00 PM, Friday: 9:30 AM – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:30 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
["Lovely place and service. For a brunch it's the price, could be a bit bigger the portion, but overall it's good. By card it's only one payment, which means one person needs to pay for the whole table. This is annoying as later you need to pay for others and so...", 'I’ve likely found my favourite brunch place in Berlin. The food is exquisite, I was frankly, quite blown away by the ABC Tasting Plate.

Service, on the other hand, can be quite slow but I think that’s very common for brunch places anywhere in Berlin, especially on a weekend.

Make a reservation or go early!', "ABC had been on my brunch list for quite a while. The food was good but didn't exceed my expectations. The staff was friendly, though service was a bit slow, and unfortunately, they had run out of orange juice and other juice options that day. The shakshuka was a bit too spicy, which wasn't mentioned on the menu."]

Name: Cafe Neue Liebe
Summary: Waffles & croissants, plus vegan & vegetarian global fare, at a hip cafe with al-fresco seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
["The best vegan breakfast in Berlin!

I came back here for the waffles, but the breakfast dips platter pleasantly surprised me! It comes with a bread basket as well. Honestly I didn't expect to like the croissant as much as I did, would definitely recommend the croissants here!", 'After more than one week in Germany I FINALLY tried a franzbrötchen there (vegan of course), I took their cinnamon-apple one which was absolutely marvelous. I would definitely recommend it :)', 'It’s really pretty. The whipped cream as sensational, amazing, flawless, but the waffle was okay. The olive dip is also super good. The chai was really watery and a bit tasteless. The cappuccino doesn’t even resembles a real cappuccino, unfortunately.
The vibe is good, it’s a good place to go and chat with friends but overall I wouldn’t come back.']

Name: Mitho Cha! P-Berg
Summary: Quaint, country-style restaurant with housemade Nepalese & Tibetan cuisine, plus a take-out option.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Pretty good restaurant for Nepalese cuisine. The dumplings were just OK, the Paneer Chilli was delicious and the vegetarian noodles were quite good. The service is quite friendly and the portions were decently large. Reservations are recommended since the tables are usually booked out.', "Delicious food, especially the coconut chicken & alu poda. We originally came here for the Nepali momos – they were decent in taste but felt too floury.

The service was exceptional, our waiter made sure we had everything in time.

The vibe both indoor & outdoor is great. It's also ideal for bigger groups.

And yes, their mango lassi was delicious too. I also loved the thalis they used to serve the food.", "One of the best restaurants I've visited in Berlin. Not only they have super nice customer service but also the food is so good, you will want to try the whole menu. I suggest making a reservation before arriving and try to be here at 18:00 if you don't want to be around a lot of people, after 20:00 this place is full of people.

I ordered so many things, because i was in love with their concept, i had my dinner like they normally do, floor sitting. An impressive experience. The MoMos were the Best."]

Name: Masel Topf
Summary: Creative takes on Israeli meze plates & grills at an elegant spot with a terrace on a leafy street.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Reviews: ['This was certainly one of the culinary highlights of our trip to Berlin. Cosy terrace, lovely vintage interior and then the food…we just loved it! We had ladke mit lachs as a starter and then the famous Jeruzalem teller. Huge portions and excellent price/quality rate. Strongly recommended!', 'Wonderful breakfast at this cute lil place near the Wasserturm. Super-friendly service & delicious house-cured salmon.', 'Tender lamb, juicy fish, tasty humus! Nice place in the very heart of Prenzlauer Berg! Prices are quite high, but the meal worth it!']

Name: Café do Brasil
Summary: Brazilian cuisine & cocktails offered in an easygoing establishment with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['such a nice and chill atmosphere with good music! the coxinhas were really good as well as the guava juice. I also tried a risole de camarão which had a rich flavour too. Definetly recommend coming here!', 'Lovely small restaurant with good food and great service. The Moqueca was delicious. Nice people, live music and joyful Brazilians … Harun was particularly helpful as I arrived without a reservation and got the best seat in the house. Special farewell to Berlin on my part.', "On Google it is shown as opened but then you arrive and turns out they are on vacations.\nIt is easy to change it. Just do it. I just traveled from the other side of Berlin specifically to eat here and now I'm absolutely disappointed."]

Name: Ristorante Primavera
Summary: Pizza, pasta & grilled steaks at an enduring, family-run dining room with tables in the backyard.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM
Reviews: ['Great food. Great service. And not too expensive. We could sit in the back garden away from the busy street which was perfect. But be aware, cash only no CC or EC.', "Very friendly staff and prompt service at once! It was quite crowded in and outside so we gave it a try. In general, food quality didn't meet our expectations but the staff and services were so superb. They offer huge portions", "Food was tasty and inexpensive. Service was very good. It was easy to get a table inside, although outside was quite full.\nIt's nice to be able to add a green salad to an Italian meal for a reasonable price... I'd been missing vegetables here in Berlin."]

Name: Restaurant & Biergarten Schoenbrunn
Summary: Casual venue in Volkspark Friedrichshain serving local fare & wood-fired pizza, plus weekend brunch.
Address: Friedrichshain, AM SCHWANENTEICH IN VOLKSPARK, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 3:00 – 10:30 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 10:30 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["So gorgeous, middle of East Berlin's largest, most sumptuous park - a fountain midst of a lake facing the restaurant terrace and a circular shower for the kiddies off to the left - food was top notch, and served by pretty, friendly staff - thank you!", 'We had excellent service from the start, and then our Amaretto (in the correct glass) and coffee. The seating is comfortable. The temperature is perfect today. Just brilliant. And the apple strudel was primo!', "Beautiful place to be whenever you thought of relaxation and wants to eat or drink. It has a wonderful views. It's foods are unique, drinks served up in favorite patterns. The staffs works at your satisfaction at all times. Schoenbrunn Restaurant is choice place for your family and friends."]

Name: Taleh Thai
Summary: Thai specialties & veggie options at an unpretentious setup with Asian motifs & outside tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM
Reviews:
['Finally found a decent Thai restaurant in Berlin. Ordered the red and green curries; a little watery but still delicious and flavorful. Service was great as well. Will be back soon!', 'been to taleh thai a lot and mostly everyweek, the food was really delicious and so tasty!! you can request as spicy as you wish,
the portion is good and price are affordable.

definitely will recommend to everyone..

❤️❤️❤️', "Nice, small Thai Restaurant in Prenzlauer Berg. I really really like the place, it's one of the few real Thai restaurants in Berlin. It has its own flavour and they're preparing meals that are consistently good.
I love that they use the typical veggies like small Thai eggplants.
The place has few tables, I'd recommend to make a reservation instead of trying your luck, especially if there's more than two of you. I tried several dishes here but the green curry is one of my favourites, it tastes different from all others Thai I've tried in Berlin and it's really good.
Prices are fair for the area, most main meals are within the 13~14 euros range.
In general it's a restaurant I'd surely recommend for a nice and original Thai meal in Berlin."]

Name: Bamboo’s Hut Asiatische Küche & Sushi Bar
Summary: Simple Asian & sushi snack bar with green décor serving Chinese, Thai, Vietnamese & Japanese.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
["Tastes like you are in Vietnam. The owners are couple from Saigon. They are very friendly and the food tastes very authentic. Don't expect any glamorous interior or fancy serving. Come here for the good match of quality and price. Very affordable place and 1 dish will make you full. Definitely will come back.
P.S. They don't serve sushi anymore", "Tasty food and very fair prices. The atmosphere is a bit simple and the menu doesn't offer many sushi options but I guess that's fine.", "Really good food for a really good price ! I took a Vegan dish because i've been to Asia and knew they can make really tastefull vegan dishes so i wanted to test how the quality would be here in Berlin. Well, no diisapointment at all, it was really very good and tastfull and i finest my plate to the last piece of rice ! Have to stay for work a few days here so i think i will be back !!!
And allso, very importent, the people are very friendly !!  So, if you like asian food, this is the place to be in Berlin !!!

The next day, i couldn's resist to go back and try something else and.......as good as the other day !!"]

Name: KIM999 Vegan
Summary: Laid-back veggie restaurant serving an extensive menu of Vietnamese dishes & vegan sushi.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Amazing food. Quick service. We went twice and were very happy about it. The restaurant has a nice terrace and an indoor room.\nUnfortunately the restaurant is located next to a boulevard which can be quite noisy if you are outside.', 'We are two French women who came on vacation to Berlin.  This vegan restaurant is the best restaurant we know in all of Europe!  The dishes are extraordinarily delicious.  The service is very friendly.  The place is pretty.  We will come back to Berlin only for this restaurant where we ate twice.', 'We had lunch in this place and we can say it was a very good experience! The sushi I had was very tender and the vegan duck was a-ma-zing! The curry sauce was also very good and the gyozas were super crispy! The place is comfortable and we spent very few (less than € 30 both together). I recommend it!']

Name: Papa Pane di Sorrento
Summary: Subtly lit Italian restaurant with a wood-fired pizza oven, arched windows & a dark wood ceiling.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 4:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['I recently had the pleasure of dining at Papa Pane di Sorrento that transported me straight to my beloved Italy with every bite. The experience began with a plate of incredible bruschetta. The bread was perfectly toasted, with a delightful crunch that complemented the fresh, flavorful tomatoes and fragrant basil. Each bite was a harmony of textures and tastes, reminiscent of the simplicity and elegance of true Italian cuisine.

The main course was equally enchanting. I ordered the salami pizza and a classic Margherita, both of which exceeded my expectations. The salami pizza was a masterpiece of rich, savory flavors, with the salami providing just the right amount of spice. The Margherita, however, was the star of the show. Its simple yet profound combination of fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil instantly transported me to the sun-drenched beaches of Bari. Every mouthful felt like a gentle breeze on my cheeks, a sensory journey back to Italy.

The authenticity and quality of the food at this restaurant are truly remarkable. It’s a place where each dish tells a story, inviting you to savor the essence of Italy with every bite. I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking an unforgettable Italian dining experience.', "I have ordered pizza from this restaurant for more than 5 years now. They always made great traditional crust pizza. My favourite is the Tonno DOC Pizza, unfortunately the quality of the pizza has dropped in the past year or so.

For some reason, the pizza is very heavy and wet. I am not sure what the reason is, maybe they are using a different type of tuna or maybe they didn't drain the tuna and olives properly. Pretty sure it is not condesation because I left the box open in my car immediately after colelcting it. This is already the third tonno pizza I have ordered that turned out to be too wet.

Service remains good, but because of the wet pizzas, I cannot recommend this place.", "Papa Pane di Sorrento is a pizza lover's dream. The Neapolitan pizza here is a masterpiece – impeccable dough, vibrant tomato sauce, and incredibly creamy cheese that stretches like a dream. The staff is friendly and welcoming, adding to the fantastic experience. This place is a gem for pizza enthusiasts seeking top-notch quality and a warm atmosphere."]

Name: Katz Orange
Summary: Laid-back eatery with exposed brickwork, sofas & an international menu made with seasonal produce.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Thursday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Friday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Saturday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM, Sunday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Reviews: ['Amazing food. A bit pricey for the portions. Regardless would recommend. Food felt light (ceviche to share and flank steak). Closer to fine dining.', 'Food very good, old brewery converted to restaurant.\nSitting inside gets very noisy, almost annoying when busy.\nVery helpful staff, answered all sorts of questions thrown at them.', 'Great food - great overall experience. I went with my parents who visited for the weekend and they really loved it + were super happy to with the food. Service was very attentive and welcoming. Definitely coming back! :-)']

Name: Ristorante Nuovo Firenze
Summary: Italian cuisine served in an upbeat, casual environment with a full bar & sidewalk seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
["Servers were nice when they're there, they're dressed nice, and the ambiance was pretty nice. Service itself was very slow, it's a very slow restaurant, you'll sit here for hours. Food itself was good, decent, fresh, al dente pastas and piping hot. Glass of vino were poured fairly, and their merlot was on the tart side, not full bodied. Everything was just enough flavor... so, for me, not enough. Fresh pepper and fresh grated parmesan weren't offered with pastas. If you need something that's comforting, not too much flavor, that can settle the belly, this may be the place for you if you have at least 2-3 hours to sit down. It was nice to get olives and fresh, good bread after you sit down.", 'The food was ok but not meeting the expectations of Italian kitchen. The bruschetta and mozarella tomato are quite large as appetizers but somehow need a bit more kick. The tiramisu did not have the amaretto taste. The service was very kind and good but my expectations were higher for an Italian restaurant at this location.', 'We went for lunch, so it was not so full and we had a nice service. They were really quick and always ready to serve us.
The food was really good!
It was really good Italian food, Even the tiramisu was really tasty. We had pasta and meat, both delicious.
The atmosphere is also nice, with the small lights on each tables making the table more cozy.
I really appreciated the set up of the table with a proper tablecloth, making it feeling more like home']

Name: Distrikt coffee
Summary: Trendy, industrial-chic cafe serving coffee, breakfast plates & smoothies in a plant-filled space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Tuesday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Thursday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Friday: 8:30 AM – 4:00 PM, Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:30 PM, Sunday: 9:00 AM – 4:30 PM
Reviews: ['Went here for breakfast. They have a great and delicious breakfast selection that pairs well with their excellent coffee. The batch brew was lovely, the French toast absolutely delicious and the tasting plate for their guest coffee beans was super nice!\nThey take no reservations, but are super well organized with making sure they seat people as soon as possible. :)', 'Honestly, great place for breakfast! I loved the atmosphere, very industrial style, and the coffee was amazing. We had pancakes, really, really delicious, great overall experience, perfect!', 'Great atmosphere 💫 had brunch on a Sat morning and waited 1 hour to be served unfortunately. Food was delicious 🥑']

Name: BrewDog Berlin Mitte
Summary: No-nonsense chain bar specialising in the Scottish brewery's craft beers, with regular guest brews.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['This was yet another great visit at BrewDog Mitte, we were a large group of 16 people and the staff was accommodating and patient.

The food quality is great as always, fresh out of the oven, and biers collection is outstanding.

We had a gathering for a small nonprofit community event, and everyone enjoyed their time.', 'Yes to BrewDog in Berlin! As someone who loves fresh, high-quality, and tasty beers, BrewDog in Mitte is one of the few remaining places that maintain that standard. They offer the best service with friendly staff who provide a full experience, especially Loulou and Maya, and really, all of them! The food is excellent, and enjoying some beers in a sunny spot where the sunset is magnificent adds to the experience. The interior is spacious, which I love, and they also have a great backyard.

Whether you’re with a group of friends, having a cozy chat as a couple, friends , or just chilling by yourself or with your pet, BrewDog has got you covered. The space, privacy, beer, sun, and service are all top-notch.

When I say I can compare, trust me, I mean it. In Berlin, there are a few places that try to copy the vibe, but they are far from reaching the same level. So if you’re in Berlin, don’t miss it. Thanks to the BrewDog team, you deserve this!', 'Really good sourdough bread pizzas! Large selection of beers (or non-alcoholic beverages) and very friendly service. Order at the bar when you get there and they'll bring food to your table. I'd recommend a reservation if you can get one as there can be large groups. It's also pretty kid-/pet-friendly so not a super "bar" vibe so a pretty relaxed atmosphere. Not a bad way to spend a night out!']

Name: The Rabbit Café
Summary: Charming coffee house & plant shop with a diverse menu of Asian & Western nibbles.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 9:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 7:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['Amazing food and coffee, lots of healthy and savoury options too! The vibe is really calm and it’s very pretty inside and out, and the portions are BIG! The brioche dish with extra salmon is particularly delicious.

We had a calm and tasty brunch here on a Saturday afternoon!', "Surprisingly cheap cafe given the location, with one of the best cream carrot cakes I've had! The french toast was solid for the price, and the vanilla ice cream float coffee was delicious too! Really love the green vibes here, they also sell plants.", "Recommend the french toast & egg drop!!!
Really tasty and reasonably priced!!! So we came back again before we went home.
I'll definitely come again if I visit Berlin 😋

Highly recommend"]

Name: The Tree
Summary: Szechuan rice bowls, noodle soups & small plates in a high-ceilinged space with eclectic decor.
Reviews: ['The interior design is very creative, with a touch of beauty that makes the space stand out, even if it’s not the most comfortable. The art and atmosphere make up for it. The food was decent, and the vegetarian dishes are clearly highlighted on the menu.', 'Very friendly staff, good food.\nWe ordered the noodle soup with 3 different types of tofu and the mapo tofu with noodles (calla).\nThe food was ready within minutes. They serve the noodles with fresh vegetables (radish, carrots, cucumber, arugula, tomatoes) and in some spicy chilly oil. The noodle soup was not spicy at all. You can see on the menu which dishes are spicy and which are not. The beauty tea with goji, dates and rose petals was also very special and delicious. You can sit inside and outside. Very nice atmosphere. I would definitely go out to eat there again!', 'Food was actually good but charging 2€ for extra chilli oil is a bit too much!']

Name: ASMAN
Summary: Colorful, down-to-earth restaurant offering spicy meat & veg curries, biryani & fried samosas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Nice place, food was tasty but the service could have been better. Took the food long (45 min) time to come, but when it came it was great. Would have gotten 4 stars If not for their slow services.', 'Was here this weekend for lunch, with colleagues. Ordered Veg Thali, whereas the colleagues ordered Asman special thali.

Quality and quantity wise both the Thalis were awesome. Though it took some time for the preparation, but it was worth waiting a bit for the delicious food. The veg dishes as well as non-veg items were very tasty.

Staffs were very friendly.', 'Food was good and tasty and they have lunch offers. Anyone working in this vicinity can try their mittag angebot.']

Name: Bandol sur mer
Summary: Industrial-chic haunt with an open kitchen, offering multicourse fine dining menus.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:30 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['At the start of the evening if there is space they accept walk-in diners who can order a la carte from the menu. Dishes were all delicious and creative and we enjoyed wine and bread sitting outside on a beautiful evening. My best friend was visiting and this was a lovely way to celebrate their time here.', 'All the dishes have a character of Berlin. Experimental and international mood on all the dishes but not harming the each ingredient’s own flavour.

Wine paring was okay.

My husband really liked the mood and music of the evening.

This is the most accessible and nice fine dining in Berlin. I liked it.', 'It was ok but not up to a Michelin star! The service wasn’t great the food was tasty but like ok nothing mind blowing! The atmosphere was good but I don’t think I will be going back']

Name: Cafe Ribo
Summary: Unpretentious weekdays-only outfit serving dumplings, cheese noodles & other homespun fare.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 8:00 PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["Such a pleasant surprise, in the midst of mitte. It's authentic, kind and offers great food.
I didn't expect southern German traditional food can be so tasty and comforting.

The owner is so kind and helped me translate the menu and the food was simple yet very delicious. I drank the very last sip of the soup.

I would come back again. 🥰", 'Friendly menu, uncomplicated and delicious food. The broth of the Maultaschen was perfect. It instantly became my comfort food. Will be back soon :)', 'Nice little place, the staff was very friendly and their käsespätzle was very good. I highly recommend!']

Name: Chay Viet Berlin
Summary: Vegetarian pho soups, cold rolls & Vietnamese curries in a relaxed, street-facing venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Simply amazing!! One of the best meals I’ve ever had in my life, so so delicious. The staff was also very kind even with the language barrier, which is super rare in Berlin btw. Recommend 1000%!', 'Really good Vietnamese food, variety of options. The service was wonderful as well.
We ordered their spring roll 8/10, fried dumplings 7/10 and fried noodles 6/10.', "Delicious food with a rich selection of menu items.

I tried their Vietnamese Bibimbap on a friend's recommendation and wasn't disappointed. I was surprised about the quantity though, it was pretty large.

The prices are also reasonable and the ambiance is great with ample seating."]

Name: Sasaya
Summary: Japanese restaurant with a sushi chef preparing maki, nigiris & rolls in front of onlooking diners.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Friday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 2:30 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews:
['Our experience at Sasaya was delightful overall. The sushi was exceptional, and we were impressed by the variety of good and authentic Japanese dishes offered at reasonable prices. However, we found the interior could use some improvement to enhance the dining atmosphere. Additionally, the booking process, which involved stopping by the place a week before, could be more convenient with online options. Despite these minor drawbacks, Sasaya is definitely worth a visit for its delicious Japanese cuisine.', 'I usually love everything I eat here.  But today, traditional sushi plate was just okay.  Toro was great.  The squid skewers was also just alright.
Spinach salad was good.  The buckwheat soup with shrimp tempura was nice.  The nato an interesting flavour to try. And the the fermented squid was also nice. :)

My usual is the plate for two with the chefs recommendation which is normally amazing. The gemaincha is a true delight.

Service always really sweet.  All those women are incredible.   Atmosphere also warm, simple and straightforward.

I obviously don’t have all the pictures.   But here are some.

Love this place on the whole.', 'I loved this place. Delicious food, fair prices and lovely service (so peaceful 🥰). A glass of tea is offered upon arrival. Booking is necessary as the restaurant gets crowded rapidly and is visited by many regulars. Credit card accepted.']

Name: Meena Kumari
Summary: Warm Indian restaurant & bar with modern decor, wooden flooring & a photo of the eponymous actress.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["It's one of the best indian restaurants in Berlin, I would say. They serve authentic mutton and chicken dishes with real indian Spiciness. Definitely recommended!!!!\nI ordered mutton rogan josh and garlic naan(it had lots of garlic 😍), It completely satisfied my taste buds! The staff was so polite during the service.", '*Cash Only*! A great experience! The mutton bhindi was particularly delicious, while another mild dish we got was good but unremarkable. Excellent atmosphere and good service. We were almost caught out without enough cash on hand as we didn’t realize in advance, would love for a heads-up next time.', 'Have great experience with Meena Kumari food and service is outstanding 👌 I honestly recommend it']

Name: Wohnzimmerbar
Summary: Light bites, coffee & cocktails in a stylish bar with retro armchairs & mismatched furniture.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM, Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM, Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM, Thursday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM, Friday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Saturday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM, Sunday: 4:00 PM – 2:30 AM
Reviews:
['I love hanging out at my favorite bar in Berlin! There’s always plenty of seats, so you never have to worry about finding a spot. The interior is stunning, with a mix of styles that make it feel both cozy and chic.

One of the best parts is the variety of vibes and seating options. Whether you want a quiet corner to relax or a lively spot to chat with friends, they’ve got it covered. Plus, there are lots of charging stations, which is super handy.

The music is always amazing

All in all, it’s a fantastic place to chill, chat, and enjoy great drinks. Highly recommend!', 'Vibrant bar with amazing interior, service and music. Positive atmosphere and attitude that you get infected with after stepping in. Amazing coffee and vines. Can only recommend❤️☕️🍷', 'Vibes💯. Decent espresso Martini, you could improve it by putting a little black pepper on top🍸. Drinks took a long time to get, but the staff is nice. I love the furniture inside, it truly does give this place an old school living room vibe. Outside the red light at night creates a unique atmosphere. It was super full on a weekend night when we came and I understand why.']

Name: Villa Rodizio
Summary: High-ceilinged, art nouveau venue combining churrascaria, Mexican cantina & Argentine steakhouse.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ["Enjoyable Rodizio style restaurant on the outskirts of town. They are very happy to please you. I had a tough piece of beef, which was inedible and they couldn't do enough to put it right! Basic but satisfactory salad bar, excellent service. I would happily visit again.", 'What a great experience! A ten course meat feast sounds impossible,  but the way it is done is really good. They bring the skewers of the different meats straight from the spit and carve off washer you want at the table. There is good variety,  and buffet vegetables and salad to go with it. Make sure you are hungry when you go! The service we got from Angelo was excellent. Friendly and helpful. Highly recommend', 'Great food, huge variety at the buffet. Meat has never stopped for a minute. Food was delicious, service was friendly and proficient. We had a great time!']

Name: Trattoria Felice
Summary: Truffle pasta, thin-crust pizza & stone-grilled meat & fish at a cozy venue with terrace tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ["Overpriced food. Small portion. Pasta was too salty while the vegetables for the other course were not seasoned at all. You can literally taste the 'original flavour' of the carrot and the beans. The pan fried beef, on the other hand, was overcooked and tasted like rubber.  For some unknown reasons, everything tastes a little bitter.", 'Had a beautiful dinner here with a lovely wine suggested.  The pasta was perfectly cooked, the mushrooms succulent and gorgeous!  Cozy, romantic ambience.', 'Pretty good! Both dishes we ordered were very good but not exceptional. The espresso and Tiramisu were fantastic as well. I would come again for dinner and try the pizza and pasta to get a full picture but overall it’s quite good. Prices though are a bit high for the offering. Nice vibes and good service too.']

Name: Juki
Summary: Korean BBQ with meats grilled at the table, plus rice dishes & soju in a relaxed setting.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews: ['I ordered Mandu, Samgyoebsal, Kimchi jigae, and Bibimbab. They are so good and taste the same as in Seoul! 😍 I highly recommend Sangyoebsal and Bibimbab. The staff is also very kind and high standard of hospitality. This would be my first favorite Korean restaurant in Berlin. Don’t forget to order some Soju or Makgeolli to stay in the vibe.', "Just ordered to go from here. And now what? I opened my food and smelled like it had gone. I tasted it and realized this food was gone. It may not be popular for selling but you should take care of your food quality. And they don't accept card payments under 50 euros.", 'Visited this Korean BBQ Restaurant and had an amazing experience! The staff was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting.\n\nThe meat was fresh and flavorful, and the DIY grilling at the table added to the fun. They had a great variety of sides and sauces to complement the meats. Would recommend.']

Name: Zum Schusterjungen
Summary: Homestyle German classics like pork knuckle & schnitzel, plus beer, in an old-fashioned venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['This was one of the best lunches I had in Berlin. I had the schnitzel with creamy mushroom and potatoes with bacon bits + beer on a summer afternoon in Berlin. Their terrace is great, it was so calm and chill to watch the intersection & enjoy a very yummy meal. The food was honestly simply perfect. Service was great, the server was polite, efficient and nice.

Restaurant is cash only like many others - not that big of a deal, just come prepared.', 'Genuine German kitchen, served by super-friendly staff. The authentic, traditional taste speaks for itself, while the prices are still quite reasonable. Portions are large enough for likely anyone.

Note the place is sadly cash-only. The nearest ATM charges some absurdly high commission, so you might want to visit one of those located at Sparkasse branch near Eberswalder Str. station first.', 'Nice Eckkneipe offering a delightful selection of classic, old-fashioned dishes. The ambiance is undeniably relaxed, evoking a nostalgic charm. The staff is both knowledgeable and welcoming, enhancing the overall experience. The Buletten and Schnitzel were particularly impressive. With a spacious dining room and a cozy corner for drinks and snacks, this Eckkneipe is a must-visit for anyone seeking an authentic taste of old Berlin.']

Name: Cenacolo
Summary: Cozy trattoria with exposed bricks & a busy terrace, known for classic pizzas, pastas & fish dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM, Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Reviews:
['Very good italian cuisine, we were very satisfied. Nice to try it ..', '+ pizzas were delicious. The ingredients were very fresh.
+ the waiters were very fast and friendly.
+ good price / quality ratio
- I can’t think of any negative points.', 'Just discovered this restaurant and had a wonderful evening. Delicious food, fast Service and good price. We were 4 persons, all happy. Will definitely come again ! 👍']

Name: Werkstatt der Süße
Summary: Contemporary patisserie with a striking light installation, offering colorful tartlets & pralines.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM, Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Reviews:
['After buying our birthday cake from here for the last few years, we were very excited to order our wedding dessert from Werkstatt der Süsse. They offer a tower of little cakes topped by a bigger cake to be cut together, as it is tradition. We worked with Bea, who was lovely from the start. She let us choose 4 different flavours based on our personal taste. We went for white chocolate maracuyá for the top cake, and raspberry, peach and chocolate for the little ones. The team even delivered the cakes safely to the venue.
We got a lot of compliments from our guests and really enjoyed all 4 flavours ourselves. Unbeatable!
Thank you so much Bea 🤍', 'Very high quality cake! Was not over sweet and with delicate flavor and texture. I want to try other cake too!', "Cakes are wonderful!
Very tasty indeed.
They are pricey though but totally worth the taste.
I have only picked up the cake from there and didn't dine in, so am not sure about the general atmosphere and staff.
But it generally didn't feel warm and welcoming as the cakes :)"]

Name: Restaurant Lorbeer
Summary: Elevated German food & a big array of beers at a stylish, convivial brewery with a sidewalk terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Tuesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: 12:00 – 11:00 PM
Reviews:
['Although we found the portions a bit on the smaller side, the flavour was phenomenal!
Absolutely delicious schnitzel and gnocchi.
The beetroot gnocchi was filled with a cream cheese, something I would definitely go back for.

Service is so friendly and nice, we were really happy with that too.

I would consider this one of the best veal schnitzels in berlin.', 'The food was amazing, I had the Schnitzel and it’s absolutely one of the best I‘ve tried.
The service was super friendly and they speak English too.
the restaurant was very clean, something that’s important for me.
I would absolutely recommend the place.', "Asparagus was good. The eistees were quite strong in flavour. I liked it but some might feel it's too strong. Staff was friendly and spoke English as well."]

Name: Red Dragon
Summary: Unassuming eatery offering Chinese, Thai & Vietnamese classics, with a vegan menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Thursday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Friday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM, Saturday: 3:30 – 10:00 PM, Sunday: 11:30 AM – 10:00 PM
Reviews: ['Very not tasty pho I’ve evert tried. I came in just because it’s nearby and I was too tired to walk further, but i guess I wouldn’t come back again cause the food is….the meat is so hard to chew and in overall, it’s…..anyway, gotta go. Peace. ✌️', 'A friendly place with great food, I would particularly recommend the flavourful green curries!', 'The price is relatively reasonable and the food is worthy to eat as lunch or dinner.']

Name: La Buvette - Grill Français
Summary: Mussels, beef tartare & entrecôte steak, plus French wines, at a cozy, understated brasserie.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Wednesday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Thursday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Friday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Saturday: 6:00 – 11:00 PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Went there today and was really happy about the spontaneous decision. The food was tasty and a proper portion, the service was friendly and professional. It is not cheap but adequate to the quality. Definitely looking forward to going there again.', 'Our second visit. This time we brought along sone friends who loved it, too! The menu is not very extensive but the food is very good! The vine card also holds something for everyones taste. We will be back!', 'Always a great night at La Buvette. The French staples are well interpreted, the wine list is good value and the the staff are unfailing in their desire to provide you with a great experience. Will always be back!']

Name: Burgerie
Summary: Casual stop for artisan burgers cooked on a lava stone grill, with an array of toppings, plus fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Tuesday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Thursday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Friday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Saturday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM, Sunday: 1:00 – 9:30 PM
Reviews: ['Burgerie offers burgers for everyone. Whether you’re a meat eater, vegetarian, vegan or want to enjoy a gluten-free burger: they know how to satisfy their guests and their hunger for a good burger. I enjoyed the gluten-free Rabby burger, made from kohlrabi. It was tasteful, delicious but also nutritious. You can sit outside or indoors, depending on how you handle the street vibe/sounds. Big recommend to go here!', 'Burgerie is one of the best burgers in Berlin, particularly due to the flame grilled burgers. They also are a wonderful place to meet for friends with different diets, to include gluten free, vegetarian, etc. Highly recommend!', 'The go-to place for celiacs looking for a gluten free burger. Indoor sitting is quite limited, thus I would recommend reserving a table in advance. Has the "family-business" atmosphere. Would recommend the fried sweet potatoes on the side.']
